review:
As a decent and polite and normal person, my tinder profile is definitely normal but my account gets banned for no reason one day. While on the opposite side, those people profile contain Inappropriate languages or images stays safe. And the tinder group is so arrogant that they don‚Äôt even offer a way to correct this!!!!!!!!!!! I had a tinder gold membership and suddenly they told me that I was banned because I violated their terms of use or a community guidelines. This is absolutely ridiculous.
And as far as I know there are lots of people who are in the same situation. 
So tinder if you really cares about your community environment, banning users without even checking manually is definitely not the way out. 
I mean I can understand that sometimes machine will not produce accurate results when it comes to monitoring user behaviors, but offering a formal appeals process is absolutely some of the amendments you can make! 
I try to connect with tinder‚Äôs support team, but the answer I get is no difference with the website support. And when I am asking for more help the customer service just gets disappeared.
title: the surveillance mechanism is absolutely useless

review: I loved using tinder it was my go to dating app whenever I was looking to meet new people but I logged in one day and found that my account was banned? All appropriate pictures, no hate speech whatsoever, everything was peachy clean yet here I am with a banned account. Of course you can‚Äôt call because that would be way too easy so when I reached out to support to AT LEAST see why I got banned they wouldn‚Äôt tell me and told me that once you‚Äôre banned you‚Äôre pretty much banned for life. So here I am banned for no reason at all and can‚Äôt even learn what it was that triggered my banning in the first place. I‚Äôm all for the safety of others and making sure nobody is offended but how do you expect people to want to use an app and spread good things about it when there is absolutely no communication between owner and operator. Establish a real point of contact. Give people answers. I‚Äôve seen that I‚Äôm not the only one who‚Äôs had this happen and quite frankly that‚Äôs ridiculous. Do better tinder. You‚Äôre losing out on people who thoroughly enjoyed the app over nothing. Truthfully I don‚Äôt even want to drop one start but I can‚Äôt post without doing so.

The app is fairly decent  for the non-subscription package. Make an interesting profile about yourself. See people in different interest fields and can actually find people within a certain ‚Äúdistance preferences‚Äù that you‚Äôve set. 

But the app became buggy and and kept making me do reCAPTCHAs every other day to verify I wasn‚Äôt a robot. I do those successfully and go on about my day. But on 10:00 a.m. on Sunday May 21 I went on the app just to get the window that says my account has been banned from tinder for ‚Äúviolating terms of service‚Äù. The window itself is very vague in its statement and never specifies anything. So I go Tinder customer services to check my account and help me find out how I ‚Äúviolated‚Äù their terms of service. Around 3:00 p.m. the same day I got an email in return stating ‚Äú‚Ä¶We take violations of our policies seriously. Your account will remained banned from tinder, and you will not be able to create a new tinder profile using your Facebook and/or phone number‚Äù. Still no concrete reasoning as to how anything was violated and they move on with their day.
title: Wrongful terminations

review: Recently opened my account back up and decided to give it another try. Was going well for a couple days, until one day I went to open the app and it said I had been banned. I know for a fact I had not violated any guidelines or offended anyone, as I have not even had a full conversation with others via the app yet. After emailing them asking for assistance and asking what may have happened I was just told I couldn‚Äôt get any additional information at this time, and the email itself was scathing to boot. They just keep sending me links to the terms and services/ community guidelines instead of giving any kind of answer or guidance. I feel very mistreated; I would never do anything to make anyone feel upset or angry, and I know I have not done anything. Now I cannot get my account back, nor can I ever make one again in the future. It is making me feel like some sort of criminal when I truly have not done anything. I have had my account for awhile, and have used it off an on, and nothing like this ever happened prior. Just very confused and honestly extremely disappointed
title: Bans you for life for no reason

review:
Personally, I am very disappointed with Tinder.
I‚Äôve been using the app on and off for about a year when I‚Äôve been in and out of relationships, and I really enjoyed my experience. I met loads of awesome people on the app and while very few ever turned into anything in person, it was a nice distraction. A couple days ago, I opened the app to discover I was banned. Now, this came as a surprise to me, because I had done nothing wrong to be banned from the app. No explanation was provided in the app, and when I reached out to support, no explanation was provided because they ‚Äúdon‚Äôt provide explanations for why bans are issued and don‚Äôt offer appeals.‚Äù Yikes. This feels very targeted and personally I am very disappointed and disgusted with the way Tinder handles their banning process. At the very least - I deserve to know what rule I supposedly violated that led me to be banned from the app. To provide no explanation at all is just another example of Tinder having absolutely no regard for the safety of its users or caring about its users at all. Sincerely, and I mean GENUINELY disappointed in Tinder. Tinder - do better. You are taking advantage of your users and people are noticing.
-J.
title: Yikes.

review: Well, I am in a foreign country for awhile, and I was hoping to use the app just to meet people here. I had also wanted to reset and have a fresh start on my swipes, and I clearly selected that as the reason when I deleted my old account. However, when I made a new account and even put in the effort to get verified, I got banned two days later. I then took the time to reach out to staff only to get the response that they take their guidelines very seriously, and I would remain banned without even any explanation as to why. I had not interacted with anyone yet, and my profile was very tame compared to others I had seen, so I was incredibly confused and irritated. I understand the importance of safety in social apps like this, but if they Intend to have a permanent ban system, they should at least be willing to provide specific reasoning. There is a fine line between keeping the community safe and just plain being lazy when it comes to customer service, and this app crossed it. It appears I am not the only person this has happened to either ‚Äî I just feel extra bad for the people who put money into it.
title: Banned Without Context

review: I have had tinder on and off since I was 18. I have met some wonderful people and current ex boyfriends of mine via tinder. This was a wonderful app to get to know people and see new interesting people out there. But, as time as went on, all men on there just want hookups, when I decline them of sexual favors, they must of report me, always. Because now I‚Äôm banned for absolutely no reasoning behind why. I never once talked in a sexual manner to any male on there, if anything that kind of conversation happend on another social media platform. I‚Äôve read so many reviews of people getting banned for no reason. This is absolutely insane and ridiculous how you can just get rid of users left and right without any explanation behind it. All my ex boyfriends are from tinder, I use to use it every day when I was single. Why ban me for something I have not done. Prices on tinder gold and etc, are outrageous. I can‚Äôt stand dating apps anymore. Please tinder, if you are going to band 75% of your users, give us reasoning behind why. i‚Äôm now 22 and wanting to explore the dating world but yet being banned for no reason has become the issue.
title: Banned for no reason

review:
I‚Äôm not going to list the myriad reasons why tinder is a sub par service, just the app itself.
The app is built to constantly market boost and super like purchases to customers and it‚Äôs incredibly annoying. Almost every other time you tap through someones profile you get a large pop up prompt asking you to super like them, which always blocks out location information. Same with liking popular users. In my opinion, a premium paying user shouldn‚Äôt be constantly inundated with pop ups trying to siphon more money out of them.
There‚Äôs also issues with matching/chat functionality. Likes and messages are regularly dropped, which leads to situations where you think somebody is ignoring you but they just never even got your message. I‚Äôve had a couple chats just get deleted wholesale as well.
For the amount of money this app takes in, it should be much more polished and reliable.
That being said I‚Äôve gotten a couple decent hookups over the past month so I can‚Äôt completely hate it. Just be ready to deal with some frustrating bugs if you‚Äôre going to jump in
title: Too buggy for all the money they take in

review: I got a new phone and downloaded tinder, then it took me about 15 minutes to find photos to use. By the time I uploaded them and started the rest of my bio, I got a notification saying my account was under review which would only take a couple minutes. Well it took like 12+ hours, then I got a notification that I had been permanently banned. I was, and still am, insanely confused because there‚Äôs no way I could‚Äôve violated any terms and conditions or community guidelines since I hadn‚Äôt swiped or messaged anyone, I had barely begun to set up my profile. I emailed to see what had happened, but they sent back a generic response saying that they couldn‚Äôt give me any more details and there is no appeal process. I followed up and their customer service is unhelpful, slow to respond, and basically at this point I‚Äôm just giving up. There are enough options for dating sites that I‚Äôll gladly choose another one that values it‚Äôs users and takes issues seriously. If I could give zero stars I would. Really disappointing, especially since I‚Äôve had the app before and had a good experience.
title: Frustrating and disappointing

review: Overall this app is pretty decent it definitely has more people in match with than others but I was recently banned probably because I had two separate accounts (was unaware this was against TOS) one account was for my business of selling rugs and the other was my personal account. My business account was banned a couple days ago and I was confused as to why until I read the TOS then I made sense and I completely understood why it had happened. But then today I noticed my personal account was banned and it kinda makes sense as well so I tried reaching out to customer service and they stated there is no appeal process for banned accounts which is unfortunate especially as I am a tinder platinum member and paying $30. There should be some sort of appeal process for stuff like this because I never said anything offensive or hurtful to anyone on tinder I just had two accounts which again I was unaware of as most people do not read the TOS or community guidelines. It‚Äôs really unfortunate that I am no longer able to use this app anymore over something so insignificant as my case but it is what it is.
title: Overall pretty decent

review:
Update: just got the new version with ‚ÄúHot Takes‚Äù (a live chat game) and.....it doesn‚Äôt let me respond. No keyboard comes up when it‚Äôs my turn. So I just left a couple young women hanging and looked really rude. All because you can‚Äôt get CHAT to work. CHAT. It‚Äôs just unbelievable how bad this app is at the basics
**
Turns out MY MATCHES WERE RESPONDING BUT THE APP DIDNT PASS ALONG THE MESSAGES. Sometimes it shows, sometimes it doesn‚Äôt. I have no f‚Äî‚Äîing idea why. Then matches disappear and reappear. Then later, months after the matches respond, I finally see their response. I can‚Äôt believe how bad, buggy, and frustrating this poorly coded app operates. How many people‚Äôs self esteems were damaged because Tinder couldn‚Äôt be bothered to pass on the messages that were sent? So many people probably felt ghosted and disrespected not because of anything their counterpart did, but because this company can‚Äôt seem to figure out CHAT. Aka INSTANT MESSAGING. You know, the thing that‚Äôs been solved since the early 1990‚Äôs? (And all of this is generously assuming your bad messaging system isn‚Äôt some sort of sick, sad gamification feature to get us addicted...) Shameful. Absolutely shameful.
title: Messaging is BROKEN

review: The average woman gets unlimited likes which leads them into having unbearably high standards and unless you‚Äôre a highly attractive man or Shakespeare, you will always be chasing and getting played. I matched with a girl who was decently attractive who had 10k plus likes. Most ive had is 83 and i would say im slightly above average with a good profile. The ratio of men to women is ridiculous, if you‚Äôre an average man you will have very little if any success. Some women will pay to pick and choose from their crop of likes and to boost. Men will pay thinking they‚Äôll stand out or if they‚Äôre highly attractive, to also see their crop of likes. Both cases are pointless and at $50 A MONTH for the actual good services, you could spend that money on far better things. Stop giving these companies money at these ridiculous prices, especially if you live in a rural area. The flip side is that if they charge less, more people will buy thus making the services less credible. Right now the game is rigged for men, and too stimulating/unrealistic for women, bottom line.
title: Dont waste your money anyone

review: I canceled my subscription Forever ago but You took it upon yourselves to still charge me 25$ through my PayPal account using my card information. This is unacceptable and quite frankly i was unaware about the transaction considering after i ORIGINALLY CANCELLED i deleted both Tinder and My PayPal app. So you mean to tell me i couldn't afford my phone bill since then because of this? Unsure if i qualify but I'd appreciate a if not full refund at the least a partial refund. This was a low ball move and I'll NEVER USE this app again nor will I suggest it. So not only did you rip me off during all that time due to your lame restrictions and rules? I then got ROBBED from under my nose? I have a screenshot of the transaction and the Date it was processed. Considering it was just a 7 months ago? And i was unaware of the transaction i feel I'm owed a reimbursement of sorts. Please contact me here or even my Email address. I'll be waiting to hear from you. Considering where my life has been going down the drain? And i could of at least had my phone paid For the month of April and May ? Again UNACCEPTABLE TINDER DATING APP
title: It was lame while it lasted but You robbed me Tinder

review:
Tinder is in an odd position as a business: it‚Äôs only profitable when it‚Äôs not achieving what it claims to achieve. People in happy relationships do not spend $60 a month on ‚Äútinder platinum.‚Äù The developers have to have just enough features to give you hope,  while trying to keep you single long enough to milk you for all they can. Keep this in mind while using tinder: you are actively fighting against the app itself. 

When tinder first came out, most of its features were free. Unlimited likes, a free super like a day. Now it seems that every time I redownload it, they‚Äôre stripped more free features in order to resell them to you at exorbitant prices. Now you get absolutely nothing for free except a handful of regular likes  
 
All in all, as long as you‚Äôre aware of the ways the app is scheming to take your money, you can certainly pick a worse dating app. Tinder boasts a large userbase, sleek display, and some fun ways to customize your profile. Learn how to game its systems to your own advantage and you‚Äôll probably have some success here.
title: Lower features, higher prices

review:
I just renewed my annual subscription recently. The price is way too high for the value provided now. Previously, Tinder Gold allotted 5 Super Likes a day‚Ä¶now it‚Äôs just 5 a week. To buy more super likes is now SIGNIFICANTLY more expensive. I might be able to overlook that by citing current economic turmoil‚Ä¶but here‚Äôs the reality: Tinder should be paying ME for the amount of work I do reporting fake and scammer profiles. I‚Äôd say a good 85% of all female profiles are fake or scam. They use the same tricks every time and it wouldn‚Äôt be hard for Tinder to police this. I have an MBA in Data Analytics and I know the capabilities exist to identify and delete fake/scam profiles‚Ä¶however the platform wants it to seem like they have more users, so they do nothing. Drop the prices, control who uses your platform, and give back the benefits you took away. If you don‚Äôt do this, the app will die. There are 100 other dating apps ready to take your market share and you‚Äôve just handed it over on a silver platter. You will never see another dollar from me.

UPDATE: Now about 95% of profiles are fake, scam, or promoting social media. This app is no longer viable.
title: Value is no longer here

review:
If tinder was good at finding you matches, it would literally lose its customer base. Tinder is not in the business of match making, in fact quite the opposite, it‚Äôs in the business of making you feel desperate enough to spend money on the app. It is designed with planned obsolescence.  

Statistically, men out number women 10 to 1 on tinder. Men average a 0.7% match rate - meaning for every 1000 right swipes, you‚Äôll get 7 matches. That‚Äôs a horrendous rate, especially when you consider half of those matches won‚Äôt respond, and the other half will be weird/mean/hurt people. You might get 1 good conversation every thousand women you look at. I can easily do better than that going into literally any social environment, this app is terrible. Not to mention it normalizes superficial values and objectification of men and women. Plus it is literally the laziest way possible to approach dating.  Oh is talking to other humans too difficult? Let‚Äôs all just cower at home and swipe right banking our life partners off of tinders algorithm. No thanks. 

We can do better as a society.  Go out and talk to a human like a normal person.
title: You‚Äôre better off socializing in person

review: OK so I loved Tinder. It was my number one dating website then I had gotten tinder plus and that‚Äôs when everything went downhill. I wasn‚Äôt getting as many matches then my account somehow it violated community guidelines and it was under review, and I had got a hold of Tinder help and they gave me back my account because I had not violated any terms and conditions, but then I could not match with any of the matches that I could, was not getting any new likes And any of the messages that I was sending seemed like no new messages were coming through like I was shadow banned or something and when I complained about it to Tinder, they told me I had to be verified and before all this I was already verified so then I got reverified and had the blue checkmark and still didn‚Äôt fix it so then about after two days of still seeing if he could work or not and it not working, I don‚Äôt want tonight and I have been banned and I have not changed anything from where they have viewed my account. I had been dealing with this issue for about a month and trying to get tinder to fix it and I guess their fixing it was banning me.
title: Scammers and useless

review: I had no problems with Tinder for the amount of time I‚Äôve had it downloaded (which has been about a year, maybe two), until recently. I‚Äôve never done anything inappropriate, never said anything inappropriate, my pictures were not inappropriate. Nothing I‚Äôve done in the last two-ish years has warranted a warning, let alone a ban. However, as soon as I decided to purchase Tinder Gold on January 15th, I was banned from the app about three days later. I did absolutely nothing to get banned, I barely even talked to anyone in that timespan, but the conversations I DID have were just pleasantries and small talk. Nothing warranting a ban. I tried to look for something that would let me contact Tinder, but there was nothing. What kind of app doesn‚Äôt offer some sort of customer service for things like this? And the ‚Äúno appeals‚Äù thing makes NO sense. People who do nothing wrong and spend money on this app end up getting banned for no reason, and there‚Äôs no way for them to contact someone to try and fix it? No thank you. Add appeals and actual customer service OUTSIDE of the app so you stop stealing money from people!!!
title: Banned for no reason. No customer service.

review: Tinder, OkCupid, and Hinge are all part of the Match Group so if you‚Äôre banned from one you‚Äôre banned from the rest. I woke up one morning to find I was banned on Hinge when I had been pretty inactive there for a month due to the holidays. When I contacted support to appeal, they said the ban originated from another Match Group service. How this is possible I do not know as I had not used OkCupid in over a year and Tinder for several months, with accounts deactivated by myself on both. OkCupid has been wholly unresponsive and Tinder support kept reiterating they will not do anything. Neither will let me know if and how the ban originated from either of them. They claim to take violations ‚Äúvery seriously‚Äù but clearly do not reciprocate when a user is concerned that they have been misrepresented with no activity to be held accountable for. I will take this as a blessing in disguise based on my experiences over the years (notice, I went years using these on and off without issue). I do know people who met partners and spouses from off these apps but I was never personally optimistic. Now I‚Äôll never have to worry about it again.
title: Lack of care for users

review: Tinder seems like a good concept, but after using the app I‚Äôve noticed a lot of fake profiles and or a lot of age discrepancies. I even hung out with a guy who stated he was 22 on the app then come to find out he was actually 19. While tinder seems to go to great lengths to get accurate information and a lot of verifying it‚Äôs also kind of annoying I have to give out all that information not knowing if tinder will sell it... I also think there‚Äôs an issue with banning. The lacking of an appeals process and relying on user complaints or the algorithm to ban people is pure laziness on the tinder team. People get wrongfully banned or banned without knowing why and it‚Äôs ridiculous. There‚Äôs a lacking of customer service and usually when you want to complain or contact the company you are just redirected over and over again to already posted information On the site. Then when you do finally submit an issue they‚Äôll send you an email with regurgitated information. Truly this app is a for profit business now constantly pushing for you to upgrade to tinder gold or buy super likes and doesn‚Äôt seem to care about anything other than that.
title: Go somewhere else

review:
Previously when I was able to actually log on to the app, there were no issues. The regular tinder free version is a fairly decent experience, and so are the other tiers(tried gold for a month and was very pleased with how easy it was to find potential matches), but one day I opened the app and it forced me to re-verify my face to I guess match my photos I already had on the app. Keep in mind I had already been verified when I first uploaded my photos weeks before. However, once submitted, I got a notification that said ‚Äúyou have been banned from tinder‚Äù. And of course my reaction was ‚Äúfor what!?..‚Äù so I emailed the support email I found and got a basic answer stating that I had been banned because I violated the terms of service and their decision was final. WHICH term of service did I violate? We will never know to this day‚Ä¶ 
Thanks tinder for denying another loyal customer their chance to make you guys money. Because my case isn‚Äôt the first I‚Äôve heard of people being banned for baseless reasons, and I‚Äôm afraid this will continue to happen to unfortunate people for the foreseeable future.
title: This app will ban you for being YOU‚Ä¶

review: After having a Tinder account for many many months I was suddenly and without warning banned. They did not even put my account under review first. I emailed ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äú asking for more information and repeatedly got the same response about reading the terms of use and community guidelines. That‚Äôs all well and good IF you actually know what you did wrong!  Up until that point I had been enjoying the app more than Facebook, Bumble, and Hinge. I am a 52-year-old single woman who is law-abiding and a rule follower my entire life so it baffles me when I‚Äôm banned from a dating app for absolutely no reason. It occurred to me that maybe my account was hacked thereby creating some type of issue that would have warranted the ban. So I also contacted ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äú about that and gotten zero response. it‚Äôs ridiculous to ban someone without giving them the opportunity to make corrections first. They need to be ashamed of themselves for running a business this way when I‚Äôm sure this is happening to many other women out there who are having to resort to dating apps in an attempt to find men to date.

review:
Tinder is absolutely ridiculous when it comes to the way it treats trans women. I have now been banned three times for no reason at all. It was forgiven the first time because I assume someone noticed I didn‚Äôt do anything. But they have never given me any reason as to why i‚Äôve been banned and when I try to reach out to customer service by submitting a request they slap a fake name on the email and send me the exact same copy and paste message that says ‚Äúyou‚Äôve been banned‚Ä¶‚Äù yes but why? i use multiple other dating sites such as bumble, hinge, and taimi yet i have NEVER been banned from tbere and I do the same thing. 

THE PROBLEM IS: straight men are upset that a trans woman comes up on their profiles to swipe. they report me so it blocks me from coming up again and after enough do that i‚Äôm banned for no reason. i do not post inappropriate pictures, i don‚Äôt participate in illegal activity, i don‚Äôt even treat the men who harass me about being trans that bad. i can‚Äôt go out and meet people at bars because it‚Äôs literally unsafe and now i‚Äôm banned from one of the only ways i can meet people. DO BETTER TINDER DONT BE TRANSPHOBIC
title: Trans women DONT WASTE YOUR TIME

review:
I seriously have no clue what I was banned for. There was no reason for me to have been kicked off this app. It‚Äôs absurd. A system that will remove you without any reason being given and no appeals process‚Ä¶.it‚Äôs immoral. NO SYSTEM should be run that way. Can we start a conspiracy theory for what the basis is for these out of nowhere bans? Is there a common thread line for everyone that has been unjustly and arbitrarily removed? I‚Äôm a conservative, is that it? Do the leftist freaks who monitor private conversations at Tinder get their rocks off by banning people who think differently? Just a thought. Anyway, outside of my conspiracy theory, I‚Äôve heard that you can be banned for just getting reported three times over the entire course of use. Well, I‚Äôve had a couple of heated political discussions and my guess is that some fragile women reported me because they didn‚Äôt like my opinions. My journey may be done with Tinder but I get the last jab in‚Ä¶.here is your one star Tinder; you deserve it. 
PS: I found the girl of my dreams right before I was banned. So, Tinder actually can help you find someone special if that‚Äôs actually what you want.
title: Tinder Conspiracy Theory

review:
The frequency and quality of my matches are abysmal. I‚Äôve had decent success with other apps so I‚Äôm pretty convinced at this point that my issue is not my profile but rather tinder itself. On bumble I usually have half a dozen or more matches every day, whereas with tinder I get maybe (?) one a day? I think I probably swipe left on 75% or more of the people that pop in to my feed which indicates to me the algorithm is terrible at determining my type or it‚Äôs just deliberately flooding my feed with low quality profiles to get me to pay for premium. Which I refuse to do bc the free version is terrible. 

In addition to the low quality of profiles, I also set my preferences to strictly 10 miles or closer. This shouldn‚Äôt be an issue because I live in one of the largest cities in the country. Yet somehow I continue to see people who are dozens of miles away. And also international people?? Why would I want to see them on my feed?? 

Awful service, will likely delete my profile soon. Had the free version been better I would‚Äôve paid for premium (which I do with hinge bc it‚Äôs a high quality service).
title: Worst dating / hookup app

review: I was a tinder gold member for months upon months. I never really talked to anyone because I was too nervous to do so and I had recently gotten out of a relationship that was 4 1/2 years long so I was still healing. I was just on the app to try to make friends and try to ease myself back into the dating scene. When I finally decided that I was okay and ready to start talking to people, just trying to hang out, tinder banned me. I sent three messages to three different people before I went to bed, and I discovered that I had been banned upon waking up. The three messages in question were ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs your favorite thrift‚Äù because they mentioned it was a hobby of theirs, ‚Äúwhich doughnut place is better? (Listed two local places)‚Äù because their profile mentioned doughnuts, and lastly ‚Äúhey I think know you form somewhere‚Äù to a mutual friend. I have tried to appeal this with Tinder but their support is very condescending and mean. They will not give you a definitive answer of why you were banned, just that you violated community guidelines. Hang me now if asking about someone‚Äôs favorite doughnut place is a crime.
title: They Don‚Äôt Care About You

review: It‚Äôs been having a lot of issues lately. I‚Äôve had to contact support multiple times to fix issues . This last time I emailed them they claimed they couldn‚Äôt help me fix the bug because I wasn‚Äôt using the email I signed up with when it was I send a pic proving it was they send a email response saying they will delete my profile for me. I DIDN‚ÄôT ASK YOU TO DO THAT!!!! I had to re make another profile !!!!! I then use tinder for what it‚Äôs intended for ya know SWIPING to meet people and because I swipe on ‚Äúto many people ‚Äú I‚Äôm not real and i need my profile locked so they can verify me didn‚Äôt even have the new profile for more then 8 hours ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶there is plenty of men on there who don‚Äôt need to be verified and we all know men harass women and have sus behavior all the time but that‚Äôs okay right ? They can make sexual comments about my body and harass me when I don‚Äôt respond but they can have profiles and don‚Äôt need to be locked out 27/7 . I don‚Äôt do anything wrong on tinder that makes me have ‚Äúsuspicious behavior ‚Äú And they constantly are locking me out and making me verify who I am. Kind of over it .
title: Tinder what‚Äôs the problem?

review: In my first few days I got 20+ likes, the following few days I got no responses or anyone liking my profile. If you send too many messages too quickly or use any sort of language that could be considered ‚Äúinappropriate‚Äù, no matter the context, you will be shadowbanned and will no longer receive messages and your profile will be hidden from the pile. I don‚Äôt know how it‚Äôs legal to do that seeing as how some people pay for a premium experience and STILL get shadowbanned, essentially scamming you. I made another profile, didn‚Äôt message more than one girl a day and didn‚Äôt use any language that would be considered by tinder, inappropriate, and I have consistently been getting matches and likes. They don‚Äôt tell you about these rules but they exist and will happily take your money. The ‚Äúsupport‚Äù team is all bots too so don‚Äôt waste your time with it. Request refunds through Apple and manipulate the app so that it works for you properly. Don‚Äôt use the same pictures or same email/number because that again will get you flagged, leading to being shadowbanned from the jump.
title: Beware of Being Shadowbanned

review: I had been a user off and on for years. Never had an issue before and always was courtesy and kind to people on there. One day I woke up and got the ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve been banned‚Äù message. Be aware - if they ban you on Tinder, they ban you on all platforms that they own (OKCupid, POF, Hinge, Etc.). I tried to appeal asking for clarity and all they said was that I ‚Äúviolated their terms and agreement‚Äù without any further explanation as to what actually happened. They wouldn‚Äôt refund my purchase either. I would say just stop using dating apps if yo want to find a meaningful relationship or just avoid all apps associated with Tinder. They are a business so they do whatever they can to make money. And why would they want you to not be single? If you were single they wouldn‚Äôt be around and making money. Their algorithm is setting people up for disaster and is trying to keep you single as long as possible. Get off the apps people, get off your photos and actually look up in the world! You may lock eyes or bump into the love of your life if you just stare away from the screen for a few moments.
title: The ban for life for no reason

review:
I‚Äôve had tinder for a few years now. I‚Äôd go through periods of use and nonuse every few months. I‚Äôm a college student and sometimes it‚Äôs just an easy way to meet people. Was going through some down time when I opened up the app to find I had been band. No reason given even when I contacted tinder support. I‚Äôm not a very social person. Most of the time I never contacted matches and would just delete them. The response from tinder was that I had violated community guidelines. They gave no further info and refused to have an appeal process. If you can‚Äôt have an appeal process then you shouldn‚Äôt have a social media app. Seriously, use some logic. If I‚Äôm never really on the app and rarely change anything then why would I be banned? I guess we‚Äôll never know. Don‚Äôt waste your time with this app.

UPDATE: tinder still refuses to give reason and has now violated their own terms of service in the entire process. It‚Äôs all automated so their ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äù is non existent. They still don‚Äôt have an appeal process and refuse to revise their system. Just thought I‚Äôd let you all know.
title: Banned without reason

review:
I‚Äôm not easily physically attracted to people. It is very rare that I see someone I think is ‚Äúhot‚Äù so in turn, I swipe left a lot. Unfortunately, tinder constantly disables my account for this under ‚Äúbot activity‚Äù. It‚Äôs the frequency that is ridiculous. Every 3-6 hours it will want me to verify myself with photos. Shouldn‚Äôt once be enough? Then after providing correct answers to match images & uploading my own pictures to match the gestures, tinder locks my account for 10+ hours (they say it will ‚Äúonly take a few minutes‚Äù). 
I‚Äôve had tinder for less than 48 hours and it‚Äôs disabled my account 3 times‚Ä¶. I shouldn‚Äôt be punished for swiping left on people I am not attracted to. I live in a dingy city so the options are slim. 
Continuing to frequently disable my account AFTER I have sent photos proving I am human is ridiculous and obnoxious. Again, I‚Äôve had the account for LESS than 48 hours and tinder has  disabled my account 3 times so far. Accept proof of humanity via photos once and then move on jfc.
title: The excessive account disabling for left swipes ruins it

review: I am a trans woman in a not so accepting state so meeting people who would be secure enough in their masculinity to be with a trans woman outside of the apps can be challenging, that‚Äôs why I loved tinder; it was a way for me to convey the fact that I am trans in a way that wouldn‚Äôt put my well being at risk and allowed me to connect with guys who weren‚Äôt intimidated or ashamed to be with me I met all of my partners on tinder, that‚Äôs not to say I didn‚Äôt experience incredible transphobia and homophobia, so imagine my shock when I was banned from tinder with no rhyme or reason so I quickly contact tinder‚Äôs customer service email and sent this ‚ÄúI‚Äôve run into a lot of transphobia on the app and am disturbed to see that tinder would take the side of my oppressors I‚Äôm simply looking to find a partner and that is hard to find in the real world being trans‚Äù and they simply replied with we don‚Äôt do ban appeals. I know it sounds dumb but this situation has thrown me back into the depression cycle that I was in pre-transition I simply want love and I think that I‚Äôm deserving of it and have given a good amount of money to tinder to achieve my goal.
title: Tinder favors transphobes

review: I haven‚Äôt logged into my account or been active for a couple of days now and haven‚Äôt held a conversation with anyone in those couple of days, most of my matches haven‚Äôt responded back to me. So I‚Äôm not 100% sure as to why my account has been banned. Me not responding back to my matches is not my fault and shouldn‚Äôt be a reason that my account gets banned. My bio is safe and my pictures and boomerangs are all safe. I‚Äôve had the same tinder profile for over three years now and have NEVER violated any of the terms and conditions. My account is even verified. So if I do not get my profile back I will just get my money refunded because obviously tinder will just ban an account without hearing the other person‚Äôs side. I‚Äôve had many men on this website be rude and vulgar and yet the only thing that I do unmatch with them. Why do men get to just make a decision if a woman gets banned from a dating app or not. I would also LOVE to know what terms and conditions I violated! Also you do not talk with a real person, you talk to a robot that responds back to you when you send in your emails.
title: TINDER DOESNT CARE ABOUT WOMEN ü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü§£

review: I had an account since 2015 used the app in and out between the years during relationships. In 2022 saw they had an option for profile verification. Regardless of me having all credentials to prove it‚Äôs me while also not messaging or actively using the app I decided after a month of being Mia I wanted to match with someone but decided to get that blue check mark they provide. I did what the app said and 45 minutes later I was banned for no reason. As I request an appeal an automated message has popped up to tell me it‚Äôs permanent and I went against the terms and conditions. I decided to message back again to ask to verify what I did which led to another automated message saying they cannot give details on what I did. If I wasn‚Äôt active for a month and the first thing I did was try to get that blue check mark and my account wasn‚Äôt under review WOULDNT there be some type of explanation tinder customer service could provide. Regardless if the account won‚Äôt be unbanned give the exact reasoning for it since the ban links to your social accounts and phone number anyways.
title: Terrible customer service

review: All about the money. Overpriced. Can‚Äôt see who‚Äôs swiped you unless you pay (overpriced). Won‚Äôt be able to be seen by those you‚Äôve swiped unless you pay (overpriced). Gotta swipe for years and years just to see someone you may be compatible with‚Äîand if you accidentally swipe left and want to go back, once again, you‚Äôve got to pay (and yes you guessed it, it‚Äôs overpriced !) Even if there‚Äôs tons of people who‚Äôs swiped you, you‚Äôll only see tons of people who haven‚Äôt just~ to waste your time and keep you on the app. They even added some stupid, completely irrelevant interactive game with beautiful actors portraying your ‚Äúfriends‚Äù so you can feel less like loser, I‚Äôm guessing? (It‚Äôs an ironic game) It‚Äôs gorgeously shot but instead of using all of your money to make a better app, they spend it on stupid things like that to keep you on the app and not deliver on what they claim to be in business for: dates. Sigh, the ugly consequences of greed. I‚Äôm not a bad looking female, so it theoretically shouldn‚Äôt be extremely hard for me. But Tinder is dystopian in how terrible it is. Don‚Äôt waste your time, please.
title: Trash fire of an app

review:
TL;DR unsupportive support

Like many others, I had gotten banned briefly with no notification. I paid for a 1 year gold membership, so some courtesy was expected, silly me. When I reached out to support, I received a canned response, and then a response from a person who said that the email address I was writing from wasn't associated with an account, so they couldn't help me. The email address that I 1) used to sign up 2) used to verify my account 3) have listed on the app and 4) which it automatically used/linked when contacting support. After probably 24 hours, my account was back up and only one profile was missing. I assume that guy reported me for...not responding to "hey" when I was at work? We'll never know because their support is unsupportive. 

Also, I have all notifications turned off except "new messages." At least twice daily, I get a "peak swipe time" notification. Really gotdamn annoying to have to open the app to clear out the notification from the icon twice a day. Will not be renewing.
title: So much room for improvement

review:
As other reviews have said Tinder scamming customers and banning accounts randomly. I reactivated my tinder account after a long absence, and they offered me a half-price deal on a membership so I figured I‚Äôd try it for a month and 2 days later my account was banned. All I did was setup my profile and get my photos verified, but I hadn‚Äôt sent a single message or interacted with anyone. When I tried reaching out to support they refused to even offer a reason for the ban, wouldn‚Äôt help with a refund, and stopped talking to me. 

Given this poor support I didn‚Äôt trust them with whatever of my personal information they still had so I decided to delete it using the tool their support articles provide, but spoiler that tool doesn‚Äôt work. I was able to login to my account through it and verify they still had all my personal information using the export tool, but the deletion tool does not work which is a clear violation of both GDPR & CCPA. I‚Äôve already disputed the charge with Apple and I‚Äôll be filing a CCPA complaint. 

Do not trust Tinder with your data or your money.
title: Tinder is scamming customers and violating GDPR/CCPA

review:
Honestly I would imagine the most popular app for meeting would actually have you match with people. I have had 19 matches and 177 of them. Yes, 17, that‚Äôs 89.4%, of total matches have been simply someone trying to get me to send them money or pay to meet them or offer me some sort of ‚Äúservice‚Äù.
Not to mention that I‚Äôm almost positive that most of the accounts shown to you are not active. I honestly can‚Äôt believe how bad this application has made me feel about the situation, in fact I refuse to believe that my profile is being shown in my area, I am literally famous. And the fact that I have not even matched with a real person speaks the world about this application. Don‚Äôt spend your time your money or even anyone else‚Äôs. Clearly the developers are paywalling basic normal features and functionality but it really seems they are paywalling just getting seen. For reference I spent $50 and have never even had a genuine conversation with someone. Either fake accounts that ghost and sit there in your matches or people that just spam a Snapchat user name and then unmatch you. Unbelievable
title: Waste

review: It‚Äôs more of the users that cause it than it is the platform. Swiping is just too easy, and no one does it selectively. If you‚Äôre a guy, better be over at least an 8 or you‚Äôll be ghosted by all your matches (that means even if they swipe right on you, they‚Äôre still not actually interested). If you‚Äôre a girl, you‚Äôll be overwhelmed with such a massive selection of easy men you‚Äôll get lazy. Then there‚Äôs the pseudo-philosophy on Super Likes and greetings. What should be a great way to get someone you‚Äôre really interested in to know, they‚Äôve been branded as ‚Äúcreepy‚Äù or ‚Äúthirsty‚Äù. And intros. The fundamental basics of conversation are greetings, but those aren‚Äôt welcome here. People demand something mind blowing right off the bat, and they‚Äôre still unlikely to respond. And finally, maybe the worst thing is, Tinder will actively select who‚Äôs most attractive and show them first. If you‚Äôre anything less than gorgeous, you won‚Äôt be seen. The only way to bypass this is if you pay for the Platinum service. It‚Äôs a shame because it‚Äôd work wonders if people were a little more thoughtful.
title: Makes an incel out of all of us.

review: I downloaded this app again not even 2 days ago. It had been a year or so since I deleted my old account. Today I get on and it says I was banned. I reached out to support to ask why and all they told me was that they weren‚Äôt allowed to tell me why. I didn‚Äôt break any rules. I didn‚Äôt post anything even remotely controversial, offensive or risky. They banned me for no reason. If you are looking for a dating site, go somewhere else- This one is not worth it. The people who work for tinder are all robots who have no sense of community. They are sheep. The bans completely lack evidence and are random. Tinder steals your information and then blocks you from accessing your account. Tinder used to be a fun way to connect with people. It‚Äôs a complete joke. I‚Äôm not even sure the people i received support emails from are real people. The messages seemed very automated and fake. The prices are also outrages. Unless you pay out the Wazoo for likes you will not have fun on this app. I think it‚Äôs time to abandon online dating and meet people the traditional way. Tinder is the absolute worst.
title: What a joke of an app.

review: This app is a ripoff. It‚Äôs the second time I use it in the span of 6 months and it‚Äôs the same dynamic. The first day you download it it gives you a decent amount of likes with the free version. It will trick you into suggesting I received a good amount of likes but it was not running any of them through the main feed of girls to swipe on so it naturally made me buy Tinder Gold. Once I did and saw my likes, I started matching right away with most of them. However, after a few dozen matches (almost 50) a day later, all of a sudden no more likes, AT ALL, so no one to match with. Instead, it now bombards me with pop ups to buy Super Boost to get more exposure. Otherwise, no more likes for me. I got Tinder Gold for a month, but it was only really worth two days. There‚Äôs no point in seeing dozens of hot girls to swipe right on when the app doesn‚Äôt show me and give them a chance to swipe right on me too. I‚Äôm a paid member, I deserve better treatment/exposure on the app. Tinder is not what it used to be a few years ago when it first came out.
title: Ripoff

review: I have had 30 profile likes, of course from people within my area, for over a week now. I‚Äôve used my daily likes every day and now it tells me that ‚Äúthere are no more profiles in my area‚Äù for me to go through. In that entire week that number of likes only went down by one, so through that entire week and hundreds of profiles it purposefully chose it only show one of them that liked me, and now it wants to claim it has shown me everything when clearly it is hiding behind its back from me those 30 profiles which have liked me. Furthermore it knows that I know this given that it is showing me these likes, so they are putting them in a hostage situation, holding my romantic opportunity at ransom of paying their premium price just for me to achieve the purpose the app claims you can achieve without paying. Clearly however it is impossible to find matches now on free, and thus this app is useless and I urge for the app makers to change they‚Äôre greedy cruel model or continue to be berated by one star reviews. Be ashamed of yourselves
title: Purposefully hiding profiles that have liked you

review: I bought the platinum subscription when I signed up for the app a few days ago. Things went smoothly at first, then I noticed that my matches stopped messaging me and I wasn‚Äôt getting anymore likes. I didn‚Äôt think much of it at first, then I got a Snapchat message from someone I matched with asking me if I unmatched her. She said that she couldn‚Äôt see our Tinder messages or my profile anymore. At this point, I decided to ask someone else I matched with if they could see my Tinder profile, and they couldn‚Äôt. I messaged a Tinder rep and they said everything was fine on their in, then miraculously my matches could see my profile again (though I still haven‚Äôt gotten any new likes). My guess is that I got ‚Äúshadow banned.‚Äù Apparently, Tinder can ban your profile and you won‚Äôt even know. The app is still functionally the same for you and it even looks like you can send messages, but you‚Äôre invisible to everyone else. So you can line their pockets by buying all the subscriptions and boosters you want while your profile isn‚Äôt even being shown to others.
title: Disappointing

review: Tinder is by far the most successful scam app in the App Store without a doubt so let me explain and break it down for you. Everyone you know has had a tinder at one point which means there will be conversations that get started which could lead to disagreements which would end up with your account being banned with no warning or shadowbanned with no warning. I‚Äôm not even going to discuss the ban issue because there is more than enough reviews on that so let‚Äôs discuss the shadowban. If you‚Äôve ever wondered why you used to get a lot of likes but no longer receive any ? Shadowban! If you ever wondered why you send a lot of messages but never get any replies? Shadowban! Basically anything you do will get you shadowbanned or actually banned but the craziest part is they will never give you a warning or inform you and they will continue to give you a couple likes every blue moon so you will continue to pay for boost/tinder gold‚Ä¶ At this point they are running a successful multi million dollar scam empire that will end with them getting sued and I am seriously considering taking legal action
title: The Biggest Scam

review: I was banned suddenly for absolutely no reason. My photos were appropriate, guys I spoke to told me they‚Äôd seen lots of overt boobage and advertising for OF on most of the girl‚Äôs accounts and I had none of that. One day without warning I received a banned notification. No warning, no suspension, just all the sudden banned. I reached out in the only available manner and received an email response saying they wouldn‚Äôt help me at all, just simply they don‚Äôt tolerate violating their terms, which I appreciate but I never did any of that (I even read it in depth to see if I may have violated something strange you‚Äôd never expect). They offered no direction or explain action on what might‚Äôve happened. I even filed a complaint on the way they handled the matter. I had a paid account for 6 months as I‚Äôm a traveler and wanted to be able to change my location and meet people in different places (travel mode) and had 5 months left... I asked for refund but of course they didn‚Äôt even acknowledge that request. There is no way to call or dispute anything. TINDER IS AN ABSOLUTE SCAM, BEWARE! üôÑ
title: Banned without reason

review: The amount of 1 and 2 star reviews on here for the most part seem to be saying the same thing: bugs, scams, and ban issues and I‚Äôd say they‚Äôre accurate I bought tinder to try it and I‚Äôm not impressed I would lose matches that I was having good conversation with out of nowhere with no way to contact them anymore the app would show me people way out of my distance zone I would use the monthly boosts and do swipe surges only to get like 1 match on top of that the app is riddled with bots and scam accounts there seems to be an issue with the gender preference and worst of all you can‚Äôt even use the app without paying as a dude this app will likely only hurt your self esteem and as a female you‚Äôre likely going to get spammed and have to constantly dodge shady accounts if you want a date my best advice is to go somewhere and meet people because these dating apps aren‚Äôt worth your time and they‚Äôre certainly not worth your money until they fix the issues and I see other better reviews I won‚Äôt pay again.
title: Wouldn‚Äôt recommend

review: I‚Äôve had this app for 7 years. I‚Äôve noticed that the only time I match with someone is when I‚Äôm a good member. It‚Äôs like they purposely don‚Äôt show you people that liked you or vice versa that they will not show your profile when you swipe right. It seems to be a ploy to say ‚Äúhey you have 8 matches waiting, upgrade‚Äù. Funny how I never get a like when I‚Äôm a paid member though. My mileage from location is way off. I see all these profiles that are supposedly within my set mileage limit. When you see where there from its hundreds of miles off. I‚Äôve tried to delete my account and redo it. Still same issues. In 7 yrs, I think I matched with maybe 4 people. For the record, I know my limitations and don‚Äôt swipe on the fake models or woman out of my league. I believe I‚Äôve swiped right to hundreds of profiles in the years and 4 matches (only when I‚Äôm a paid member) though. I‚Äôve swiped left to hundreds as well. Ashame you can‚Äôt contact or email support on the app. It‚Äôs like thank you for the $$ and we don‚Äôt care.
title: Pay for Matches

review: I purchased a Tinder Platinum membership early this month during which I did not get any ‚Äúlikes‚Äù and that the same folks appeared to my screen for me to like or dislike their profiles over and over again. Then, I decided to cancel my subscription two weeks ago knowing that it will still be good until October 30, 2022 (I paid $110 Platinum good for 6 months). Yesterday, I tried to use the Tinder app only to find out that I have to create a new profile, which I did. Now my Platinum subscription is invalid. Also, all of a sudden I have ‚Äúlikes,‚Äù but of course I have to purchase Gold or Tinder plus or Platinum to view profiles of those who ‚Äúliked‚Äù mine. I contacted Tinder and they told me to restore my purchase for me to view the profiles. Why do I have to restore my purchase when I have an active (Platinum) subscription which is good until October? Could someone tell me if this not a scam, which I totally believe it is!? I won‚Äôt be surprised if Tinder will be a subject of another Class Action like what happened in 12/21 because of its malpractice scamming people out of their money!
title: I have been scammed!

review: Normally I wouldn‚Äôt care if I care if I was banned from something it‚Äôs very rare that I am. I‚Äôve notice I‚Äôm also not the only review about being banned. To start I have not been on tinder in years due to me being in a relationship. I got a new phone and number and decided to give it another try. After I had downloaded the app I went to try and create an account and it said I was banned. I‚Äôve tried reaching out to the joke you call customer service multiple times which is just an automated email response and no one will contact me over the phone so I can see how this even happened to me. I still don‚Äôt have any answers no one will respond to me and I‚Äôm honestly disappointed and dissatisfied with this app now. If this is really how y‚Äôall are going to treat your customers then I hope others read these reviews before considering downloading this app. Like I said if I already had the account and I did something to get myself banned I would understand but I hadn‚Äôt even made an account with my current number yet and it‚Äôs already telling me I‚Äôm banned.
title: Banned for no reason

review: Most profiles are fake and response rate from those few matches are extremely low. When you report a fake profile nothing happens. During swiping, which takes forever, there are constant interruptions as they try to upsell you on new features. Many of these features used to be standard. Even with the expensive paid subscription, you get a few super likes then the offer to sell you more of them and tell you they have run out. Also there is no ability to select demographic dating preferences anymore even with the paid subscriptions. For example you can no longer include or exclude people in your dating results by listing your religious, cultural, racial, language preferences, political views, etc. This means hundreds of more swipes per day than before to filter through hundreds of people you may not prefer. It‚Äôs a shame these apps have fallen in quality and escalated in price. It‚Äôs really not worth anyone‚Äôs time or money anymore. There are so many things they can improve, but they don‚Äôt. Typical Silicon Valley laziness at its finest.
title: Absolute waste of time and money

review:
After having dated online for many years I finally gave tinder a try. The interface is decent and its easy to use. It hookup roots are showing in the lack of filtering basics like parenthood, height, and whatnot. But my biggest gripe is that after two weeks on tinder plus having used 50 super likes and having literally run out of profiles within 15 miles of a major urban area i have a grand total of two matches and two other women who swiped right. I‚Äôm a decent looking guy with a well crafted profile. The same profile on bumble gets loads of matches. So i have to conclude that tinder is just not showing it to anyone. Its not worth any more of my money and time.

One more thing: they need a way to optionally not see profiles of people who live in other places but are just in town temporarily. If you‚Äôre looking for a hu then it makes sense to see visiting non-locals. But if you‚Äôre looking for something lasting then you may not want to waste time swiping on profiles from all over the world. It should be an option.
title: Not worth it

review: It's dumb that you have to PAY to see who likes you. I'm using Tinder to potentially find my soulmate, not waste my money and thinking women will talk to me even after paying. I'm about to delete the app just because over 98% of the women who do match with me, end up not replying to my messages or they unmatch from me before I can even see who they are or talk to them. I don't really view myself as an "ugly" person but I will agree I'm definitely not the most attractive person either. I'm a pretty decent looking guy who's got a house, a car, a job, bills are paid, my life is pretty much together, yet nothing seems to satisfy women on this God forsaken app. To the employees at Tinder, please fix your app to satisfy everyone's needs and stop making your app seem like it's definitely going to help people find the love of their life. Your app is nothing but a false sense of hope for single people who don't have that good of luck of potentially finding their soulmate. At least on Grindr you can actually see who taps you and you can talk to them without paying for anything.
title: Tinder is just a money grab

review: Tinder used to be the best dating app for meeting people online, Now its just flooded with fake profiles, bots, scammers, and women just trying to sell you their Onlyfans. It feels like there are no authentic profiles anymore. The few that there are Tinder pushes back on the algorithm so you are forced to pay for their premium services which have also gone up in price significantly and offer much less features. With the basic Gold profile you used to be able to see who swiped right on you and would get 5 super likes a day. Now neither of those features are included and instead are part of much more expensive packages. The once a month boost you would get is also gone. All of this to say that Tinder is dead for the regular users who actually liked the app for being able to connect and interact with people looking for the same thing as you. Its gone and probably never coming back. Other dating apps like Bumble and even Hinge are now much better for dating and meeting people. Say good bye to Tinder it was fun while it lasted
title: Used to be the best dating app, now its all Fake profiles

review: Please understand I don‚Äôt believe I was right fully investigated. This is a wrongful ban I seriously was minding my own business. Tinder please actually Investigate your reports because I believe for %110 I did nothing wrong. So, Why is it. That I have had my tinder account for 2-3 months normally but as soon as I get tinder platinum and start really using the service. Out of nowhere I amrandomly banded because some fake users wrongfully reported me. My messages are clean I know they are. I am verified. Im completely legit. Please tinder this has to be a glitch i literally just purchased tinder platinum. I had almost 80plus matches so much time wasted. So how am I supposed to make a tinder again if can‚Äôt use my number and I do not have a Facebook..... I guess I could use Instagram. But this is ridiculous. There‚Äôs no need for me to make another tinder account. I would really like to have an account with tinder again. That‚Äôs hard if my phones completely banned I can‚Äôt just go get another number. I already have a newer number. Tinder please review this and allow me to come back.
title: Banned for no reason

review:
I was getting matched with accounts that were 9000 miles away and outside of my age parameter so I started to report them. And then I found that I was reporting 10 accounts a day and not even getting a single match. So I reached out to customer service to let them know that there was something wrong that the age in the distance were incorrect and they told me that they were offering a free passport to users in the month of April and that‚Äôs why they were matching me two accounts that were 9000 miles away. I told him that I had global turned off and I didn‚Äôt want any matches outside of my parameters they gave me some ideas reinstall the app etc. that didn‚Äôt work so I reached out to them a second time then this morning I woke up to being banned.

5/3/21: multiple attempts to customer service to find out why I was banned and they keep telling me they can‚Äôt provide me detailed info just that I‚Äôve violated either community guidelines or TOS.

They don‚Äôt like you reporting fake accounts. It lowers their ‚Äúuser base headcount‚Äù which they need to appeal to the investors.
title: Banned for no reason

review: There has been so many issues on this app in the past year! First off, they hardly ever show your profile anymore to anyone and you will hardly get matches. Then they recommend you buy extra deals which are just a way to get you back to how tinder used to be. I used to get 300+ likes with around a 100 matches within a couple months and I tried it a month ago and I got 85 (combined matches and likes) in that time span. Not only this, but recently they will delay your matches for some reason. I had swiped on this dude a couple days ago and he added me on snap the same day (we never matched though). Then all of a sudden, tonight it shows we just matched a couple minutes ago. I do not know why it was delayed by a couple days, but this has definitely not been the first time it‚Äôs happened. I used to not mind tinder but recently I just see them as a company that sees you being hopeful as a way to make money off you. They will legit not show your profile and when you get feel alone, they recommend you pay $15-20 to actually be seen.
title: Scamming you

review: If you‚Äôre not an attractive guy and are just average or fugly this isn‚Äôt for you, you‚Äôll get taken advantage of and sent to the pit of ignored darkness AKA ‚Äúshadow ban‚Äù if you‚Äôre in it, your profile is hidden from literally anyone, your likes never actually get sent, super likes don‚Äôt, either, and super boosts don‚Äôt do anything either. The worst part is you‚Äôre not told of this profile status and they WILL let you pay for gold which does nothing other than take your money. They‚Äôre making their money off of guys hoping for a connection. They track and store your pictures, when they recognize them you‚Äôre immediately shadow banned, if you try to make a new profile and previous was banned they‚Äôll ban it, they track your specific phone serial numbers and ID‚Äôs, your IP address, if you were ever banned if their system recognizes any of above mentioned you‚Äôll get banned again. Your only chance is a new device, phone number, IP address, emails, new pictures, and don‚Äôt be ugly anymore. Then pray you don‚Äôt make any of the many easy mistakes to not get shadow banned again. It‚Äôs all ridiculous.
title: Shady on many levels

review: I wouldn‚Äôt recommend even downloading Tinder, because you will more than likely get banned for breathing the wrong way. I went to open my app one day and saw I was banned - with no explanation, just referring to the Terms of Service. Good luck trying to get in contact with support. Their support is almost non-existent. They will never respond to emails and their phone number isn‚Äôt even in operation. They will wait until you make a purchase for Tinder Gold or any other overpriced subscription, and will ban you with no refunds allowed. If I could give this app zero stars I would. The app is overpopulated with fake profiles, robots, and scammers who seem to never get banned. But don‚Äôt worry, Tinder will make sure to ban the good people for absolutely nothing. I cannot tell you the amount of times I have seen a profile with a fully naked person in it, report it, and continue to see the same profile across the app weeks later. This app is absolutely a scam. I will be filing a report to the BBB for the denial of service I received after making a purchase.
title: Get ready to be banned for no reason

review: I‚Äôve been a tinder user for awhile now. It‚Äôs going on about 2ish years? I tend to delete and recreate my tinder at least once or twice a year because I get sick of the dating scene and want a break. I‚Äôve never had any issues with it until just now. I recreated my tinder and did the photo verification thing. I go back to my account awhile later to find that I‚Äôve been permanently banned because I ‚Äúviolated terms of service‚Äù. What did I even violate though when the only way to get banned is 1.) harass people (which PLENTY of men I‚Äôve matched with have technically done yet they still have an account), 2.) post nudity (never done that), and/or 3.) have multiple accounts to get more matches, which I‚Äôve permanently deleted my accounts every time before recreating a new one. There‚Äôs also no email to contact for support to see if you can get the ban appealed. I don‚Äôt know if the reason was the fact I deleted and recreated my tinder account too many times? Which either way, that‚Äôs the whole point of being single is taking breaks or going through trial and error.
title: Banned for no reason??

review: This used to be a (mostly) GREAT app. I used it pretty often on and off the past couple years and decided to download it again because why not. I saw that prices had SIGNIFICANTLY been raised and also the app for whatever reason seems to hide people and say there‚Äôs no more people left to swipe on, even though i live in a city with a population of 3 million (like seriously, i doubt there‚Äôs <100 users in the city of houston, tx. especially with my prior experience w this app.) but even then i shrugged it off and even purchased Tinder Platinum (which is currently $30 a month) and continued using the app. To my surprise, after a WEEK of using the app like a totally normal person and not having a single bad interaction with anyone my account was banned?? Then i contact support and they can‚Äôt even tell me what terms i violated?? I‚Äôm definitely getting a refund and on top of that telling everyone i know that considers tinder in the future about this. It‚Äôs very unfortunate because it‚Äôs like everyone i know my age has a horror story about tinder similar to mine. BUYER BEWARE.
title: Oh how the mighty have fallen

review:
I downloaded this app yesterday. I was using it for maybe 45 minutes and I had already gotten 99+ likes. I didn‚Äôt swipe right on many people so I only ended up matching with a few people. I was talking to a few people last night and was enjoying my time. I wasn‚Äôt showing any skin in any of my pictures, they weren‚Äôt inappropriate at all. My conversations weren‚Äôt inappropriate either as I wasn‚Äôt looking for hookups, but mostly friends.
I woke up this morning to see that my account was banned. I did absolutely nothing to make this happen so I am extremely frustrated. I emailed support and they gave me a robotic answer saying they take people going against the community guidelines and terms and conditions very seriously, however I did nothing to violate any of them. They did absolutely nothing to help me. The team behind Tinder is a bunch of Robots, because anybody looking into my ban report would know it was wrongfully done. I‚Äôm very annoyed. A very cool app, just run by awful business people. Would leave 0 stars if I could.
title: Banned for no Reason - Awful Customer Service.

review:
Within 30 hours of having this app, my account was put under review and then banned. In the midst of this all, I had only been able to swipe left and right on other profiles due to the fact that there was a constant error message stating ‚Äúfailed to match with ‚Ä¶‚Äù that I couldn‚Äôt solve. I contacted customer service and all O received back was a ‚Äúthank you for notifying us, we will get back to you shortly.‚Äù A short 12 hours and a payment for a gold subscription, I was banned. The reason? Violating guidelines. 

To clarify, my profile had not violated any of the community guidelines, nor had any messages since I was unable to send one the entire time having the app. When I asked customer service again for removal of the unearned ban, all I could receive was a ‚Äúwe can not provide more details at this time. Your account is permanently banned due to violating community guidelines.‚Äù

Every aspect of this app has led to a horrible experience. I highly do not recommend this app. Spend your money elsewhere. Hopefully they treat you better.
title: Poor service all around

review: If I could give this negative stars I would. I have had tinder since 2019 when I turned 18. since then I have on and off used tinder with and without paying for their premium service. However yesterday I went to open tinder and a screen popped up that said you have been banned for violating community guidelines, when I had been on there hours before texting a guy about cheesy pickup lines üòÖ. I then went and read through all the guidelines, none have been broken or even close to being broken. I then emailed them, since the phone number they provide is a non existent number, and I got a reply that said they do not do appeals at this time but wouldn‚Äôt tell me what guideline I had broken. I have emailed 5 times since and have been given the same email response all five times. I was so pleased with the app until this incident. I have since canceled my subscription(and if you payed for the yearly plan and your account gets banned you get no refund), my friends have already canceled theirs and deleted their accounts. I am so disappointed in this company.

title: It‚Äôs tinder

When I asked for the reasoning behind being banned, they said they couldn‚Äôt provide any more information, which is hilarious to me because they haven‚Äôt provided ANY information at all. title: Unbelievable

review:
I‚Äôve used Tinder off and on for about as long as they‚Äôve been around. It‚Äôs now overly priced and even after paying a hefty amount for the Gold membership I still have to pay more money for simple features that should have been free to begin with. 
My second disappointment is that I do get a lot of matches. I travel for work so matches are constantly  piling in. 90% of those matches either don‚Äôt reply back or don‚Äôt talk to you at all. Which isn‚Äôt what I‚Äôm upset about with the app. It‚Äôs the fact that if I want to start cleaning out my matches from my account I have to individually go one by one to do it and I‚Äôm talking after a year of matches I have at least 200 woman I want to get rid of from my list. There needs to be a system where you can either select a time frame we can choose from for these matches to respond before they get removed as a match. Or they need to give us a clean up option where I can at least tap on who I want to unmatch from and remove them as a group instead of individually doing it. It‚Äôs a huge hassle.
title: Tinder needs to clean up

review: Tinder used to be the best dating/hook up app when it first released but now it is bombarded with overpriced and unreasonable subscriptions, obnoxious promotions even with platinum, glitch‚Äôs and bugs that will literally make this app counterintuitive and customer service that is so pointless and useless that you‚Äôre better off reading the troubleshooting guide that basically says ‚Äúuninstall your app and reinstall it and if that doesn‚Äôt work you‚Äôre probably just ugly/uninteresting‚Äù. You will match with people and have full conversations that just vanish because either the person got banned or suspended and you wouldn‚Äôt know any better and or the app glitches/bugs and deletes the match entirely. I know this because I match with several personal friends and we will just vanish on each others tinder accounts and I check with support and they say our accounts are ‚Äúworking fine no problems or suspensions, try these troubleshoots‚Äù. Don‚Äôt waste your money or time, get hinge or just try your luck in the real world, this app has ruined online dating.
title: Icarus flying too close to the sun

title: Just Bad

review: I wanna start off by saying that I am a very respectful person. I abide by every rule they have, with no questionable actions at all. Yet one day they sent me a request for review of my account. I sent the required pictures and within a couple days they replied saying that my account was banned because I had violated their terms of use/community guidelines. I kindly emailed their support team and all I get back is ‚Äúwe take our terms of use and community guidelines very seriously‚Äù. Ridiculous. I asked for for a specific reason because I know they can‚Äôt come up with one. Eventually they blocked me from emailing them (won‚Äôt send anymore) and now I don‚Äôt know how I can contact them for my refund‚Ä¶ since they kept billing me for my subscription! If you‚Äôre reading this‚Ä¶ you‚Äôre better off on another app. Or at least don‚Äôt spend money here because you might not get it back.
title: It‚Äôs true. They ban for absolutely no reason

review:
Well, they unintentionally support scam accounts. You can report a profile as a scammer; however, you can only do this when the profile is visible to you, so either when you are swiping or after you match. The problem is, if you match with a scammer, and add them on say snapchat as many people do with tinder, they can just unmatched you before attempting to scam you. And now, there is no way to report them. Now maybe you don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs a big deal cause you don‚Äôt fall for the scams, but that‚Äôs besides the point, you should be able to view profiles that unmatched you to report them. As trash as the app is, it would at least be better if half the people who match me weren‚Äôt scammers.

Besides that, it‚Äôs just an app that is preying on lonely people to make money. Telling them that if you pay more money you‚Äôll find someone for you. Well I got news for ya, you won‚Äôt be any more likely, cause assuming you are matching with real people and not scammers, tinder can‚Äôt just force people to date you. Someone either likes you or they don‚Äôt.
title: They Support Scam Accounts

This is where the problem lies, I don‚Äôt get very many matches so I try to talk with mine as soon as I can, but just today on two separate occasions my phone slowed down while talking to people on the app so I closed it out and when I got back the were unadded, I do understand they could have but I had been talking to one for a couple of days and just matched with another so I find it very unlikely that these two girls both unadded me after my phone slowed down and I closed out the app 
I would really like this resolve I wish I could match with them again although I‚Äôm not sure if Tinder would allow that
title: Crashing app and deleting matches

title: Banned

Tinder refuses to admit they‚Äôre doing this, but I know they are cause no matter how much I change my photos or move my location around the world, I receive 0 likes or matches after weeks of swiping. title: Account hacked and now banned
