title: Terrible customer service

review:
Tinder used to be amazing. No bots, constant matches, a great reporting system. Now it‚Äôs just gone downhill. The amount of bots and people who are only selling content is very annoying. Tinder claims its not a hookup site yet it allows all of the people who are selling content to make profiles, making it hard for the people who are trying to find friends or more. The bots that you sometimes can‚Äôt tell are bots are flooding the space. 
However the app isn‚Äôt as bad as most of them out there. But there are a few things i‚Äôd like to see in the future:

‚Ä¢Filter by ethnicity (easier to find what you like) even if it‚Äôs a premium feature this would help a lot, coming from a man of color who isn‚Äôt interested in white women, it seems every time i swipe there‚Äôs 30 white women before a single person of color pops up. Please make this a feature it‚Äôs what makes the okCupid app (kinda like tinder) better since they have it

‚Ä¢Filter by what they‚Äôre looking for 
Tired of women who just want to hookup, i‚Äôm looking for a friendship that turns into a relationship down the line. I‚Äôm not trying to hookup left and right with these women you feel me?

‚Ä¢Scan a valid License in order to create an account
This would: 1. Keep bots from flooding the tinder space, 2. Ensure people are their correct age and not lying,
And 3. Make it a safer space for all included easier way to verify
title: Decent, not what it used to be.

review: I have been a long time tinder user. I have had some success making connections through the app, I‚Äôll give them that. However, there are certain things the app does that greatly decrease the quality of the experience. For one, recently, I have found that I cannot open profiles till I match with the person. This means I cannot read the majority of the information. After researching, I learned that this is part of beta testing for a possible future feature. I‚Äôd like to firmly say that I absolutely hate this. Also, I often find that the app ignores my preferences, showing me the profiles of literal teenagers. Why have an age filter if the algorithm will ignore it? I also find that often I become matched with people I am sure I never swiped right on. Many of my friends have also experienced this. I also wonder if tinder ever matches me with people who didn‚Äôt swipe right on me. In general, why offer features that the app itself than makes obsolete? Make it make sense.
title: If it ain‚Äôt broke don‚Äôt fix it

JUST BECAUSE I‚ÄôM A CAM GIRL DOES NOT MEAN IM NOT WORTHY OF FRIENDSHIPS / RELATIONSHIPS OF ANY SORT. Cam girls have a life too!! We‚Äôre just like everyone else. title: TINDER DISCRIMINATES !!!!!

review: This app has many issues which range from being glitchy to the most important being fake accounts. The plethora of fake accounts is the single most flaw of this app beyond any other flaw. review: So I signed up, just to feel out the app. I uploaded four pics, and wrote a MINIMAL amount of detail in my bio. Just to be clear I‚Äôm a good looking gym rat with an excellent physique and a six pack. Within the first twelve hours I had 18 likes that I couldn‚Äôt unlock unless I ponied up the credit card for a gold membership. Once they get the credit card, it‚Äôs over. I started swiping right, being selective with whom I reached out. Got no matches. So just to see what would happen, I indiscriminately started liking everybody, I probably swiped right on 100 women, all ages, shapes and sizes. Still haven‚Äôt gotten a single match. Statistical probability that I‚Äôd get 18 in the first half day, and then literally zero the next day shows me the app is manipulated. They‚Äôre either not circulating my profile, or withholding my likes from the women I swiped right on. And of course they‚Äôre trying to get more money to increase my exposure, because $36 a month isn‚Äôt enough apparently. Maybe it‚Äôs different for women, but if you‚Äôre a guy there‚Äôs a target on our wallets. Save your money, gentleman.
title: It‚Äôs a scam

review:
This app always shows a notification badge, even when there are no new matches or unread messages. There is no way to mark all messages as read, so unless I delete or reopen every chat and match, the notification badge does not go away. Absolutely ridiculous. There‚Äôs no way to know when I actually have new notifications.

There also should be ways to customize how messages are displayed, and a date/time
stamp should be shown on the message list rather than requiring the message to be opened to see when the last message was sent. Messages aren‚Äôt even displayed in chronological order. Random old conversations get bumped to the top of the messages list with no rhyme or reason whatsoever. In addition to this, I am constantly shown the same profiles in my area that I have swiped left on numerous times. Finally, being able to undo an unintended left swipe should not be a feature only given in paid subscriptions. Whoever designs this app is very clearly incompetent and not keeping practical user experience in mind.

There are also features that are just stupid. One is where the app occasionally says ‚Äúoops you missed a match‚Äù after swiping left on someone who liked you, as though the interest definitely must have been mutual, so you should therefore get the paid subscription in order to not make this ‚Äúmistake‚Äù and ‚Äúmiss‚Äù a match again. Yes I may unintentionally swipe left but the app should not presume that‚Äôs what happened.
title: Horrible design and features all around

review:
1. Allow users to undo a Super Like. Sometimes I accidentally press the button and there‚Äôs no way to go back or cancel it. Super annoying 

 2. Enough of this blue popup message trying to get us to use Super Likes. It gets in the way of important profile information and it‚Äôs popping up like every 3rd swipe. Soooo annoying 

 3. I‚Äôm constantly getting ‚Äúghost notifications‚Äù - tinder tells me I have a new like or new match and I open the app and there‚Äôs nothing there. This happens a couple times a day 

 4. Don‚Äôt like that Likes expire after 7 days. Seems like many users don‚Äôt check the app on a weekly basis so many of these will be missed which is a huge bummer 

 5. Although I‚Äôm specifically filtering for people within 15 miles of me, I‚Äôm constantly getting people that are hundreds, if not thousands of miles away 

 6. Let people filter and sort your Likes list. Sometimes I‚Äôd like to sort by expiring soon or filter for people I Super Liked or filter for people who are recently active, etc 

7. Things that Feeld does that I appreciate: - Tells you if a user is currently online or last time they were online - Their version of Boosts (called Uplift) lasts for 24 hours as opposed to a Boost only lasting a half hour, which makes it a much better value and therefore more likely to utilize - Read receipts are standard and free - greatly appreciated
title: Feedback for devs

review: My account is apparently under review, but my profile is clean and I have not done anything that could be grounds for getting reported. Tinder does not send alerts to let you know your account is under review. I was not receiving messages after being in conversations the previous night, nor was I able to match with anyone, despite being able to swipe. I asked a friend that I matched with on there to send me a message to see if I receive it, but they told me I am gone from their matches and they can‚Äôt see me. I can still see them on my matches though. You cannot call to talk to a human about what is going on, only send an email and hope for the best that a bot doesn‚Äôt decide to nuke your account for no reason. The customer service (I have paid to upgrade my membership) is nonexistent. You‚Äôre making money from us, pay to have humans that we can depend on. I have looked on many forums to find solutions to no avail. There are so many other reviews similar to this, it‚Äôs a problem that needs to be addressed.
title: Account under review

review: Nothing would make me more happy than seeing Match Group go bankrupt. They control over 60% of the North American dating app market. Their products are designed for nothing more than to cause frustration and despair in hopes of extracting money out of people‚Äôs pockets. I am unable to use this app because I have deleted my account merely once and made a new one using the same number and email. According to the holy algorithms that this app uses, that makes me a bot. Tinder hates this word and refuses to interact with you if you use it when contacting support, but it‚Äôs pretty clear to me that I‚Äôve been SHADOWBANNED. And oh do they love to do this. Isn‚Äôt it pretty messed up that a company is able to do this? Especially considering how many people rely on online dating and with how big of a share of the market Match Group has? Do they give you a chance to remedy this whatsoever. No. Not at all. Like I said, I look forward to the day that this company ceases to exist and there is a reckoning for the immense social and cultural damage that it has caused.

review:
So I used to have Tinder free edition and it was aweful but I was getting a decent amount of likes. So I decided to spend to get platinum to see who likes my profile. However, ever since doing so I stopped getting any likes. The matches I got was an accidental swipe. 
The only likes and matches I get are women who market their Only Fans, Snapchat premiums, and how much they charge for services. The other issue I have is the fact that some matches are with women in happy relationships wanting to promote their social media pages. 
Lastly, I paid for the most expensive edition of the app yet I cannot use a boost but 1x a month without purchasing. Also the fact there are only 6 super likes available after purchasing the most expensive version doesn‚Äôt make any logical sense. Why should I be getting bombarded with extra charges to get features I thought I was paying for. Also why am I still getting in app ads of more purchasing options when I paid to not have any ads at all?
title: Wasted Money

review: I‚Äôve had tinder since 2018 off and on and never had a problem with it until recently. I opened the app one day to see I had been permanently banned. Days after redownloading the app. I had verified my account multiple times and even paid for tinder premium because I thought it would make for a better experience using the app and boy was I wrong. If you don‚Äôt answer a man within their set amount of time or do whatever they ask of you they will take it upon themselves to report your account and of course tinder gives you no way to dispute the claims or defend yourself. I emailed their customer service back and forth for a week for them to say that my account was fine on their end and whatever problem I was having unbanning my account was in fact just my problem. Of course tinder would make an option that lets men punish women for not being interested in them. Thank you tinder for setting the precedent that in 2023 you can‚Äôt reject a man or you will get banned from ever using tinder again.

review: I‚Äôm not one to write reviews. I personally don‚Äôt care for reviews but at least this one I get to say it‚Äôs an honest one. A little over a year ago I decided to give tinder a shot. My impression of tinder was tinder is just an app to find short term or just flings. I really didn‚Äôt have any expectations for tinder but only if it happens it happens, if not oh well. I decided to give it a shot and as of yesterday I made a year with someone who turned out to be very special in my life. I can honestly say she became my best friend And someone who I‚Äôve came to love so dearly. We have been on many adventures already and hopefully more to come. It has been an exciting year. Now this is none of everyone‚Äôs business But just saying this to thank Tinder cause if it wasn‚Äôt for tinder, I wouldn‚Äôt have found my bestfriend/ love of my life.

review: I downloaded tinder just a FEW days ago, took me a day to set it up and had barely even had the chance to use it and my account got BANNED. What‚Äôs even more frustrating is that a mere 30 minutes before my account got banned I paid to have the extra features so I could really get the most out of the app and then boom I wasn‚Äôt even allowed to use the app at all. I reached out to ‚Äúcustomer support‚Äù and explained the situation and how I had zero clue how I could have violated the terms and conditions considering I HADN‚ÄôT even had the chance to USE the app. All my pictures were appropriate, I didn‚Äôt even have the chance to talk to anyone so there‚Äôs no way I could have offended or said something to anyone that was bad, and in return I received an automated email telling me again that I violated the ‚Äúterms and conditions‚Äù but not HOW I violated them. I really just wanted my account back considering I just paid for the extra features and I hadn‚Äôt had my account for more than 3 days. I just don‚Äôt understand. 10/10 would NOT recommend.

I‚Äôve never been rude or disrespectful or inappropriate whatsoever on this app somehow got banned told them I don‚Äôt want my subscription renewed if this is how they treat their customers the customer service told me that it would not be renewed and everything would be considered canceled after my request even though I was charged another month for 2999 and for some reason I can‚Äôt get Tinder through their email links and support to cancel my subscription. review: This app was great a few years ago. It has since turned into an app where men must pay to even have their profiles shown to women. I used to get 20 matches per day and now I get maybe 1 per week. I certainly haven‚Äôt gotten that much uglier over the past 3 years. I really think the early years of Tinder were part of a longer term strategy - bait them in, show them the awesomeness - then pull the rug out from under them and make them pay for each morsel of the way things once were. Also, the liberal agenda behind these apps just gets old. They won‚Äôt let you filter by ethnicity, you can‚Äôt filter out transgendered ‚Äúwomen‚Äù, they only offer tags like BLM,  LBGQ, Pronouns, Vaccinated, etc - they offer only liberal categories for everything. Dating apps, social media platforms and news media outlets are all hyper focused on transforming our society and our country into a giant pile of crap. Look around and ask yourself whether people really are happier now wallowing in this modern liberal trash pile than they were in the Leave it to Beaver days.
title: Trash Pile

review: I used to enjoy this app occasionally and recently redownloaded it to find that everything is monetized and costs quite a bit. You now have a limit on how many swipes/ likes you get in a day and have to purchase more if you‚Äôd like to match. You no longer are able to super like (let people know you liked their profile) without buying them. Before you got like 3 a day. The price for Tinder Gold went up which would let you know who liked you (a standard free feature on other dating apps) and allow you to go back and fix a swipe/ like if you messed up. Also, now in between liking profiles they will send you ads as profiles that you have to swipe past as if they‚Äôre dating profiles. So they‚Äôre collecting ad revenue from you without giving you any new features, taking more away, and charging more for the services that existed? Make that make sense. Tinder was always known for low-quality hookup dating but at least it was fun to use. It was never the best dating app and now it stands as the absolute worst.
title: The worst dating app.

review: Their team constantly falls for revenge reporting and bans you for no good reason. I‚Äôve been verified a few times by Tinder before. This time I simply wanted to delete my account and the app would not let me. This is after I realized I had been shadow banned due to revenge reporting. I was getting only 5 likes when I usually get 99+ in less than an hour. And what does Tinder do? They know they‚Äôve shadow banned you and let you keep playing for subscription and other services. This is unethical and shady. More importantly. there is something going on with their verification team - especially if you get the ones from overseas. They play with users. They send you through hoops asking you to send photos, after you have already deleted your photos, saying they want yo ‚ÄúVerify‚Äù that it‚Äôs you. How are that going to do they when I had already removed my photos and had a photo of a dessert because I wanted to delete my account? Do not trust Tinder. They have shady, unethical and questionable practices.

review: I‚Äôve been trying to use this app for over a month now!! Every few days my entire account gets deleted and when i try recovery through my email it says there‚Äôs no account attached to it. I‚Äôm constantly being shown the same people I‚Äôve already swiped on, and have gotten 0 matches in over a month (not saying i should have a million matches, but i know I‚Äôd have at least one by now if it were showing me to people). I‚Äôve filled out my account to 100%, verified my account, connected my Apple ID, checked my internet connection, updated my phone, updated the app, deleted and redownloaded it, used it with and without a vpn, and i get nothing. Even if someone could get it to work for me, the fact that I‚Äôve had to go through this is ridiculous. This app has existed for years and still is unusable for some people; that‚Äôs just a bad app. I‚Äôm done trying.

Hope this helps!

review: I‚Äôm 20 years old average looking man and I think many other men feel the same when I say this. It‚Äôs horrible. I‚Äôve had this app for 2 years and probably only got 100 likes in that span of time and probably same amount of matches that lead to nowhere and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm a part of the reason but at the same time I get a like and open the app to see what the girl looks like then boom the likes gone for reasons I can‚Äôt control it‚Äôs either that or some girl built like a linebacker for the nfl is liking me. Now I don‚Äôt shame people for their physique because everyone has their preference. And mine is not that. However, the tinder algorithm can‚Äôt seem to detect crap so that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm stuck with. The platinum membership is a complete shakedown when it comes to the amount of likes which doesn‚Äôt increase at all and is just disappointing. I feel at a complete impass when using this thinking maybe if I wait longer it will finally happen, but it doesn‚Äôt which is probably why this app makes so much revenue.
title: Garbage but still my only option

review:
You won‚Äôt find a relationship on Tinder, especially as a male. And if by some miracle you get around all the pay-walls, ego boosters, and angle abusing overweight people, they 9 times out of 10 won‚Äôt be right for you. Tinder preys on instant attraction, which isn‚Äôt true love. It just leads to a relationship based on lust, which is like building a house on sand. It serves to gratify the self through the satisfaction that someone else thought you were attractive. 

The amount of single mothers I‚Äôve matched with who have told me they met the child‚Äôs father on Tinder is absurd. Tinder is the result of a generational fault, and it will sadly remain a plague on the world for the foreseeable future so long as desperate people still think their soul mate is just a swipe away. 

If you‚Äôre a college student, a senior in high school, or a post grad, you‚Äôve been warned. Don‚Äôt fall into the trap. I promise, you‚Äôll meet the right with one time. Work, classes, or even just by chance out at Walmart. I know it‚Äôs not easy, but it‚Äôs a better investment of your time than Tinder.
title: Tinder Ruined an Entire Generation

review: Trash app. Terrible support. The app is so buggy and messed up. You have to pay to see who likes you and all this crap. It‚Äôs definitely a cash grab. The app claims there‚Äôs people in your area and that you need to ‚Äúboost‚Äù your profile to get in touch with them! If you don‚Äôt boost your profile I guess the developers or whoever created this scam, won‚Äôt let you truly see who‚Äôs in your area or what not. review: I am interested in knowing how far away someone is, what line of work they‚Äôre in, whether they‚Äôre in school or not, and what kind of interests they have in a general sense, and that info is usually accessible at the same time that I‚Äôm tapping through the photos in a profile. That‚Äôs a helpful layout that allows me to make decisions more quickly. However, because of the location of the super like button directly below the profile info, any time that Tinder tries to influence my behavior by suggesting I super like, the helpful info above the row of icons is blocked from view by a pop-up text bubble. That‚Äôs disruptive to my preferred use of the app and seems counterproductive to what I assume is tinder‚Äôs goal of encouraging regular and/or prolonged engagement. Please let us disable in-app notifications of this type. I know how to Super Like and I have thought about when I would and wouldn‚Äôt like to Super Like. Please stop telling me to consider Super Liking profiles.

review: I‚Äôve been using tinder on and off for 2-3 years.. never once had an issue. Upgraded my account to tinder gold was paying for boosts and super boosts since I recently moved outta state it was a easier way for me to meet and make friends etc. I paid for a super boost. I just don‚Äôt understand why tinder is doing this to people. Least you can do is let us appeal and get our accounts back. I don‚Äôt get what the issue is reviewing people‚Äôs accounts.  I‚Äôll never recommend tinder to anyone after this situation. So inconvenient and upsetting.

review: There‚Äôs too many fake profiles, or people showing up from thousands of miles away. My ‚ÄúGlobal‚Äù preference is always off, and still it shows me 90% people 1,000+ miles away. Because passport is obsolete now that you showing my profile everywhere instead of locally. So that‚Äôs not working feature(which I pay for). Every tinder Gold feature that I paid for is essentially obsolete. I can swipe all i want, but that doesn‚Äôt matter much because you show me people in another country i could care less about. review: I have had an account for a couple years. I have always been respectful, been honest about my information, and followed all the community guidelines/terms of use. I was asked to verify my account using one of those bot puzzles. Despite completing it multiple times, I was informed my account was under review. A few hours later, I was told I was banned. I requested support from Customer Service and merely received a generic response with no real feedback or support. I still don‚Äôt know the reason behind getting banned because I know i‚Äôve followed all the guidelines and terms of use. I‚Äôve spoken with some people and it randomly happens with no way to get back your account back or even any clarifications. I find it frustrating that this happened to me (who hasn‚Äôt broken any rules) when i‚Äôve received cruel/rude messages from people and i‚Äôve seen people break tinder‚Äôs guidelines but they still show up in my feed. My advice, save your time and energy and focus it on another dating app.
title: Use a different app. Tinder doesn‚Äôt offer any support.

review:
I find myself needing to express disappointment in my experience with Tinder. The majority of matches I‚Äôve encountered seem to be accounts intent on accumulating followers on social media rather than forming meaningful connections. I‚Äôve also encountered a concerning number of seemingly fake profiles that appear intent on soliciting personal information.

Additionally, I‚Äôve found the app‚Äôs notification system to be misleading. On numerous occasions, I‚Äôve received alerts suggesting a match or incoming message, only to find these to be promotional attempts by the app to spur more usage. This does not create an enjoyable user experience, but instead leads to unnecessary anticipation and frustration.

While the concept of the app is commendable, the implementation needs significant improvement. I believe that a more secure and honest environment would greatly enhance user experience. I hope to see these issues addressed in future updates. Until then, I‚Äôm afraid I can only award a 2-star rating.
title: Misleading Notifications and Suspect Profiles

review:
I have been single now for four years, and I can thank tinder for opening up a new world for me after my last relationship. However, I am now 23 years old and interested in finding love again.
For the past two years, I have had very disappointing results I am so grateful that tinder has added the option to display whether you are looking for short term long-term or testing the waters for your profile.
I have spent proximately $100 or more with Tinder gold and extra purchases in app 
I kid you not I have maxed out the amount of likes my profile has received (9,999)
It is so overwhelming and annoying. Trying to sort through the likes I receive to find anyone even close to similar interests.
If there was any way to sort things to where I could only see people who are of the same sexual orientation, and wanting long-term relationships, that would help me phenomenally
The amount of rage that overcomes my self when I‚Äôm dating someone only to find out that they had no intentions of long-term goals, someone who was only visiting town, someone who had a second partner. 
I try to be patient, I report every fake, inappropriate account I see but it‚Äôs never enough. 
I wish the dating app was used for dating, instead of hookups and whatnot. I don‚Äôt wanna lose hope and abandon my aspirations to meet someone again, but it‚Äôs dwindling at this point.
title: 4 years and counting

review: First off, I am a woman and don‚Äôt have a spam account. I was seriously looking to meet people. I‚Äôve downloaded tinder on and off over the past 7+ years using the same account but updating my pictures and bio as I saw fit. Tonight I redownloaded it again and was almost immediately banned for seemingly no reason. I have a normal profile with very little inappropriate skin showing, no racist or offensive remarks in my bio or pictures, never done any of that in the past, read their guidelines and didn‚Äôt seem to break any of them. I matched with one person and sent them 2 messages and opened the app to respond again and was permanently banned from my account or making new accounts in the future. The only thing I can figure is that someone must have reported me but for what? Why wouldn‚Äôt tinder look at my profile before permanently banning me? I literally haven‚Äôt done anything and now I can‚Äôt use one of the most popular dating apps out there. They need to seriously fix their algorithms and reporting structure.
title: Permanently banned for no reason

review: This is the worst thing that has happened to society. The app and the algorithms use are so biased and prejudice. The app is not designed to look out for a little man at all I've use that for quite some time and I have realized that if your profile is not flashy and catchy you will be put to the bottom of the stack. And don't you dare spend money on the app because they will give you one match per boost used if it's the first boost of the day. Occasionally more than that but very very seldomly. Think about it if the Company is making money off of you they don't want you to end up in a successful relationship because their money stops there. So they try to influence you into spending more money in hopes of getting more matches in hopes of eventually finding your significant other of your dreams but it's all A lie and a scheme. And I know that with COVID-19 getting out and mingling in person is a lot harder than it used to be but that is your best bet far as making new friends and creating new relationships because tinder is flawed to the roots.

review: I don‚Äôt use tinder often. But my main issue with the app is that there is a phantom notification. It always has a red 1, meaning one unread notification on iPhone. However there are none. I go into the app and look under every section and sub section possible but no matter what the notification never disappears. Some times if I get an actual notification and check that after the phantom notification disappears but only for a few hours until it returns again. Only real way to get rid of it is by disabling all tinder notifications which then makes it pointless if do you get a match. May just have to delete the app for good. Second most annoying thing is you have to pay for everything, more swipes, boosts, super likes, etc. I get it is a business and they want to make money but it makes the app very limited. Third annoying thing is you can not block people before actually matching with them. Only way to block is if you match with them first and the block. Do better Tinder.

I usually wouldn‚Äôt have been bothered by the situation but tinder is honestly the only way I make friends I am very anti social and don‚Äôt get out much and I was slowly getting closer to making friends through this app only to randomly be banned which is seriously unfair with the amount of harassment I‚Äôve gotten from people on this app. I still keep trying to reach out but am getting nowhere, I‚Äôm hoping this will be read by support so they can see that it‚Äôs a pattern and it‚Äôs happening to people who don‚Äôt deserve it.

review: Don‚Äôt use this app! Tinder is not professional, random people who don‚Äôt care about you or your personal information work behind tinder and will lock you out of or ban you off your own account. title: Trash

review: I‚Äôm theory, this app could be great but the amount of fake profiles that Tinder creates to encourage engagement and to keep people buying stars is insanely high. I did a one week study and 1 out of 8 profiles of was created by Tinder. There‚Äôs also a vast amount of fake profiles created by scammers. Although there are real people using this app and connections have been made, the percentage of that happening is extremely low. There are options to make the app valuable for real life people trying to use it for reasons other than making money off it: 1. All accounts must be verified. 2. All free accounts must be eliminated and everyone must pay a subscription. 3. When fake profiles are reported, Tinder follow up with those who reported it. 4 Tinder must be transparent with its audience on key metrics regarding the fake accounts it creates and the accounts people report as fake or scammers. To anyone using it or intending to use this app: TINDER IS NOT FOR THE FEINT OF HEART. It requires tenacity, a careful sense of how you use it, and a high tolerance for disappointment.
title: Full of fake profiles

review: I am a married woman in an ethically non monogamous relationship, since tinder is known as the hookup app my husband sans I agreed that tinder would be the best app for what we were looking for. review:
The amount of notifications you get for not subscribing to the platinum subscription tier is borderline harassment.  Multiple times per day you get push notifications worded in a way to try to get you on the fear of missing out, ‚Äúoh sorry you missed somebody because you aren‚Äôt paying us $30 per month‚Äù tinder is absolutely not worth $30 every month.  Nearly every other swipe you get obnoxious in-app notifications that you can‚Äôt turn off ‚Äúhey you‚Äôre missing a feature because we want more money and you‚Äôre not giving it to us‚Äù 

Reviewers are correct, you don‚Äôt need to pay to use the app.  You might miss a couple extra features that are useful or just cool but you‚Äôre not getting locked out of matching with somebody just because you don‚Äôt pay. I‚Äôm happy to pay the basic price to remove ads, I get that companies have to make money, that‚Äôs the world we live in now. It‚Äôs enough to make me want to delete the app entirely with how many you get just begging you to give them more money.
title: I get the pay tiers but

review:
I never harassed anyone, never got in to arguments, didn't post inappropriate pictures, had nothing offensive in my profile, never treated my dates cruelly, never spammed anyone....then this week - banned. I reach out to customer service to ask why. They responded that I violated the terms of service. I told them that I reviewed the terms of service and I violated none of them and asked if they could tell me the specific reason I was banned. They said they couldn't because they don't have that information.....

I pride myself on conducting myself respectfully and being kind to those around me. The ONLY thing I can guess is the day before I was banned I went on a date with a man who claimed he was 34. The second he showed up he tried to kiss me despite me telling him "no," then confessed that he was 44. My only response was to say, "ok. I'm leaving" and I left. No yelling. No fighting. I got out without a scene. 

I can only imagine tinder banned me for not staying on a date with a man who nearly sexually assaulted me.
title: Banned for not violating terms of service.

review:
First off, I‚Äôd like to say that I‚Äôm coming at this review from the perspective of someone who thinks the app‚Äôs features have the potential to make the experience amazing (when working as intended). The main issue with the app is that there are too many annoying and repetitive bugs that completely destroy the user experience. 

First off, why even have an option to ‚Äúonly show people in this range‚Äù if every other profile you show is 2000+ miles away from the range I set? I mean, I get it. The app runs out of users to show you after a while and is forced to recommend profiles outside the range. But then why not just say that the app has run out of profiles and leave it at that? My guess is that the devs are trying way too hard to waste people‚Äôs time and keep them on the app as long as possible.

Second, literally every other swipe I get a notification that says ‚ÄúSuper like to increase your odds by 5x.‚Äù Now, I personally wouldn‚Äôt care about the constant notification. But it‚Äôs literally right above the profiles distance for you. Which is the number. one. consideration. when deciding on whether to swipe right or not. Again, this goes back to my initial theory that the devs are looking for ways to keep users on the app. 

I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve logging out and back in, deleted the app and it‚Äôs data. Nothing fixes these issues, because they‚Äôre not bugs, they‚Äôre features.
title: The App continues to find ways to waste your time

review:
The title of the review is an understatement. If you are not prepared to shell out almost 40$ a month for their platinum membership (where the app is actually functional) don‚Äôt bother getting this app. 
   The app will work against you in every possible way not to match you with the people that liked YOU to try to get you to subscribe.
   I am all in support for pay for convenience apps or just purchasing the membership when they are straight forward to you about it, but when they advertise the app as free and try and use these methods to manipulate you into a subscription is cringe. 
   And for an app where such a big portion of users are there to seek out drug dealers or promote their social media, it‚Äôs a joke. 
   Take your money and go to your local speed dating event where you can meet some people that are there for the same reason as you are and not get catfishes, or use a different app. This is a casino of online dating where the only ones who are winning are Tinder, and the very few users.

title: 1 complaint

review: I deleted my account halfway through my first month of gold membership because it's that useless to me. The app will continue to hound you with ads to buy various paid one-use items AFTER already paying them a subscription fee, that's needed to just see who likes you're profile at all. So basically to match with anyone if you have a free account, you both have to like each other's profile without knowing that the other did it. Do you know how unlikely that is to happen? Also the user-base seems to be 99% people who could find work in modeling while I'm just some guy. No way would I have any chance on this app. Also it doesn't even ask for basic information like political or religious beliefs. If I have to match with someone just to find out that they're not compatible with me anyway, why would I want to use this app for any long-term relationship? This app only technically has the option for long-term relationships, but good luck finding any.
title: Advertisements for paid subscription members

review:
So, first they introduced a new higher tier of membership to ensure our Gold membership likes sink deep below all the new Platinum members' likes. (Not even offering an upgrade plan for Gold members.)

Then they reduced our "5 superlikes per day" entitlement to "5 superlikes per week". (Men who don't look like Brad Pitt need to send out a lot more likes/superlikes than the best looking guys and most girls, so this affects us the most.)

Next, they use false advertizing to fool you into thinking you actually get 1 boost per month and 5 superlikes per week when you actually get much less than that. The weekly/monthly timer starts when you've used them up, instead of just expiring at the end of the week/month if unused. In my opinion, this bit is criminal and worthy of a lawsuit.

Finally, there are often times when I don't want to make a decision on someone in the deck so instead of swiping left/right I just close the app for browsing later. Now, when I do this, even though I know there are thousands of people I haven't yet swiped on, I open the app to see a "you've run out of people" in your area message. I live in city of 8m+. Clearly, not swiping on someone puts their profile on cooldown.

It's astonishing how progressively worse this app can get. ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
title: Worse than ever

title: Permaban just for making a couples profile

review: I‚Äôve used Tinder on and off for the last couple of years, and have tried their premium features. Whenever I need a break from the platform, I delete my account to ensure my profile isn‚Äôt shown to other users when I‚Äôm inactive. When I‚Äôm ready to return, I‚Äôll create a new account using the same information as the previous account. I‚Äôve found deleting and re-creating an account more than a couple of times results in practically 0 likes or matches. Before deleting my account for the first time I received a fair amount of attention on the app, but now I‚Äôll be lucky to get a match every couple of weeks. I find it incredibly unlikely that my account receives practically 0 attention given I live right outside of a major city. I‚Äôm under the impression my profile isn‚Äôt really shown to other users. At the end of the day, deleting and recreating an account doesn‚Äôt violate any of Tinder‚Äôs terms of service, but yet I‚Äôm still punished. It‚Äôs obvious Tinder has little regard for their user base.
title: Shadow Banned?

review: I‚Äôve had this app for a year now and am yet to go on a date. Conversations have lasted less than a few days on average. The only time I‚Äôve been close to going on a date is when the girl charges money for it (which I think is actually illegal). Maybe I‚Äôm just bad with small talk, but I‚Äôve had friends who are low-key womanizers do entire conversations for me and still get nowhere. Maybe I‚Äôm just ugly, idk. Also, I don‚Äôt get why there‚Äôs a 12 hour wait between swipe sessions. The only purpose it serves is to make it so that you have to swipe right when you get up in the morning if you want to get two sessions in a day. It should really be 11 hours or 10 hours since no average human is going to exploit that to get like 2.15 swipe sessions per day. Wish I could say this app is worth it, but in my experience, it‚Äôs definitely not unless your just looking for hookups.
title: Not great if you‚Äôre serious

review:
Out of nowhere in the middle of me using Tinder, I get a notification popping up on my screen saying that my account has been banned because I violated the Terms of Service. Mind you, I have been using Tinder on and off for years, have bought multiple subscriptions, and have had no problems until now. This is quite upsetting, especially when I had a active gold membership. Not only that, upon reaching out to customer service they are not able to give me details as to why my account has been banned. I asked them, ‚Äú so in the instances that there may have been an accidental ban or a ban that was initiated under false pretense, what do you do?‚Äù I have told ‚Äúrepresentatives‚Äù on this customer service system repeatedly that this ban was not justified and I would like to speak to a supervisor. 

This is by far the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life! I have invested a good amount of time and money into Tinder and for my experience as a valued customer to be disregard is very mind-boggling.
title: BANNED FOR NO REASON

review: It's pretty obvious that at this point it seems like some profile for a supposed person that appears to be near you will match with you. This "person" chats for a while and then ends up asking for your number. This "person" then texts you at fairly regular intervals, particularly first thing in the morning and to say good night in the evening. They each have a story but they stories are dry and generic. If you ask this "person" anything specific about where you both live, you basically get answers that you could find from a simple Google search. They put off meeting even though they supposedly live near you. Eventually that becomes pointless interaction and you end up just blocking them. Almost like clockwork, another profile matches with you a week or two later, and the same thing happens. But it seems to be an interval *designed* to keep you engaged--and thus paying--in the app. The entire app is seemingly just a SCAM. Don't bother.
title: Service scams you with bots to keep you paying

review:
I used Tinder ever since I turned 18 (I‚Äôm 19 now) I am a gay man and there aren‚Äôt many gay men in my area so I have it to just meet and communicate with people like me! I recently payed for Tinder for just one month to see if I could actually find anyone serious about dating. But before my one month trial ended I got on the app to see that I was banned. I was trying to think back to anything I could‚Äôve said or done that would‚Äôve triggered this‚Ä¶ but I could think of nothing that would violate the community guidelines because I am respectful and kind. I didn‚Äôt use any inappropriate pictures and I follow all the rules. 

It‚Äôs said because I tried to write to Tinder about my experience of being banned and because I wanted an explanation but they gave me a bogus response. I think it‚Äôs crazy that so many good people just get randomly banned. Tinder seriously and immediately needs to rethink this process because they‚Äôre banning a lot of genuine people who are serious about dating.

My time, money, and effort has been wasted and I am not too mad about it but it‚Äôs just the principle that this can happen is bothersome because I know I did nothing wrong.

Also, I was receiving random dm‚Äôs from random accounts on Instagram saying that I matched with them when I did not. Nor had I ever heard or seen this people before!? Maybe that had something to do with it‚Ä¶ like someone may have been using my pictures on a fake account!?
title: Banned for absolutely no reason

review:
Just spent our first Valentine‚Äôs Day together. Have faith y‚Äôall, this is like applying for jobs. You‚Äôll have a few bad ones or vice versa. Stick with it and don‚Äôt be a creep most of all. This app has a lot to offer. 

6 months after the right swipe (he actually super liked me lol) and I can‚Äôt believe it but I‚Äôm actually gonna say thank you to Tinder for coming through for me and bringing the most amazing, most supportive, funniest, sexiest, sweetest person into my life. I used Tinder in 3 countries for 3 years and, yes, I met absolute SCUM on this app. But I also met my favorite person on it. Of course you can always meet people other ways/on other apps, but you could also get lucky like we did. ‚ù§Ô∏è Protect your heart, don‚Äôt tolerate any disrespect, love yourself first, and good luck with your journey. ‚ù§Ô∏èTanks Tinder:) from both of us.
title: 6 months as of today

review:
I‚Äôve been swiping for a solid 15 minutes and all I‚Äôm seeing are profiles from 100, 700, 1,000, and even 4,000 miles away? I have my location set to a maximum of 20 miles. I can understand if someone was in the area for a bit and swiped on me, left the area, then them showing up. But that is really not likely when the last 50 profiles I swiped on are up to 4,000 miles away. I could also understand if someone was just outside my maximum distance by 5 or so miles. It‚Äôs really annoying. I don‚Äôt want to swipe on people that far away from me. Respect my distance settings, tinder. Just another ploy to keep people swiping.  üôÑ

Also, I reported someone last week because we hung out and he was pushing boundaries and wouldn‚Äôt stop even when asked. Not only is he still on the app, but he showed up on my swipes today. If someone is reported, at least be decent enough to not have their profile come up on the person who reported them‚Äôs swipes.
title: 4,000 miles away?  Reported person showing up

developerResponse: {'id': 39638419, 'body': "We're sorry to hear about this! We'd like to take a closer look at what you‚Äôre experiencing. Could you reach out to us at gotinder.com/help so we can help troubleshoot and hopefully improve your experience?", 'modified': '2023-10-20T13:53:57Z'}
review:
Gave Tinder a second chance after a few years, and absolutely no improvements have been made. I supposedly get all these ‚Äúlikes‚Äù so I thought it would be worth it to pay for the premium. Unfortunately when I like someone back to match, the chat automatically disappears. Every. Single. Time. I swear the likes on my profile are fake, and if so this is a very manipulative practice. Waste of my time and money. I would not have paid for the premium subscription if I knew this would be the case. I can see other people are commenting on this same issue, yet support does nothing to help them troubleshoot. 

Additionally, the app shows people that are outside of your orientation which is useless and confusing. This app is nothing but a cash grab, preying on people who will spend their hard earned money to try and find companionship. When it never truly delivers, but baits users to spend more $z Hinge is way better than this app, it truly is garbage.
title: Fake likes to bait you into purchasing premium, etc.

review:
The error is mine for thinking anything would change with tinder gold. I had more interactions without the upgrade. I absolutely want my money back. If there are not people in the area, cool, but get rid of the bots. 2/3 of the profiles I see on this app are bots! Quit with the circle jerk and pull it together tinder team. Oh and on top of allllll this, they make sure that there is no possible way for you to contact them.

Update; there is now method by which to contact anyone from tinder (it appears that was intentional). About 3/4 of all profiles are bots and even if you have tinder gold they still will not show you all those who are verified. They want you to go back through the whole stack to reclick on the same people. Overall, I had a better experience without Tinder Gold, it is why I want my money back. It would probably be a good idea to refund instead of waiting for the class action due to the manipulation of the program and false advertising of what the upgrade actually does.
title: DO NOT PURCHASE TINDER!!!

review: I‚Äôve used tinder on and off for 3 years. In 2019 It was very easy to get a match within the first hour of using. Now it‚Äôs nearly impossible to match with females. The algorithm is Based off payment now. If you don‚Äôt pay for Gold Plus Or Platinum. You won‚Äôt be shown in the stack or you‚Äôre at the very bottom below all the Paid users. You can swipe right all you want on females nearby, but they don‚Äôt pay for gold or platinum so they will never see you in their stack. Disappointing for all free users, even if you did pay for platinum membership you‚Äôd have a better experience. (Who would‚Äôve guessed it) apps not worth the download anymore, people aren‚Äôt on tinder to hookup they believe it‚Äôs eharmony or match now. It is what it is, if you‚Äôre in a similar situation just go beat off and you‚Äôll forget how depressing the app is seeing people who put social medias in their bio only to never respond and have their phone full of notifications they‚Äôll never open like it‚Äôs a trophy.
title: Pay To Match (for men at least)

review: I got out of my last relationship in October of 2021. Because i‚Äôm young, not in school, and working full time, I found it pretty hard to run into people naturally. So, after a couple months I finally cracked. I think I have been on and off this app a few times since December and I have matched with 3 people (all without any response). I have friends who seem to be the kingpins of dating apps, i‚Äôve made every change and mirrored exactly what works for them, the only difference is I refuse to put any money into this app. If you‚Äôre looking to actually meet someone, you‚Äôre in the wrong place if you‚Äôre on Tinder (unless you‚Äôre planning to dump half your salary into it). This app has slowly been rebuilt to cater to those who seek validation by seeing how many likes they‚Äôre getting, Tinder isn‚Äôt bringing anyone together. If you‚Äôre reading this and haven‚Äôt already had the worst experience of your life, I recommend you exhaust every other option before you even consider joining Tinder.
title: Waste of time

review:
Figured I‚Äôd come back all these years later and right a review. It‚Äôs been a little over 3 years since I‚Äôve been on this app. It was okay when I was using it. A lot of people match but don‚Äôt want to talk afterwards beyond saying hi and how‚Äôs your day going. Which is not the apps fault more of the person‚Äôs fault.

I can back to say that out of all the people who just said hi I meant someone 3 years ago who wanted a relationship behind hi how are you doing. Going so well we got married on our 3 year anniversary. Just figured I‚Äôd come back and say thank you Tinder for making it so my wife and I could meet. It‚Äôs the best thing that has ever happened to me. 

No more tinder for me but remember you have to say more than hi and how are you doing to build a relationship!
title: It WORKS IF you actually TRY!

review:
This is the support request I sent in. They haven‚Äôt responded yet, I‚Äôll edit when they do:

I tried to login to my old tinder account. I get to the page and it says I cannot be on tinder because I don‚Äôt meet the age requirements. It said I have zero days to wait for the ban to be lifted. I am 19 years old. I cannot make a new account since my phone number is tied to this account. I tried to verify my account through the drivers License ID verification. I sent in pictures of my ID and it said to come back later and check if it has been approved. I come back later and the same screen appears- you do not meet the age requirement, you have 0 days left to wait, verify your age? 

I then decided to download an app to get another free number. The account was made but I realized I didn‚Äôt get a single swipe. I am a young, attractive lady, and when I‚Äôve used Tinder before, I got over 200 matches within the span of an hour, each time I‚Äôve used it. I got another subscription for this account to be able to match more and STILL no matches, no swipes, nothing. I was hidden. I tried to delete this account, and once I tried, it would always show an error when I tried to delete it. I then just paused my card/account and logged out. 

I‚Äôm nervous after seeing some of the reviews, sounds like nothing is gonna be done about it. Not getting a new iCloud so I guess the app is useless now, unless something is fixed.
title: Banned Twice For No Reason

review: I was using this app last year for the first time. Under the impression that it was free, I thought it would be worth a try. After a few days, it said I had to upgrade to premium to match with any more profiles. I should have deleted the app right there and saved a lot of trouble, but I didn‚Äôt. After doing a one month trial the app said I can save money by doing a 6 month plan which I did, since it was taking me a while to get any luck. Shortly after that, I got banned from the app permanently for no reason. I looked up what could have happened but nothing applied to me. I only messaged the people I matched and was always respectful. When I looked for customer service there was no number, so I sent a nice email detailing my problem but never heard back. I still had to pay for this app until June. Warning to anyone thinking of using Tinder DON‚ÄôT! There are many places you can meet nice women or men in the real world which are much cheaper and more fun than any dating app.
title: Waste of time and money

review:
I give Tinder two stars because it offers a good service and has a nice layout/a lot of good profile features, but all of that gets lost in a swath of ads that come MUCH more frequently than on other apps and other frustrating bugs.

The character limit in bios is off and you can‚Äôt even use the full amount without it deleting some for you, you can‚Äôt unmatch or delete chats from an account that has been deleted, even when they‚Äôre not trying to sell you something there‚Äôs still a ‚Äúupdate this part of your profile!!1!1‚Äù all the time. 

All of the features that used to make this a good matchmaking app are now hidden behind egregious pay walls, the number of free daily likes is so much lower, no more free super likes ever, I am CONSTANTLY being shown a huge number of people outside of my distance, age, and gender settings, even though I have my settings set to only show people in those ranges.
title: far cry from what it used to be

review: As much as I loathe the changes to make this app pay to play, which I will never support again after hinge robbing me. I will say, I appreciate the work tinder has done to make this app more user friendly and taking more time to listen to feedback/ answer questions and support. Years prior, I could get banned, I could get hidden, or I could be shadowbanned without any warning or explanation. Years later, they‚Äôre now actively giving me matches without paying, they‚Äôve got much better options to put in the main about me so you don‚Äôt waste character space, and overall have done a lot to show who you are. I just hope they make the app more even/fair down the road for free and paid users so that way there‚Äôs not as much FOMO for not paying. Otherwise, great improvements! And def have come back to #1 dating app for the time being.
title: Fixing some models of the business aspect

review: This app is manipulative and plays games with the male psyche. If I had to guess, this app is engineered to keep guys in limbo of REQUIRING to pay at least 25$ to get anywhere fast as far as basic matching. I swear there is an insane amount of algorithms working against you under the hood. Also seems like there are a LOT of fake profiles thrown in the mix to fluff up the loot pool, along with people from unrealistic distances. The last thing they want is a quick in-and-out 20 minute adventure here on the T. This app has tripled in complexity since I last  used it (2.5 years ago) with all sorts of new reasons to coerce you into the various subscriptions, which are all way more expensive than I remember them ever being. Tinder is designed to take your fear of loneliness and dangle it in front of your face, and  make you feel like this is the only way that you will meet someone, and that buying into it will make things happen faster. Honestly, save your time and money and just avoid this cesspool altogether!!!
title: ‚ò£Ô∏èTOXIC!!!!‚ò£Ô∏è

review: I‚Äôve used this app for a little under a year and I‚Äôve had MANY ups and downs with the people on there, to the point where I would delete it multiple times because I got tired of it. But then I realized that I was the problem, with these kind of apps, you need to go in with the mindset of no expectations. I didn‚Äôt pay for any subscriptions either because I didn‚Äôt want that pressure. True that there are bots/weirdos and etc, but VS the majority, it doesn‚Äôt really make a difference. I became good friends with this super sweet guy, we had a platonic friendship for about half a year and now things have become romantic :) without this app, I would‚Äôve never met my best friend and my future boyfriend! The trials and tribulations were 100% worth it. Trust the process!!
title: Just give it time!

review: If you think the frustrations of tinder the app are bad, the frustrations of tinder the company are even worse. I was a paid member who one day received a message ‚Äúyou have been banned from tinder‚Äù without explanation. I am probably the most boring person ever, so this came as a big surprise. My best guess is that traveling for work (military service) triggered this somehow. I attempted to reach out to customer service to clear this up, but they simply referred me to a general link of their policies. I read the policies, none of which I violated. I contacted them again to explain this and fix this, but with the same result. Then I contacted them for a refund, which they refused to initiate. I had to go through my App Store and their own fraudulent charge process in order to get my money back. I provide this as a warning to other potential customers - tinder is not willing to have any customer service interactions with you. To this day, I remain banned, without explanation and nobody to appeal to.
title: Problem, Zero Customer Service

review:
Let me start off by saying I‚Äôve met some interesting people through this app over an extended period of time.  Nothing that has turned into more than a friendship but a great way to meet people with like minds.  However the last few months it has become flooded with fake profiles - photos of the same guy with 20 different names, fake photos - models obviously - and men who give both first and last names - total red flags.  I do my share of reporting those I know to be fake because of previous interactions but it‚Äôs got so bad lately.  

I tried a month of Tinder gold to see if it improved but it didn‚Äôt, although European men tend to be more responsive and legit. The interesting thing is that most of these fake profiles say they are 7k+ miles away which makes you wonder if there is a Fake Tinder HQ in the middle of Africa or something.  Enough already...
title: Not worth the time or money anymore

review: I was removed without so much as an argument with anyone because Tinder values homophobia and bigotry. When someone has never even talked to me, they deserve no power to pass judgment. I am strong but other marginalized people would give up after experiencing this discrimination and Tinder needs to resolve it because it is pure bigotry. I do not think that I even want to return after facing so much discrimination without talking to anyone. You should never give evil people that power and honestly, you should block those people for attacking my character when they don‚Äôt know anything about me. I‚Äôm ashamed of this app and can only think of the people that have died after facing this discrimination at their hands. At the time of this writing their has been no resolution and Tinder has lied publicly on Twitter that they can restore access to the account when all their customer support did was send a threatening email, which many would describe as evil based in extreme bigotry.
title: This app actively discriminated against me

review:
It‚Äôs a shame what‚Äôs happened to Tinder. What used to be a good way to meet people ‚Äî for a hookup, a date, or even a relationship ‚Äî has turned into a shameless cash grab. It has serious implications on society when one company owns all the major dating platforms that, unfortunately, are the main way an entire generation meets their romantic partners.

Ever since I got out of my last relationship, I‚Äôve been blown away by how terrible Tinder is. I‚Äôve tried it all: free, plus, gold, and now platinum. None of it does anything. If I get a match (which is rare), it‚Äôs somebody out of the distance preferences I set or someone I swiped on reluctantly. I‚Äôm fully convinced that the people I‚Äôd actually like to talk to just don‚Äôt see my profile at all.

I don‚Äôt know. Maybe too many people are using this now. But it‚Äôs clear that Tinder‚Äôs new ownership has prioritized selling literally useless packages to make a quick buck. In 2017, I could get a dozen matches a day for free in a small town. In a city 5X that size, I‚Äôm lucky if I get a dozen a month while paying for the ridiculously priced platinum package.

I‚Äôd say use Hinge or some other competitor, but the bad news is that they‚Äôre all owned by the same company. I hope that these apps eventually go so downhill that people are incentivized to actually talk to people at bars, parties, etc. again. Right now, this is just a playground for whoever the algorithm arbitrarily decides is attractive enough to be worth spit.
title: Downhill

review: I‚Äôve been on tinder for a while, and out of the blue sky, they send me an email that says I‚Äôve been banned. there‚Äôs no way to appeal or figure out why. They just took my money and kicked me off. I have no idea what I did to get banned. I‚Äôm a pretty normal guy and I had no inappropriate interactions or conversations or posts on my page. I suspect my ex had something to do with it , as I have had problems with her cyber stalking me. I had to file a police report about her and everything. In any case, these guys just kicked me off, banned me and never told me why. But they sure kept my money. if they are going to take your money they could at least contact you to see if there is may be something going on. Before they ban you. It‚Äôs very shady and it‚Äôs a helpless feeling.. They just keep your money and don‚Äôt tell you anything. If you give them access to your money only buy one month at a time because then they can‚Äôt steal your cash at least.
title: Do not join this app or give them access to your money

review:
This app is truly an evil that will destroy men and society. It completely gives all the power to women. The ratio of men to women is so skewed that it‚Äôs disgusting. There must be 100s of guys for every girl. It also constantly spams you for money and shadow bans you or doesn‚Äôt show you to matches unless you pay. Any woman you meet here is going to be beyond toxic; talking to dozens of guys picking her ‚Äúwinner‚Äù it promotes treating men as disposable trash. If you so much as blink wrong in her precence, she‚Äôll pick another one from the 100s she has in the queue. You as a man mean nothing to the women here. This is such a toxic and unhealthy app that it should be made illegal. 
It sort of remind me of jim crow laws back in the day. But now its men who have to sit in the back of the bus. These apps need to implement something like women are only allowed to chat with one man at the time and when they start a new interaction the previous person is notified and deleted. 
Do your sanity a favor and stay as far away as possible from this nightmare of an experience
title: Stay away

review: I've been on and off tinder for many years and it's greatest strength is that it is indeed very easy to bump into a ton of local people and make friends/find a lover. However my experience last spring (2021) was baffling, freighting and aggravating. I had matched with 15/20 people and was very busy with work and dating someone I had met on it so was hardly on Tinder itself but maybe every couple weeks would check for messages etc. Well during this time of inactivity someone kept reporting my account every time it appeared in their stack! (Likely a spiteful ex) So naturally I open up the app one day and it announces my account has been banned. I tried to contact customer service to figure out why or what happened but was met with "oh sorry you're just banned, there's no appeal, we take violations seriously". Really? What violations happened from me forgetting about the app for a month and not interacting with it or any users? Like I said scary and confusing, specially in the day and age we live in
title: Fun but troubled

review:
Please respond to this:
This is the third time this has happened to me: I match with a girl we are having a conversation then I got unmatched in the middle of the conversation, there was no indication that the conversation was going south. So I just brushed it off and continued swiping. A few days later the match appeared on my queue again and tried to apologize for what happened but at this point they really are mad at me now and I lost my chance which made me come to the conclusion that the app is un matching me. At first I thought it was her the second time maybe something happened. But now it happened again and I am just waiting for the match to pop up again and this time they will genuinely be mad at me and not reply. Please let us decide if we want to pursue that person rather than deciding for us. 
Also yes there are a lot of prostitutes and potheads that pop up and bots that want to get me to send them money. Please fix this.
title: No match for you

review: Something is not right about the distance from people I see from my location. It‚Äôll say someone could be like 2 miles away but there city is more like 20-25 miles away. Or 20 miles away and more like 40-70 miles away. I even seen where someone  supposedly in Chicago and I‚Äôm in California and it said 2 miles away. Um ok yeah right. And other thing literally can‚Äôt seem to do jack on this app for free other than swiping. Lucky to get one match to message. But get likes you can‚Äôt even see who it is. But after paying gold now not getting any likes whatsoever. While my buddy which is probably about the same as me as far as his looks is getting likes and matches left and right. Only difference is he doesn‚Äôt have an iPhone. And the amount of fake accounts is insane. Is tinder the ones making the fake accounts. Makes me wonder.
title: People within distance not right

review: This is a huge pool of people giving up their personal information to strangers using fake pictures. The screening process is a joke. And once you give someone your phone number a lot of scammers will start sending you text messages and pictures of Asians, Germans, Australians etc And telling you a fake history that was a honest mistake. I really believe that the same Tinder hire people to keep you texting here and using fake profiles to keep you paying a membership lying to you that someone really like you and may want to know you. If you are not able to have a video call during your first month of membership I will strongly suggest you to stop making payments here. All those LIKES are mostly FAKES. I renewed my membership several times after the expiration thinking that someone like me. Now I believe that this app generates fake likes using fake profiles only to keep you paying. Stay away of this app. I used the app for about 3 months without any luck.
title: 8/10 are Scammers

review: Against my better judgment, I reluctantly signed up for a month of Tinder Gold. Low and behold, I was charged for THREE months. Instead of paying $30, I was charged $60. Well, since I have payed for the service, I have received few likes, very few matches and my matches disappear when I try to engage in ice-breaking conversations. So I payed $60 to get less attention on this app!?!?! Also, I went through a divorce last year. I‚Äôm ready to start fresh, and I feel like this app literally creates false hope that I may find love. Which is absolutely trash to my confidence and mental health. I feel it is designed to try to hook me so when my three months are up, I will pay again for the pointless, wasteful service. DO NOT be fooled. Save your money. This app does not work as suggested. The algorithm is purposely hiding profile pics, and only showing specific available people in an area. A lawsuit should be filed against this app and developer. I think I will delete and just be single the rest of my existence.
title: Scam

review: With their ridiculous pricing, you‚Äôd think Tinder had discovered some secret magic in the dating app world. Nope. Same crap, different app. Their paywalls are so out of control that the app essentially useless. What‚Äôs the point of an app that I can‚Äôt use without paying!!? It‚Äôs like going to a restaurant, being given a menu and then having the waiter tell you of you want to actually read the menu, you have to pay more. Then you have to pay more if you want to order from the menu. Then you have to pay more if you want to eat. Then you have to pay more if you want to use the restroom. More cash if you want to have your water refilled. More money if you want to ask your waiter for another napkin. Then you have to pay more money if you want to use that napkin. review:
Been using tinder for 7 years and it has declined in function. Instagram pictures don't display properly, app freezing after I send a message, and not to mention seemingly fake profiles and scammers frequently showing up on my feed. 

I upgraded to tinder platinum because regular tinder is a joke but here, it‚Äôs still bad. It claims to give 5 new super likes a week and one boost a month BUT they don‚Äôt compound (use em or lose em). This is a scam considering super likes don‚Äôt really add up to anything. Many times, you get shown a profile that has been inactive for months and Tinder goes on to prompt you to use your super likes (mind game manipulation) because the person‚Äôs profile is ‚Äúpopular‚Äù and you‚Äôll get a better chance to match (matching is meaningless) I doubt the legitimacy of what Tinder is proposing and think they just want you to burn your super likes so you buy more. Also, many use the app to re direct you to other apps (snap/instagram thirst traps/scams) or onlyfans üôÑ

Improvements: increase standards for entry. Only verified accounts. Make reporting scammers/fakes/bait easier. Fix bugs. Stop with the manipulative prompts. Transparency. Compound superlikes and boosts. Allow to delete old matches we didn‚Äôt message. Be honest 

Things better than Tinder:
Therapist + meeting people in person 
Hinge dating app
Cultivating friendships 
Anything else

review: I used this app for many years and met some really cool people. I was always polite and was never once reported. After the coup took place in Myanmar I felt compelled to do something, so I changed my location to Myanmar and offered in my bio to help protesters with sharing videos and organizing. After a few days my account was banned for- who knows what but I received nothing but gratitude and appreciation from my matches. It is infuriating that I could be banned for doing one of the most humane things I‚Äôve ever done. I can understand the circumstances that would lead to an accidental ban, maybe they marked me as spam or something, but the fact that I am now banned for life without any possibility of review (you have no ban appeal) makes me want to take this to a news outlet. I know tinder got in trouble for banning BLM protesters and I don‚Äôt see how this is any different. The app overall is so great and it was super fun for so many years but it just feels so unfair to be banned FOREVER, for a mistake

2. Download the latest build from the App Store 
3. Go thru the onboarding flow
4. When Tinder asks if I want notifications, I say ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Allow‚Äù
5. Finish the onboarding and close the app
6. Go to Settings > Notifications and look for Tinder 

Expected result: Tinder should be on the list in its alphabetical order to allow me to modify settings
Actual result: Tinder is not on the list at all

ALTERNATE Steps to recreate Issue 2:
1. Delete Tinder
2. Download the latest build from the App Store 
3. Go thru the onboarding flow
4. When Tinder asks if I want notifications, I say ‚ÄúALLOW‚Äù
5. Finish the onboarding and close the app
6. Go to Settings > Notifications and look for Tinder 

Expected result: Tinder should be on the list in its alphabetical order 
Actual result: Tinder *IS* on the list
title: 16.0.3 iPhone 14 Pro Notification Bugs

review: I have had tinder for over a years time and have most likely spent 100+ in subscriptions and so forth but yet today when I go to log into the app it tells me my account has been banned and now I cannot make a new account or even be informed of what happened for myself to be banned. I contacted support in hope that it was a simple fix but as I write a long drawn out message to support I am emailed back almost immediately being told that there is nothing I can do and so once again I asked why I had been banned and that if I need to provide some sort of information to fix my account I would do so but the reply I received basically was a tinder representative telling me that there was nothing they can do for they do not offer an appeal service and with this being said I wish to have the money I spent on the app back since they do not want to help a loyal customer such as myself. Very disappointed with the folks at tinder for doing this.
title: Banned for no apparent reason

review: I had just turned 18 a few days ago and wanted to download tinder. I tried to create an account (i‚Äôve never made an account before) but right after I confirmed my number it said I was age restricted. So I contacted support and let them know what was going on. All she told me was I was banned for violating the terms which makes no sense because this was my first time creating an account. So I tried to explain that and asked the reason for the ban in which she continued to respond by saying, ‚ÄúYour account has been banned for violations of our Terms of Use or Community Guidelines‚Äù instead of actually communicating with me and trying to resolve the issue. After trying to explain to her one last time she simply said the same thing and that ‚ÄúWe are unable to provide further assistance, and so we may not respond to additional requests about this case‚Äù when no assistance was ever provided. The support team is terrible and I will not be recommending this app.
title: Terrible support team

review: It‚Äôs really sad hearing you guys banned an absolute TON of people for no reason and are just giving us all the same excuse.. so many of us were using it properly and normally and we‚Äôre fine I haven‚Äôt had the app for over a year and I got back on cause my relationship ended and my ex‚Äôs account was fine but I was banned for no reason I previously had a clean profile no nude no swearing I never made anyone uncomfortable if anything they made me uncomfortable. And not to mention when I try to call your ‚Äúsupport‚Äù phone number it‚Äôs an aggressive dial tone the biggest high pitch sound I‚Äôve ever heard before and then you have no support email, your support Twitter don‚Äôt work, your website just leads to a dead end when looking for help, you guys have no care for your customers‚Ä¶ we just want our stuff back.. you truly need to do better this isn‚Äôt fair to all of us who did nothing wrong and are being unfairly blamed for someone else‚Äôs issues and bad behavior. Figure it out guys.
title: Bans

review:
It would appear I have fallen in this category and not knowing it till signs started popping up. I have used tinder for years and have always had very good luck but noticed a significant amount of profiles and matches not occurring, indicating I‚Äôve been shadow banned.  I googled it to learn more and it is ridiculous that is allowed. I use premium services and that should yield
More matches; platinum, boosts and super likes and it does nothing. This is a scam warranted reporting to the Better Business Bureau . If I am shadow banned, I should be notified prior to purchasing premium services so I have a choice to spend that money knowing I will be limited to no results or value from money spent but I at least had a choice knowing I was banned. I hope someone on the App sees these reviews and takes this serious and what legal ramifications can come of it with today‚Äôs scrutinization of technological business dealings.
title: Agree with frustration on bans

review:
Hopefully someone from Tinder reaches out to me. I was an active Tinder user for years. Bought Gold subscriptions every now and then. My profile hasn‚Äôt really changed. Nothing that would violate any Terms of Service and community guidelines. Recently I bought Gold for a year, had a few nice conversations with potential dates and then I‚Äôm suddenly banned. I‚Äôve broken none of the guidelines but the only thing that I‚Äôve done since was buy Tinder Gold. Now I‚Äôm trying to figure out why I‚Äôve been banned. There‚Äôs no appeals.  
This really bums me out, you guys are losing willing paying subscription customer by not communicating as to why there was a ban. I‚Äôve reached out but all I get is the same message that I violated the community guidelines but offer no reason on my account. I hope someone reaches out to me on this because then your competition ends up getting the money I would have spent on you guys and I feel I‚Äôm not the only one on this.
title: Paid for subscription then banned

review: Tinder has come along way in providing as much information upfront and making the access of information. Easy to navigate know if the Tinder cards good take the pee out of the dating pool that would be even better! Kidding of course. The one thing I can‚Äôt figure out why the tinder gods haven‚Äôt noticed or haven‚Äôt changed‚Ä¶is the Interest Category not all of the interests are available to me. Spirituality is one of the biggest interests that I have. However, it‚Äôs not available as an option which is really frustrating. Tinder gods, can you change that so that I have the option to choose spirituality as my interest tab? I don‚Äôt want a partner that doesn‚Äôt understand how important spirituality is for me and would be in any potential relationship.
title: Tinder is great for what it is a dating site

review: I set up my account and when I got into my account it kept showing a ‚Äúhuman verification‚Äù message over 5x. My account was already pictured verified. It put my account into review saying it‚Äôd ‚Äúbe a few minutes‚Äù..it took 2 days for it to pop up I‚Äôve been banned for violating terms of service. I emailed the customer service, in case it was a verification that flagged the system or something. Their response to me was ‚ÄúUnfortunately, we cannot provide any more detailed information at this time‚Äù then told me to refer to the terms of service. It seems like the service isn‚Äôt run by actual people. I sent a second email asking for what term I violated and was given the same exact message with a different customer service name with no further explanation. It doesn‚Äôt make any sense how they can ‚Äúban you‚Äù without saying why over their glitchy app. I am over 21, I only posted photos of myself (nothing that was explicit) and I hadn‚Äôt matched or message anyone.
