It‚Äôs the algorithm which is designed to do nothing but make money and keep you using it for as long as possible which is extremely immoral, problematic and unethical. Even though the Tinder‚Äôs interface is sleek, intuitive and fun to use, I cannot recommend this app to most men.
title: Artificial intelligence algorithm ruins experience for men

review: like countless of other people that have left reviews, i was banned from tinder for apparently no reason. i‚Äôve barely been on the app as it is, and when i was, it was simply normal conversations. that‚Äôs why i was extremely surprised that i opened the app this afternoon and saw my account was banned. the support email is absolutely no help, all they do is give a general message. even when i asked for an actual reason for the ban, even if i couldn‚Äôt get my account back, i got no clear response. don‚Äôt you think it‚Äôs time to finally create an appeals process, tinder? it‚Äôs also REALLY interesting to me how the majority of other people i know that have been banned for seemingly no reason have also been queer and/or women...this app is a scam, they don‚Äôt care about users at all. that‚Äôs evident by the fact that a lot of these reviews are from people that experienced the same thing as me and they‚Äôve done nothing.
title: banned for no reason

review:
I have been using the app for about 4 years. It‚Äôs great for meeting new people when you move and I‚Äôve gone on a few dates as well. However, I recently got banned without warning, I looked up this issue and apparently 20% of men get banned from tinder and it‚Äôs only been more strict over time. 
When I contacted tinder asking to know why I was banned and if I could appeal, they sent me a copy and pasted message of ‚Äúwe take our community very seriously, please read our user terms of services to know why‚Äù over and over.
It‚Äôs very annoying in this day and age during a pandemic to be banned from one of the only safe ways of meeting people with no explanation, especially since I think my banning was a mistake. I try to be very respectful to people online and after reading the terms, I don‚Äôt feel like I seriously broke any of them. It‚Äôs very unprofessional for a company to run their costumer services with just copy and pasted responses it feels very disingenuous.
title: Banned for No Good Reason

review: I tried creating a new profile account after deleting mine for months, and found out that someone was using my phone number on their account. When I wanted to delete this person‚Äôs account, I wasn‚Äôt able to get past the verification page because logging in through a different device probably triggered that. I submitted my pictures for verification (even though they weren‚Äôt the same as the ones on this impersonator‚Äôs profile) I was not given the chance to even delete the account but instead they banned my phone number, device ID, and any identifier that‚Äôs linked to me. When I reached out to customer support, and explained what‚Äôs going on, they were gaslighting me and said that there‚Äôs no way for them to unban me because I ‚Äúviolated their user agreement policy‚Äù. That‚Äôs what happens when your information is hijacked and apps simply do not care about ensuring that your data is secure.
title: Terrible customer support

review: Historically I have had pretty bad luck on this app and dating apps in general. Either with meeting total creeps or just struggling to find people I connected with. Just like everybody else I would download and delete the app over and over and go on dates and get discouraged. But right when I was about to give up and delete Tinder again I met the absolute most amazing human I have ever met and we are celebrating our six month anniversary next week. My younger brother also met his significant other on Tinder and they are coming up on a year and a half now and just moved in together. So for anyone as skeptical as I was, it can work. It might just take a little while and a lot of luck. But there are good people out there and some of them apparently use Tinder :P
title: Pleasantly Shocked

review:
I have been a loyal client to tinder for 3 plus years. I do my best to keep it fun and lighthearted. But it‚Äôs starting to wear thin how many fake profiles are here. It‚Äôs to the point of being ridiculous. I just paid for a double boost and got 15 likes and 12 were fake. If you check my account, you‚Äôll see how much money I spend here. But as of late, it‚Äôs really discouraging and everyone I talk to who is on tinder has the same complaint. I know the argument of being verified or checked on, is not working. The time that has been wasted, and the money that has been spent is now a major concern of mine. There is a large amount of young Asian women occupying so much space on tinder. I don‚Äôt have the answers and I want to continue being a customer of Tinder but I‚Äôm starting to get really tired. I apologize for the complaint but something needs to be done. Thank you so much.
Brian
title: Why so many scammers

review: After using tinder for years without any incident whatsoever, my account has been suddenly banned. After reviewing their terms of use and community guidelines, I emailed them and said I had read them and not seen anything I might have done wrong. I got automated replies or at the very least scripted, and no resolution. I asked them for information as to a reason and to speak with someone who can resolve the issue, and got another scripted reply referring to their documents. I am now trying to take legal action against them and urge anyone who has had their account banned to have a lawyer contact them regarding your account. At the very least reach out and organize. Tinder is very important to me as a gay male, we don‚Äôt always get to meet people in real life, we rely on this app. I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs the reason I was banned but I can‚Äôt find another reason nor will they tell me.
title: Banned for no reason, automated support messages, no appeals process

review: So in the first 24-48 hours you‚Äôll get enough likes to make you want to sign up. About 70% of those will be real people. After this period you‚Äôll only see people 50+ miles or more away from you so the app suggests you increase the mileage - because sure we all want to meet people that live a few hours away - and also increase the age range. This will of course bring more people into the fold but it will be a rarity you see someone real within your desired distance range. I suspect the same occurs to women but it seems the goal is to get men to sign up and just keep suckering them in. I got the Gold membership so I could see the likes and one seemed real until she suggested I find her on ‚Äúallonew com‚Äù which I searched for and it‚Äôs Ashley Madison lol so sure I‚Äôll go pay money to look for you there even though I‚Äôve already connected with you here! üòÇ Lol I‚Äôve no problem paying but my message is buyer beware!
title: Pretty close to a scam

review: At least with Grindr you can appeal bans and they sort of tell you why sometimes you were banned maybe you posted something you shouldn‚Äôt etc or if they made a mistake they will unban you but with this company they don‚Äôt tell you anything and you can‚Äôt appeal it and to be honest Grindr use to ban for no reason but now most times you have to do something they will look into it but tinder does not care they take your money and run ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a scam for sure the automated system ban is lazy and they don‚Äôt want to pay people to work to fix this ban issue so Everyone gets banned even if someone reports you because you look good or you not into them or the sex or whatever the reason ‚Ä¶ this has got to be one of the worse apps and it‚Äôs sad gay people have to deal with this mess to be honest I suggest you do not pay for this app and read reviews and you will see most of them are bad and for the life of love please do not pay for this app
title: Wow

review:
I‚Äôve deleted and created new account multiple times. Each time there are inconsistencies when it come to the number of matches and actually finding out who liked you. I bought gold thinking this will fix the issue since it promotes being able to have super likes, boost (which should increase matches), and other things. Well, when I bought gold I rarely received any matches or when I did receive a notification that someone liked me and I opened it to view it, a pop up will show up and say ‚Äúno one at this time liked you, please go to discovery and swipe‚Äù. 

This app and this subscription has flaws and inconsistencies that need to be addressed. I have been using tinder on/off since college. In my option this app has changed so much, and the majority of the change has not been good. A lot of money grabbing from the developers and misleading marketing.
title: Not consistent and Gold subscription is a scam

review: Literally any other app.  Every few months I think, maybe something is different and tinder might work.  So recently, after getting matched with HUNDREDS of spammer over the years in different countries, I finally move back to Atlanta and think - what the heck let‚Äôs pay the platinum fee and give it a shot.  Obviously, most of the matches are still fake profiles or scam profiles. That‚Äôs fine, I wasn‚Äôt too mad about that.  Then my friend and roommate shows me how on HIS tinder he has a button for ‚Äúplaces‚Äù with all these great features.  Wow that is super cool.  I can match with only verified people?  I wish I had that all these years!  In fact I can‚Äôt even get it now.  After about 10 google searches I find some info to locate how to do it, but the directions don‚Äôt work in the tinder I have.  Is there some helpful support function?  Nope?  Any number to call?  Nope?  Don‚Äôt be like me. Save your money. Go literally ANYWHERE else.
title: 10 wasted years

review:
I already see many reviews like the one I‚Äôm about to write but I‚Äôm going to write it anyways üòÇ for literally no reason everyday I‚Äôm getting asked for
Verification of my account or
To pose for pictures to verify I‚Äôm real. Im not sure if others report me or ask the app to verify me cause i read online that some members (paid ones) only want to match with others
 verified members so my thought is they try to force me to verify myself for that reason ?  
They literally shut down my account for no reason and now I can‚Äôt even delete it. The app should at least wipe all my info off of my account before they lock me out of it. There are already so many fake accounts on dating apps and you‚Äôre coming after the real people like please
title: Tinder is trash

review:
I‚Äôve used Tinder over the years and never had much if a technical issue, but this app is broken. It always shows the same profiles as soon as I restart it after closing. I‚Äôve reinstalled it and tried the desktop version, turned off my VPN and all my add blockers, and it still does the same thing. It also refuses to work unless I turn on my location, then uses the location of my server, even when the VPN is off, which puts me in a major city about 100 miles away - so the app will say the person is six miles away and, surprise! They are 106miles away. I put in the location of my city, but the app completely ignores it. I have no idea how to fix this and ‚Äúsupport‚Äù is just a bloated and useless ‚ÄúFAQ‚Äù they made up with the most generic questions and answers.

I can‚Äôt suggest something that doesn‚Äôt work and I can‚Äôt be the only person this is happening to. I‚Äôd give zero stars if I could.
title: Broken App No Support

review:
Tinder banned me for no reason and with no explanation. I had barely used the app, wrote nothing even remotely disrespectful in my profile or messages, posted no lurid photos. Readers may be skeptical, but I really didn‚Äôt. When I asked for the reason for the ban, they refused to tell me anything and simply referred me to the terms of service. This mysterious ban is final and there is no appeal.  I have no idea whether it is the result of a  mistake, a complaint, or something else. It‚Äôs bizarre, deeply offensive and Kafkaesque. Apple should not even offer an app that is run this mindlessly. If it‚Äôs not a violation of the terms of service of the App Store, it should be. 

As for the app itself, it is not ideal, but there is no point in going into that here. For now, just know that you can go to the trouble of signing up and setting up a profile only to be banned without explanation despite doing nothing even a little bit questionable.
title: Should be removed from the App Store

review: They shadowban. It's also filled with bots and ugly, fat women. My advice for a guy reading this; buy a flashlight. Tinder is only worth using if you're rich, got a mansion and a boat so you'll certainly meet women on here but if you're a guy that has all that I don't know why you would need tinder anyway? But the quality is just degraded so much. App was way better years back. Now they force an agenda, just like any other company. But the app itself has so much clutter and unnecessary addons. The biggest issue is how they shadowban so you cant get any matches or just ban your cell phone number. Eventually you run out of numbers and can't ever sign up. Even if you get a different number they shadowban IP or payment method. I think this is a way for tinder to keep off certain people off the app forever. They've made their money so now it's onto the agenda thing, regardless if they lose money and permanently remove customers.
title: They shadowban

review: I‚Äôve been a user off & on for maybe 10 years now & I can speak from experience when I say this app has just became a money making dating scam. Went from free super like or more every whenever to you have to buy them even with plus or better you‚Äôre limited & timed. Features have been removed slowly which makes using this app for free pointless. When I did pay just to experiment, weird things that made me wonder happened. I‚Äôve matched with women who don‚Äôt pop up in my who ‚Äúlike me‚Äù tab. Would randomly run out of women in my area. Etc‚Ä¶ Now there are weekly subscriptions! What a joke! I can also say I‚Äôve had more success for matches & dates on other apps living in 3 different cities. Which I find very suspicious seeing that this is a top app with way more users.
title: Gotta Spend $$$ For Results

review: I was banned completely out of the blue without any reason giving besides ‚Äúviolating guidelines.‚Äù I‚Äôm assuming someone I accidentally left on read reported me for something random. I‚Äôd only messaged a few people the last mount and it was to give them my social media since I‚Äôm not active enough on tinder. But instead of looking into it, tinder just banned my account and banned me from making any accounts in the future. The instructions said to unsubscribe and delete. I contacted support because I had already paid for premium for a year and had only had the app a few months. I sent them my ID in case someone reported me as underage, stated I did not violate the guidelines and wanted proof or my money or account back. I got an automated response saying I violated guidelines- again, no specifics - and that there was no appeal process. My account is banned and the money I spent on it is wasted. Great customer serviceüôÑ
title: Banned with no explanation.

review: This App used to be very convenient with results! But now its a super expensive mess. First off the Gold isn‚Äôt even worth it. You get to see who likes you, and thats about it. The price of that has gone up quite a bit! Platinum literally just gives you some super likes (emphasis on the some) and quote on quote ‚Äúprioritizes your likes‚Äù. This is quite false. I know many people who had Platinum and there luck wasn‚Äôt good at all either. The price is just not worth it. You shouldn‚Äôt have to pay so much to have boosts as well. I feel like if you buy Gold you should have as many boosts as you want. We are paying for this service. Not too mention its nothing but scammers now too. Many claim they added me from Tinder on my Snap even though they never added me on the app and they end up being total scammers! Its almost like a MeetMe situation now. Drastically lower the price, give us more options with gold.
title: This app has gone so downhill

review: For context, I‚Äôm a cisgender female. I feel that my account on Tinder was banned for no reason. I never even got a warning email saying my account was under review; I was on the app this morning and everything was fine, but when I tried to log on in the afternoon it said my account had been banned. I went through all the terms of service and community guidelines and cannot find any violation I may have committed. I have always been respectful towards my matches and cannot think of anything I could have done wrong. I‚Äôve been searching online for reasons I might have been banned and I really think it was due to unfair ‚Äúrevenge reporting‚Äù from matches who were angry that I didn‚Äôt respond fast enough. I‚Äôm very dismayed - I‚Äôve been on the receiving end of several inappropriate messages and just unmatched/ignored them; all I wanted was to just find a boyfriend but I guess I can‚Äôt do that anymore.
title: Banned for no reason, like everyone else

review: Sadly, the app has been taken over by fake profiles. Easily more than 40% of accounts I come across are clearly scammers, but unlike other dating apps, Tinder refuses to take the steps that could end this (such as requiring accounts to be verified and preventing users from switching out the photos on an account after it‚Äôs verified). And contacting them repeatedly about this to see what they‚Äôre doing about it has just gotten me blown off by customer service. Again, this isn‚Äôt a significant issue on the other apps (Bumble, Hinge, League, OKC, etc.), so it‚Äôs obviously solvable. And Tinder are obviously aware of the issue, so it‚Äôs hard not to conclude they are just fine with their legitimate users being preyed on by criminals so long as their engagement metrics are being met. I‚Äôve been a paying user for quite a while, but I‚Äôm done. They won‚Äôt get another dime from me. Download something different. Your time will be better spent.
title: Scam city

review: Tinder is a great app if you‚Äôre looking to match with someone and then probably never talk to them again, but there will be that one girl you meet on there that you truly connect with and share everything in common with. That experience alone is insane, to find someone that is like you in some many ways yet you‚Äôve never met them until now. Tinder helped me meet my beautiful girlfriend and for the last 9 months we‚Äôve been together. These last 9 months have been the best ever. Truly you never know whose out there just waiting to make your life amazing. I met someone I want to spend the rest of my life with and that‚Äôs all because of Tinder. Thank you devs at Tinder!!
title: Wild rollercoaster

review: The app has changed over the years for the worst. Just like any business they have pushed harder and harder to create larger profits but without adding any value to the app itself. Also there is the shadow banning aspect instead of tinder banning you from the app all together, They will put a shadow ban on your account where you are invisible to others. It will not tell you this has happened instead you will just continue to spend money with no results, and no clue that this is going on ( stealing if you ask me). If you are shadow banned from my understanding it‚Äôs not as simple as just creating a new account. You cannot use the same Phone number, Apple ID, or Facebook. Also could be linked to your IP address. So probably not worth the headache go out be social meet people the normal way it is much safer than tinder in my opinion and you will have to meet the person eventually anyway right?
title: Not what it once was!!!

review:
Tinder is, essentially, just an app for one-night stands. That may sound obvious, but to me it wasn‚Äôt (initially).

I have met people off of Tinder before for actual dates before, but most of what I have found is: 

1. People trying to advertise their OnlyFans.
2. People trying to sell nudes (or feet pics).
3. Bots
4. People looking for a plug.
5. People looking for a sugar daddy.

If you‚Äôre looking for a relationship (or anyone who isn‚Äôt after your money only), you‚Äôd be better off using a different app. This app may have been developed, originally, for dating but that‚Äôs not what it‚Äôs used for now.

For me, this app made it difficult to have and to keep a relationship as I would think of the girls that I could be with via Tinder. Psychologically speaking, there are three things that make you stay in a relationship:
1. Investment into that relationship
2. *Availability of other people*
3. Time in that relationship
Availability is, typically, the most difficult. However, dating apps (and hookup apps, like Tinder) make you feel as though there is a million different people out there, all at your fingertips. They might be, or they might not. It can mess with your head though.

TLDR: Tinder bad for dating, good for hookups, overall: meh.
title: Not a ‚ÄúDating‚Äù app

review: I had a tinder account back in July of 2021 but I deleted it cuz I found someone at the time. Just as of a yesterday I tried making an account and I come to find out I‚Äôve been banned. How could I possibly do anything to be banned if my account was deleted by me manually?? Even when my account was active I never harassed anyone, used inappropriate pictures, wrote anything offensive in my bio, I‚Äôm not underage and I‚Äôm not going around catfishing people so I don‚Äôt get it. I tried emailing them and someone by the name of Harley got back with me late last night and said I was banned for violating terms of service but wouldn‚Äôt tell me what exactly so pretty much I‚Äôm permanently banned not knowing why, if I want to use this app again I‚Äôd have to use a different phone number which is ridiculous so my advice for everyone is don‚Äôt waste your time with this rubbish app you gotta pay to get all the decent features anyways.
title: Banned for no reason

review:
Tinder is a good app for people seeking conventional or unconventional relationships . Like most dating apps, it has its share of people who are trying to separate You from your wallet. It is YOUR responsibility to make sure that YOU  actually verify the identity of any person  you communicate with. A good tule of thumb: If a person cannot talk with you by telephone or video chat, chances are they are up to no good,

Never give anyone access to personal information or send ANYONE MONEY. Report those people asking for money or personal information  to the site immediately.

Give Tinder a chance; follow their rules, and my suggestions, and have fun. Who knows: HE or SHE might just be a right swipe away. Good Luck! He
title: Review:

review: How many times do I have to swipe left and right on the same people? I‚Äôm like, IN LOVE with this one woman, but I‚Äôve swiped right on her literally over a dozen times. I see the same people over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over. I‚Äôve had this app for over a week and not a single match. Probably because my app isn‚Äôt recognizing I‚Äôm actually swiping on people, because I keep seeing them over and over and.... you get the point. I‚Äôve emailed ‚Äúsupport‚Äù, and haven‚Äôt heard anything back. Reading other reviews I understand why. Fix your app! To the consumers, do NOT spend money until they fix it!
title: Discovery doesn‚Äôt work

review:
As I was sitting, doing nothing, I received a notification telling me that my procrastination was epic.  I‚Äôm sorry that my life is busy and I don‚Äôt have time to swipe left or right on YOUR whim, Tinder.

I literally felt more insulted by this one notification than I have in my life.  Why on earth would I continue to use an app that insults me for being busy and not following what they consider to be a regular schedule?  The fact that they think this is an acceptable way to treat a paying customer is absolutely deplorable.  If I went to a physical store, or even an online retailer, and they told me how I was wrong or lazy for not shopping with them more frequently, I would let the world know how how wrong they were.  Just because Tinder is an online dating platform does not give them the right to insult me.  I recommend everyone stay away.  No one deserves to be insulted because they have a busy life or can‚Äôt invest their time swiping on Tinder‚Äôs timeline.
title: This app is insulting to older users

review: I am newly 18 and I figured why not sign up since a lot of people use the app. Long story short, I got age restricted for some reason, and when I sent in pictures of my ID to prove that I was of age, it didn‚Äôt go through in the time they said it would, so I did what everyone else would‚Äôve done and emailed customer support. I got the pleasure of speaking with Adam. Adam was the least helpful person possible. Adam just told me that because of the violation to their terms of use and community guidelines, that I am banned from further use of the app. He didn‚Äôt even give a care to ask proof of identification or anything. I sent a follow up email asking if it meant I was banned forever because it was unclear in the first message, and what do you know. He sent me THE SAME UNCLEAR MESSAGE. I hope they are happy with the way they are treating their users because they sure don‚Äôt get paid enough and it shows with their work. Do better
title: Terrible

review:
I used to have zero problems with this app and had plenty of success on it. Now I have to log out and log back in to even do things as basic as see the message I was notified about. My matches can go from 2,000+ down to 60 then back to 2000+ in between all of those logins. Matches appear and disappear along with chats/messages, chats from months or even years ago are suddenly moved to the top of the chat feed while the most recent ones move to the very bottom. 

Much of what used to be basic functions available to all users is now placed behind a paywall. Just to provide one example if memory serves, you used to get five free super-likes a day now you have to pay to even get one; I refuse to pump money into any of these dating apps both on principle and because who on earth would trust them with their payment info when their app is this much of a glitchy mess?
title: Gets worse with each update

review: So I used tinder periodically but when I met someone I clicked with I would close my account and delete the app. Recently downloaded it again and tried to sign in to make sure that I didn‚Äôt still have any accounts up before signing up brand new. Then a day later I open up the app to find that I‚Äôm banned, after reviewing the terms of service, the only thing I can think I‚Äôve been banned for is their policy on multiple accounts? They didn‚Äôt tell the reason for the banning. I tried to contact the help desk via email but they gave me a pre-typed fish food reply that seems like they just forward to everyone. I‚Äôve deleted the app now completely, I‚Äôm a bit disappointed but there are other dating apps so I‚Äôm not really that upset. But just a warning to anyone, if you use this to date and delete after you‚Äôve met someone, they won‚Äôt let you come back if that didn‚Äôt work outü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
title: Banned for re-joining?

review: I don‚Äôt know if women have this issue too. However, for men, if you pay for an upgrade so you can see who has liked you, you‚Äôll see very little likes come through while the subscription is active. Once it ends, about 12-24 hours later you will be swarmed with likes. I‚Äôm currently sitting at 12 likes and I could pay for an upgrade again because it eats at you not knowing who they are. But, once you upgrade, you‚Äôll see it‚Äôs the same powdery white, large-eyed lady in Every. Single. Profile. Tinder recently updated their community guidelines, but enforcement is another story, while significantly increasing their subscription price. You still see all the same spam profiles, links to OF/Snap/IG, profile pics with their socials photoshopped in and a bunch of verified, but obviously fake, profiles. I really hope somebody makes a massive lawsuit out of this.
title: Do not, under any circumstance, pay for this scam of an app

review:
Previously had used tinder in 2019, found a serious friendship/relationship for a while until she relocated out of the US. 
Here in 2022 I just relocated myself, got a local number‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve taken time to heal myself and was finally ready to start dating seriously again. 

So I recently had downloaded Tinder and created an account. 
I swiped maybe one or two times a week.. 
Less than a month after creating my account has been banned, ‚Äúthe decision is final‚Äù. 

Reached out to them, request the why‚Äôs and what I didn‚Äôt wrong.. they state it appears I successfully deleted my account‚Ä¶ (I‚ÄôM BANNED?) They said there is no account with my email.. I provided them my number associated with the account‚Ä¶ 

Long message shot‚Ä¶. (Thanks for following up, sorry we couldn‚Äôt be of more assistance‚Ä¶This is all the assistance we can provide?) 

ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I‚Äôve been banned on other apps because I shoot quality photos with my camera, and someone reported me for ‚Äúcommercial use‚Äù ‚Äúcopywrite‚Äù every time these other apps have resolved my issue, Tinder.. didn‚Äôt attempt to do a thing. Bumble has better customer service, Elly, and Harley‚Ä¶ on the two am are just riding the clock. 

HERE I COME BUMBLE. üíØ I see other reviews also have had this same issue recently with tinder..  Bye tinder, you‚Äôre becoming obsolete at your own doing. ü§£
title: Banned, no information provided.

review:
This app has been 2 stars and below since they went for the pay to play method. They just delete all of their bad reviews and have their PR make multiple accounts for good reviews. Also, this app spams you with more and more useless notifications in a sad attempt to get you to use it. There is nothing more annoying than being woken up in the middle of the night just to see "you have more swipes come use our subpar app." Stop being money hungry and give an option to turn off your terrible notifications trying to get me to use your app. If it's not a pretty girl talking to me, then I don't want tinder notifying me.

Edit: this has literally became one of the buggiest, worst apps I have ever seen. Continuously adding useless content, constantly logs you out and ask you to reconnect with Facebook then just says "account already given permission" doesn't load things, filled with insane amounts of spam accounts, and ask you leave a review literally every time you use it even if you already have. Don't download this, and definitely do not support the developers.

Edit 2: got banned for telling a girl "you are not in my dating bracket." I've had this for 5 years.

Edit 3: the number of swipes have been reduced dramatically. You only get about 10-15 right swipes now. Still a terrible app.
title: Don't trust the 5-star rating

review: No explanation, no reasoning just entire account banned one day after attempting to open the app. It‚Äôs really disappointing because even after trying to email and understand what happened they told me I violated community guidelines but couldn‚Äôt tell me which ones. I‚Äôve always been respectful and even when guys have called me an ugly wh*re for not agreeing to sleeping with them tinder didn‚Äôt seem to have a problem with any of them. review:
So, why is Tinder not working for me?
I am not sure.
I am a reasonably good looking guy and yet I have not had one date since joining a couple months ago.
I used to think tinder was a place you go just a hook up. That‚Äôs not necessarily what I want out of this experience with Tangier but it‚Äôs been nothing but tumbleweed blowing by. 
The first thing I‚Äôm not satisfied with is that I am a 59-year-old man and most of my respondents have been, frankly, overweight, late 60s, geriatrics.
I am a very active human and that‚Äôs just not the way I roll.
I joined Tinder to meet people. Maybe, for a date that turns into a friendship ‚Äì or maybe a hook up that ends with nothing, or even further still a pleasant day that turns into a lifelong relationship. I am just simply trying to put myself out there.
Instead, I get a constant asking for more money to boost my profile with the same results once I gave into the pressure to do so.
I am still hopeful to make a connection with someone, but if the history of the last several weeks, being on the app is any indication, that‚Äôs slight at best, and I can be optimistic at a fault. Anyway, you asked for review and you just got it. All the best to all the people that seem to have their phone blowing up and hooking up every night. It has just not been my experience , unfortunately.
title: Why tinder isn‚Äôt working for me

review:
Hey everyone, I‚Äôm not much one to write reviews, but gotta say, I‚Äôm pretty disappointed here.  I was a longtime user of about 4 to 5 years that very randomly got banned from the app.  No explanation or justification as to why, and was not given any type of opportunity to address or redeem the issue.  When I inquired, I was given a very broad and boiler plate type of response from Tinder that was clearly copy and paste that completely avoided my inquiry for a potential refund. Yea, refund, as I had just renewed my subscription for a month less than 24 hours from when this happened.

This is how people date nowadays.  Tinder‚Äôs staff is swift to judge and alienate without reasoning, and it effects all profiles you have, or may have in the future, across all ‚ÄúMatch Group‚Äù platforms.  I encourage everyone to use great caution when subscribing.  As I‚Äôm sure you can probably tell.  Yea‚Ä¶. I feel ripped off and judged.

review:

review:
Overall this app works as well as you‚Äôd imagine‚Ä¶ unfortunately bars aren‚Äôt what they once were (so I‚Äôve heard and clubs isn‚Äôt were I‚Äôd find the one)  and the best way to meet someone, even if it‚Äôs not always the right ‚Äúsomeone‚Äù  it‚Äôs online dating. 
I‚Äôve managed to find a handful of relationships  throughout the years of use. But I‚Äôve always noticed a significant drop off that aligns with a lot of evidence which suggest the app suppresses your account attempting to  convince you the issue is you‚Äôre not paying for the subscription, manipulating what once was beautiful, being human introduction .. now.. just resulting into this mess.. a glittering underbelly of modern dating.  I can find hookups easier then I can relationships but I figure that‚Äôs a given considering the app and how it‚Äôs advertised. 
   But the account suppression is ridiculous and how they manipulate the strings of the algorithm to make it less likely for you to find a match, trying to score that overall app time and a potential buyer.

  But genuinely you‚Äôd be better off sparking a conversation with that cute cashier at the sneaker store
Or that stressed waitress that always gets the order right.. atleast then you & them have agency in what happens from there.

review: The app is fine, but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend buying premium in its current state. I get way fewer likes when I have premium, and your likes are certainly not a ‚Äúpriority‚Äù as is claimed. The only reasonable explanation for this would be that the person on the other end is intimidated by or draws negative opinions by seeing a premium user. If this is illogical to you (reader) then it‚Äôs very clear that the algorithm changes whether you have premium or not. You have to buy boosts to get any likes at all as a premium member. Seems counterintuitive and disincentivizes anyone from buying Tinder Premium. The day my premium membership ended, I got 50+ likes (in one day), when I was getting at most 2-3 likes a day with Premium. First, make it so your Premium membership can be hidden from other users. Second, fix the algorithm when a user has premium.

review:

Matches I‚Äôve made are generally short lived, without conversation or engagement with any women I‚Äôve matched with. To me, that reflects the shallow purpose of this app: ‚Äúgetting laid‚Äù. If you‚Äôre intellectual, struggle with emotions, or want something meaningful, avoid Tinder because it‚Äôs not meant for you. Most profiles are fake. I‚Äôd personally destroy this application if I could because I‚Äôve been chronically rejected by almost every match I‚Äôve made and it‚Äôs not my fault. review: I met my last 2 ex girlfriends who I dated long term on tinder, so I‚Äôm a believer in its potential for meeting people. That being said, the filters which used to work (I think?) no longer do. I have minimum age set to 21, I‚Äôm in my mid 20‚Äôs I‚Äôm not trying to talk to a college freshman, yet I see more 18 and 19 year olds than anything. I‚Äôm also not interested in talking to someone who‚Äôs over an hour away. I wish it would allow you to set these filters as ‚Äúdealbreakers‚Äù like some other apps do, as I‚Äôm having to pay attention to the age and distance on the profiles when it should filter them for me and save me the trouble. It also seems that using the app causes my phone to get slow and eventually freeze after a while. I enjoy swiping but I‚Äôd enjoy it a lot more if the filters did what they‚Äôre supposed to
title: Filters don‚Äôt seem to do anything

review:
The app is designed to make you search endlessly. Sure, may be you wouldn‚Äôt care if someone is a little further away than your settings indicate. But how about on the next state? 200 miles away? What about Germany? 1000 miles away? Keep swiping. Prior to this hopefully bug, if you reached the end of your ‚Äústack‚Äù there were no more individuals to present you. 

The entire business is designed to induce choice paralysis and a false sense of endless potential with some nebulous perfect partner that no one meets. Why not take a second look at someone you didn‚Äôt really consider last time? Why not prioritize locals over travelers and those across the country? Why not increase the visibility of men and women alike who put more than 5 characters in their biography? Why not allow an option to only view verified accounts?
title: Endless searching

developerResponse: {'id': 39694142, 'body': "Thank you for your comment. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Tinder. Your feedback is important to us, and we appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts.", 'modified': '2023-10-24T00:21:33Z'}
review:
The app is bursting with fake accounts and scammers. Every day you‚Äôll see repeats of the exact same bios and photos mixed and matched to ‚Äúnew‚Äù accounts just to give you something to swipe through. The verification checkmark is irrelevant, it is easily bypassed. Accounts with clearly watermarked and stolen photos are common. Staff has no incentive to do anything about the fake profiles because they need to show you literally anything to force you to run out of swipes so they can insist you pay for premium. Speaking of: previously free features are now all locked behind paywalls and the prices have more than doubled. When you get past all of that, Matches will ignore what you actually say in messages and just try to get you to add them on other apps where the conversation isn‚Äôt saved, then try to sell you services.

Do not waste your time or your money here, you will be robbed of both.

review: Tinder is not a great option for someone who is looking for love / companionship on a budget.  The prices for being included in the match results are pretty high, and tinder constantly reminds you your results will improve if you subscribe or buy "boosts".  Using the free version will only give you an idea how the Basic system works, throw you a few matches at the start to get you hooked... then matches thereafter are few and far between.  How the match algorithims work?  Trade secret, and tinder of course holds the keys to the vault.  From several years of using both free and subscribed content, I feel on average ill get better results just asking women out in person.  For my money, Id rather use Bumble or even Facebooks new, free dating service, and overall get a better result without spending over $40 per month.  Sorry tinder.

review:
Over the past few years this app has become increasingly more paywall restricted and removed features for free/paid users, while failing to do much of anything about bots and scammers. 

 They‚Äôve added a daily like limit and removed daily super likes for free users, reduced super likes for the pay tiers from 5 per day to 5 per week, and made no significant upgrades to app functionality outside of a few trivial ones like ‚ÄúVibes‚Äù and adding a messaging option to Super Likes for the highest pay tier, which is an absolutely absurd $40/mo. All the while bots, scammers and fake users are as prevalent as ever. 

 So what are they doing with all this money they‚Äôre making from these increasingly expensive pay tiers they‚Äôre adding? They‚Äôre certainly not reinvesting in meaningful upgrades for free or even paid users. Every year or so they‚Äôll add some new ‚Äúfeature‚Äù that no one really asked for and then increase prices and/or lock another free feature behind paywalls shortly thereafter. It‚Äôs getting tiresome and apps like Bumble, Hinge and OkCupid are much more user friendly nowadays, without locking messaging for everyone but paid users and matches. 

 Don‚Äôt waste your time as the app only seems to be getting worse, try one of the aforementioned ones instead.
title: Constantly removing features, too many scammers/bots/fakes

Tinder will do everything and anything to try to get you to pay them money (say you have more likes than you do, create bot accounts to give you likes, etc.). Once you pay them, however, they stop putting up a front and let your account flop around in the seemingly endless sea of bots that is Tinder‚Äôs dating site.

Honestly, it‚Äôs just not worth it. Trust, there are better dating apps out there that aren‚Äôt as slimy and manipulative as Tinder. Use them. I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs a single person alive in this world that feels good about having Tinder. There‚Äôs a reason for that.

title: Annoying

review:
Firstly, the ways in which the app attempts to push you to buy premium are incredibly irritating. From regularly reminding you to use your super likes (free users only get one per day) to withholding matches (they will tell you ‚Äúmatch with ____ when you buy tinder gold‚Äù but will not display that profile in the stack) it creates a poor user experience. 

I could complain about bots, prostitutes, ads, or scams but that‚Äôs all common knowledge with this app. 

They will regularly insert advertisements into you matches without prior warning. I have even gotten ‚Äúnew match‚Äù notifications only to find that my ‚Äúnew match‚Äù is an ad for something I do not care about in the slightest. I have no issue with ads being placed in the stack but I do not want to be told I have a match and get all excited only to find ‚Äúsmile direct club‚Äù.

The final issue with this app isn‚Äôt even with the app itself. The culture it has allowed to exist in the app is one of ‚Äúgaining a small ego boost‚Äù from a match rather than actually meeting up. I have met up with people from bumble and other apps before but it seems like most people on tinder have little interest in using this dating app for dating. 

Two stars because it‚Äôs a good concept but since Facebook bought them the app has been awful.

Enjoy your youth.‚Äù It gave me an option to correct this with an ID, but just turning 18, I do not have a valid ID of my own just yet, (I am in the process of getting one, though). To see if I could use something else, like my birth certificate or SSN, I contacted them to attempt to correct this wrong; instead, I got an email stating that I was banned for violating the terms of service. How can I be banned without even having accessed the app? I haven‚Äôt even gotten through the entire sign-up process and apparently, I am banned. Congratulations, Tinder, on making a great impression. I am more than happy to follow up with a well deserved 1-Star rating.

review:
I've been subscribing to Tinder for a few years. In the past month, there have been at least two occasions when I stopped hearing back from someone, even though they seemed really into me before that. For the most recent one, I waited then sent them a message asking if they'd sent me anything after a certain time, and leaving them my phone number. They texted me showing me screen shots of the volumes they'd written that I'd never received. I'm glad I persisted with this last one.

But it makes me wonder: How many other people that I assumed ghosted me actually wrote back in the past few years? Is this intentional? After all, if their attractive customers get coupled off, there will be less interest in the platform. I'm leaving Tinder for good. I recommend that you do too, unless you're looking for something casual.

review:
Surely this review won‚Äôt matter that much but if there‚Äôs a data analyst out there I hope they pull what I say and do research on it. (23M southwest region black, this applies for only men) 
I lived in a small town of like 200,000 people for 2 years and during my tenure there I would get likes and matches consistently, I believe I had over 300 matches and like 26 leftover likes at the end of it. I had even met my girlfriend at the time. 
I‚Äôve now moved to a metropolis with over 3 million people and after a year and a half I‚Äôve received 14 matches and 1 like. 
During this time I‚Äôve noticed that Tinder added a 3 tier system and have tripled the prices on all of them. What used to cost a month is now worth a week.
I‚Äôm off and on about paying, especially with the prices they have now, but paying or not had never stopped me from getting matches. Now I feel like the algorithm has changed to only show paying males in the lineup. Because statistically going up in population shouldn‚Äôt inversely drop my match percentage. Even including saturation and increased competition, a 95% drop in performance with 10x more opportunities is insane. 

All this to say bring back the old Tinder, Match Group. There‚Äôs no way you‚Äôre making more money from this strategy.
title: Algorithm and tiers change ruined the app

review: So not only is this app pandering towards the ‚ÄúPretty‚Äù it‚Äôs also a scam. I recently tried to put my Snapchat and insta in my bio only to be met with an email stating that my bio was hidden from public view because it violated community guidelines. I thought nothing of it until I swiped past 10+ women who all had their social media handles in their bios. All of which were recently active. Keep in mind, when I got my bio taken down and hidden, it didn‚Äôt happen 10 minutes after the fact, not even 5 minutes. It was instantaneous. Furthermore, they charge a ridiculous price just to see who swiped right on you. And should you pay the subscription, you‚Äôre often met with 2 options. a Scammer or an onlyfans model who only cares about promoting her content. Both of which don‚Äôt want you, just your money. This app is a complete Scam and I would NEVER recommend it to a friend.
title: Scam

review:
I‚Äôm not exaggerating, if you pay for this app, you are not guaranteed even what tinder promises. The feature to see who‚Äôs swiped yes on you doesn‚Äôt work, I know this because often I‚Äôll have no ‚Äúlikes‚Äù shown, but when I swipe, I‚Äôll match with people right when I swipe yes on them. This means they had liked me already and didn‚Äôt show up in the likes page. I understand having bugs, but considering Tinder‚Äôs other practices, I‚Äôm not willing to give the benefit of the doubt. Considering this is arguably the only useful feature on tinder, the fact that it doesn‚Äôt work is unforgivable. 
Tinder does not care about you and will not hesitate to use shady tactics, manipulation, and predatory behavior to separate you from your money. Sure you might meet somebody, but you‚Äôre equally likely to both be scammed, and also end up in a depressive state because of the unhealthy environment.
title: Literal scam

review: Now, I don‚Äôt usually write reviews, but this deserved it. I was a paying member of tinder, and used the app of and on. One day, out of the blue, I was banned from my account. I contacted customer support which was a huge waste of time. Sean did little to help me with his insightful copy and pasted messages. I continuously asked for an actual answer to my messages, to no avail. Eventually I made another support ticket, explaining how Sean was a terrible representative of the company and my situation again, but no one replied. It‚Äôs been days now. title: Terrible Customer Service

review:
I recently had an incredibly disheartening experience with Tinder as they unjustly banned my account without providing any valid reason. This action has left me feeling frustrated and disappointed with their service.

Not only did Tinder fail to offer any explanation for the ban, but their customer support was unresponsive and unhelpful. It's truly disheartening to see a platform that claims to promote connections and relationships treat their users with such disregard.

Furthermore, the lack of transparency regarding their policies and account suspension procedures is deeply concerning. As a user, I expected a fair and accountable approach from Tinder, but unfortunately, that was not the case.

This incident has made me question the integrity of Tinder as a dating platform. It is essential for users to feel secure and supported, and Tinder's actions have eroded that trust. I would caution anyone considering using this app to be aware of the potential for arbitrary account bans without any explanation.

Overall, my experience with Tinder has been extremely disappointing, as they banned my account without justification and provided no assistance or transparency. I hope Tinder takes steps to improve their policies and customer support to prevent others from facing a similar ordeal.
title: Frustrating Experience with Tinder's Unjust Account Ban

review: I decided that I had a better chance if I swiped no on every single profile, for the purposes of reading everybody‚Äôs bio to see if any girl posted her Instagram or Snapchat. Lord knows I would never get swiped right on, but being able to DM a girl on Instagram, would actually get me some responses most of the time. That‚Äôs right, tinder is useless to me unless I use it to simply find the Instagram of a girl to DM rather than using tinder itself. So the point is, I literally never swiped right on a single girl, I never sent a message to a single girl,never matched with a single girl, meaning I didn‚Äôt do a single thing that could‚Äôve resulted in me getting banned. And yet, I got banned. Banned even though I didn‚Äôt send anybody a single message. How can you break the terms of service if you don‚Äôt even send anyone a message? What a joke of an app, I use Bumble now.
title: Banned without sending a single message

review: Tinder is the most bare minimum dating app but the one that‚Äôs used by a majority of people. As a male using the app, your profile will be nearly invisible to others unless you pay for a boost. The super like used to be free and now you have to pay. When you do pay you don‚Äôt get at least one a day. You get 5 and have to wait 5 days for them to refill. Now that the super like is pay only they don‚Äôt work. If you super like someone they are turned off by the idea that you are paying for the app. It‚Äôs become an absolute garbage application for what it‚Äôs intended for and it‚Äôs eating its self alive. I hate tinder with a passion for these reasons.

review: This game is really fun and the idea of judging people off of their looks as a game is a really cool concept/idea. I think it is executed pretty well and is fun to play but this needs more patch updates and needs to be cheaper, it is a little bit pay to win. So currently women that just post body pics in their underwear out perform other types of pictures so the meta isnt very balanced, underwear pics are currently too strong so that needs an update. Then to unlock new love interests you have to pay and the price is insanely steep, so if you want to increase the amount of possible matches you need to fork over the cash. I wish they would get rid of the in game purchases. But anyways its a pretty fun game
title: One of my favorite games on the app store right behind Robinhood

review:
Tinder seems to be a necessary evil in today‚Äôs dating culture, but the app is plagued with problems.

Swipe limit:
The daily swipe limit was recently massively reduced, making the app borderline unusable without paying for a subscription.

You missed a match:
If I didn‚Äôt swipe right on a user, it obviously wasn‚Äôt a match. This is a stupid and irritating notification.

Popular user:
This notification pops up on half of the profiles you swipe, prompting you to use a super like to get noticed by someone tinder deems out of your league. It is annoying, and feels like a slap in the face every time it pops up.

Distance feature doesn‚Äôt work:
There is a distance slider to supposedly adjust the geographical zone of profiles you are shown. In addition, there is a switch marked ‚Äúshow only people in this range.‚Äù With this switch turned on and my range set to 25 miles, more than half of the profiles I see are still thousands of miles away. I live in Los Angeles and know there is no shortage of people nearby. What is the point of having this feature if it does absolutely nothing?

Other bugs:
For an app as popular as Tinder, there is no excuse for the plethora of bugs that plague the app.

~ Conclusion ~
You have the budget to fix this app - use it.
title: Abysmal - please fix

review: Apparently the new version of the app no longer adheres to your age, gender, or location preferences, and just shows you every profile of every user that uses the app. If I wanted to be shown people 300 miles away and 10 years older or younger than me, I would have set my preferences to that. This just defeats the purpose of even having those settings to begin with?? When I reached out for help, I got a copy-pasted version of their support page with a representative's name attached, and when I replied and asked for further assistance, they told me "that is all the support we're able to provide at this time." I've always preferred this app to other dating apps, but I'm honestly considering switching to using another app which will actually respect what I'm looking for.
title: Don't bother setting age/location/gender preferences ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

The app used to be decent, and at one point i was paying gold customer for a couple of years, however, since i stopped my subscription and returned to the free version, in realized this was nothing but a scam. They tell u you have likes, but then even if you swipe right on everyone you still get no matches... meaning its just a scam to get you to pay for an upgrade.

Not sure what happened to the app, but it feels the developers have decided to just milk as much as possible from their customers without bothering to give a proper product.

review:
If you had asked me how I had thought about Passport, months ago, I would have said I understood why it existed. Small towns, international relationships, it all made sense. But to someone like me, who is only interested in something local, something I can touch with being on a plane for five hours. My point is, Passport doesn‚Äôt need to leave, but as a consumer, I should have the option to turn off showing up in Passport user feeds and turn off passport users in my own feed. 

Not necessarily a scam, just takes not being an idiot. Their current move to Platinum, isnt surprising, considering their parent company is Match‚Äôs. At some point, Tinder will just be -30 Match, and Match will be 30+ Tinder. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

But seriously guys, turn off passport, or at least people the option to.

review: Sooo, this app has been getting progressively more and more greedy as time has gone on, but today I just got my first match that was sponsored, with a little disclaimer by tinder themselves. They already just STOP matching you with people if you don‚Äôt pay for spotlights and superlikes, but now they‚Äôre throwing in fake people, shamelessly and the first message they send you is an ad. review:
It now only functions for people who pay to promote their instagram. If you plan on meeting someone for a relationship, don‚Äôt bother. If you want to play the game of swiping on the toilet with no intention to meet anyone, it‚Äôs the app for you. 

Here are the reasons it‚Äôs now a failure:
1. I have set my distance to 20 miles. Without fail, it shows me profiles that are thousands of miles away, or people who live in a far away country that magically show a distance of 6 miles away. All of those profiles you will magically match with, if you swipe right. Why? Because they have all paid to have their profile promoted to more people. Most likely so they can list their instagram and get more followers. 
2. I have set my profile to show me only profiles that associate as ‚ÄúMen‚Äù. Profiles of women show up frequently regardless.
3. Profiles I have swiped Left to more often than not, show up 3-5 more times. No idea why, they swiped right? They pay? Doesn‚Äôt matter, I shouldn‚Äôt have to say no more than once. 
4. bombarding with worthless push notifications. I.E. when I‚Äôve just closed the app after swiping and it sends me ‚Äúyou just missed a match‚Äù HUH? 

Don‚Äôt waste your time on this  worthless app that destroyed itself.
title: This app is officially useless

review:
Looking to sell or buy drugs is ok on this app, looking for friends that have similar hobbies will get you banned without explanation. 

Tinder is a company that prides itself on its pseudo-guidelines. Be advised that Tinder does not care if a report is false they will ban you without providing explanation except an ambiguous ‚Äúcommunity guideline violation‚Äù. They are the epitome of the Web 2.0 company who provides near zero technical and or customer support and does so through automated means. 

They don‚Äôt care if you‚Äôre a paying member, you will receive the same level of disrespect.

Ban accounts asking for illicit drugs: ‚ùå
Ban accounts selling illicit drugs: ‚ùå
Legally peruse services scraping user data for their own sites: ‚ùå
Ban an account with no guideline violations: ‚úÖ 

This should all be evident as Tinder executives have received lawsuits for sexist, racist and other harassing comments to female employees, as such the same mentality carries into the app process.

I am also near certain that notifications are fluffed until you pay then suddenly all those ‚Äúunknown‚Äù matches disappear. It‚Äôs a company with dark patterns who has capitalized on providing no support for their product, enabling federal crimes and has done near zero to ascertain the safety of its user base when meeting with strangers.

‚ÄúYour account has been banned for violations of our Terms of Use or Community Guideline‚Äù.

I wear glasses and during sun weather they become darker, descriptions to the picture didn‚Äôt say that I need to remove them (maybe I didn‚Äôt notice that, sorry). I took two pictures and my account got banned.

I wrote multiple email to support asking real person verify my account and they like robots repeated the same phrases: 

‚ÄúYour account has been banned for violations of our Terms of Use or Community Guideline‚Äù.

I would not be so disappointed we have a lot of dating apps but I had dates scheduled and now those people are gone.

review:

review:
Unfortunately this is one of the very few commonly-used apps by people my age for meeting new friends or dating. I hate how much trying to meet people is treated like a ‚Äúgame‚Äù. I understand that‚Äôs part of the appeal, but we‚Äôre also dealing with real people, real lives and real mental health concerns related to this app. Paying $16 a month for a service, you should be able to reasonably expect better functionality.

My main complaints are really these two things:

1.) the app is EXTREMELY bloated/slow/unresponsive. The layout is fine, but everything is extremely laggy and feels unrefined. Especially in the current version at the time of this review.

2.) why is it that someone can unmatch with you and completely disappear from your chats with no way to report them? Is it for their safety? What about mine? What about when someone gets catfished or gets assaulted or another bad experience happens with a user, but they have no way to warn other users? This is a huge concern to me, and I have personally had experiences that made me doubt that Tinder actually cares about the safety of their users ‚Äî despite the marketing gimmicks built-in to the app.

Please fix this laggy mess that is the current version and rethink your unmatch workflow.
title: Why am I paying you if it never works

review:
I‚Äôm subscribed to Platinum and have been for a couple years now. Over the course of using this app, things just appear to be consistently going downhill. 

I find myself swiping on the same profiles constantly. I do know that users can remake their account (which shouldn‚Äôt even be allowed, due to it would waste any Super Likes used on that profile) but the profiles don‚Äôt appear to have been remakes, maybe a bug. This has been an issue for quite some time now. 

There are tons of fake profiles on this app. This even goes for some of the ‚Äúverified‚Äù accounts. Once you verify the account, it seem they can delete the pictures and add other pictures and the account seems to stay verified. (Noted from seeing a profile with women pictures up front and a man‚Äôs pictures in the back.)

Next we have the annoying pop ups. Along with the app telling you who you should Super Like, there‚Äôs now an annoying pop up telling you to invite friends for them to play your matchmaker. No matter how many times you close it out, it comes back again only after swiping a few more profiles. 

At this rate, I‚Äôll most likely be canceling my subscription once it ends and not renewing.

review:

I am concerned about the potential charges on my credit card as well. After reading reviews, it appears that this is a recurring problem that should perhaps be investigated by the Apple App Store.

review:
‚Äú We do not tolerate violent, graphic, or gory content on Tinder, or any actions or content that advocate for or threaten violence of any sort, including threatening or promoting terrorism. Physical assault, coercion, and any acts of violence are strictly prohibited.
Content that advocates for or glorifies suicide or self-harm is also not allowed. In these situations, we may take a number of steps to assist the user, including reaching out with crisis resources.‚Äù

review: I have had tinder for years and never used it any differently in those 5 years. Today, I was banned. On the other hand, they do not offer any form of communication or appeal process. That‚Äôs fairly contradicting. Customer service was extremely poor. Communication is extremely poor.

review: I match with someone, I sent them a message, the next time I look it appears that they have unmatched us. The Very next day I look on this app and a person that I thought unmatched us are still matched but their profile appears at the top like I‚Äôve never ever sent them a message before and they were brand new match. I think it‚Äôs partially the people using the app. No one wants (or at least the men who have matched with me,  which since I started using it in 2018) anything more than a casual hookup. You are lucky to go on a ‚Äúdate‚Äù. It‚Äôs pretty much standard across the board on any ‚Äúdating app‚Äù. 

I got sexually assaulted by a guy off this app and literally tinder couldn‚Äôt do anything about it. Men put their penis as their profile pic. There‚Äôs screenshots of sexual acts people want to have happen like pegging. Men will even blur out their faces and not post what they look like.

Dating apps are hookup apps. SMH. I‚Äôd love the culture around dating apps to change. But at this point any dating app you get on just want casual stuff.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no profit in a cure‚Äù, right.

review:

Their exact reply, copied and pasted directly from the email: ‚ÄúThanks for following up. Your account has been banned for violations of our Terms of Use or Community Guidelines, which we take very seriously. This decision is final, and so we may not respond to additional requests about this case. Regards, Christopher.‚Äù

review:
Was a fan of the service, but something‚Äôs gotta be very rotten to allow your app to get this bad.

- Chat is barely usable, text boxes often overlap or are missized, keyboard can appear over input so you can‚Äôt see what you‚Äôve typed, and it locks! up! constantly! Are u doing network stuff on the main thread? Please don‚Äôt!
- I have 13 badged notifications by default, no clue how to clear them. When I get a message it goes to 1, then back to 13. Maybe deleting and reinstalling would fix this, but I don‚Äôt want to go through your insufferable onboarding again. I know how to swipe - please store this fact on your user model, not locally.
- Matches from years ago are suddenly reappearing at the top of my list. ???
- I‚Äôm constantly shown profiles that are > 1000 miles away, despite my preferences saying like 15 miles max. I get that you‚Äôre trying to hype Passport - is it ethical to destroy my experience to achieve that?

These are just my most major gripes. If you‚Äôre a developer at Tinder dot com, please show this to your product and marketing folks: SHAME ON YOU! Allow your developers to fix bugs before cramming in more nonsense.

Thanks for allowing me to vent, I hope the forces of late stage capitalism allow you to fix your app.

title: livid

review:
Save yourself the time and use hinge or any other app. Tinder just hit the Final nail in their own coffin. 

Plain and simple. They removed the ability to look at a persons profile. The entirety of filling out your bio in profile is now no longer available to be seen by other people. I‚Äôm sure they have put it behind the pay wall, as usual for this terrible company. 

The fact that you have to pay for literally everything on this app that many others do for free is not only the worst customer practice ever, but now you can‚Äôt even look at an actual profile to see either what a person is looking for, information about them to see if he will actually connect or match with them, or if they are actually looking for anything or just friends, or even if they are a man or a woman.

I can understand hiding some of the other features like increased matching or search boosting, or even the ability to have additional swipes or likes behind a pay wall, but hiding the bio and information from people is the scariest thing possible. They are promoting cat fishing or ghosting or even lying about gender and hiding interests and even political views.
title: A terrible app experience somehow made worse.

review: This app is by far one of the most popular of any I‚Äôve had. The price isn‚Äôt as bad as the others, but yet I see more spam accounts and idle accounts that aren‚Äôt being used. Those aren‚Äôt deleted or banned while accounts that don‚Äôt even do anything wrong get banned PERMANENTLY!! The message received when banned gives no reason as to why your banned. There is no daily, weekly or even monthly ban. It is an instant permanent ban for any minor infraction. At least implement a new system to where there is a ban for a week for the first infringement, month for the second infringement, then a permanent ban for the third infringement. The permanent ban for anything wrong (some cases banned for no reason) is to much, yes some are well deserved but others are not a warning system should be in place before a permanent ban!

title: Ban?

I‚Äôve hooked up with a few people off here this year but only by paying their ridiculously overpriced fee and swiping for hours to find actual women. review:
I had the Tinder premium account 6 months paid subscription. After one month of using tinder and making about 12 connections I was banned. No reason why just that I violated their policy.  Nothing customized to me or for me and no way to ask any questions or speak to anyone about the termination.   
I know I didn‚Äôt violate any policy they had In place. I was very respectful to everyone I messaged. Never a vulgar or obscene word. All photos were of me and clean. 
Very frustrating to say the least that I don‚Äôt have a way to discuss this with anyone and they kept my full six month payment.  
Tinder has too many fake profiles and their business practices are borderline fraudulent to me.  I will not use Match group (Tinder and several others are owned by Match group) ever again.  I‚Äôll be using Bumble!
title: Shady business practices

review:
One complaint and one negative trend I have noticed. First, I am fortunate to travel a lot. However, Tinder makes it very difficult to know in what city a lady lives who I matched with and asking where someone lives comes across creepy but it‚Äôs the only way to avoid miscommunication and wasting a lot of time with someone in a city I was just at but will not return to for months. Please create a Location filter so I can at least tell which city someone I matched with lives. 

Second it seems like more and more women are using Tinder as a marketing tool to promote her IG page which promotes her OnlyFans site or Telegram channel. So there are fewer women truly trying to meet someone to date. Both of these things are making my time on Tinder more and more wasteful.
title: Please create filters by location and distance for matches

review:
I have reported at the very least 20 different profiles this week alone. All of them using the same girl for the photos, and the worst part is most of them are verified! It's not hard to distinguish these profiles as most of them have blatantly fake snap or insta usernames on their bio, Tinder is obviously making no effort to combat this. 
It would be nice if they implemented a reward system for reporting fake profiles, or at least a notification that shows accounts that you've reported were taken down?  Without this, you are left with absolutely no reason or incentive to report these numerous fake accounts.

Also... "likes" or "right swipes" only last 24hrs now?  It's already hard enough to get a match for some people, now Tinder has cut those odds in half?  Garbage app.
title: FLOODED WITH FAKE ACCOUNTS, don't waste your money.

review:
To be honest I don‚Äôt use this as a dating app, in fact I posit that it wasn‚Äôt intended to function as a dating app by its own developers. 

It was designed to give its users an ego boost, and honestly that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm here for as are most other users. That dopamine rush from getting a like or a match, and the social and ego implication of having so many individuals virtually acknowledge that they find you attractive, in the of the tinder value proposition, is like crack. 

It‚Äôs like the feeling you got the first time you posted an Instagram photo and got a bunch of likes and kept wanting to chase that validation. 

Look up how many matches actually turn into successful dates and you‚Äôll get your answer. One of the greatest data collection and social narcissistic apps I have ever used! My ads are even more personalized now I love it! Must get this app, one of the most impactful inventions of this generation. 5 stars as far as apps go if I can say so myself.

review:
The problem with Tinder is that as a man, matches are few and far between. You can Google the latest ratios but it‚Äôs something like a 75% of Tinder users are men so most men aren‚Äôt even going to get views on their profile, much less a ‚Äúlike‚Äù on it. Because most men don‚Äôt get matches, the app does a great job of presenting profiles of attractive women (some real, some fake) to keep you engaged in swiping. Especially with a paid subscription providing unlimited swipes, the motions are similar to a Las Vegas slot machine except the only thing you‚Äôre spending is time. You can swipe for hours on end.

Bottom line: this dating app encourages behaviors that mimic serious gambling addictions and it does it by dangling the possibility of romantic connection.  Paid subscriptions will not help your chances of success.
title: This is just gambling

review:
I signed up for a month of tinder plus just to see what happens. By the middle of the month, it was like no one was seeing my profile, so I decided not to extend. Within 24 hours of the expiration, 30+ people liked me.

I kept using the platform for a few days without re-subscribing because the platform eventually shows you people that did like you. The number just kept growing, so I figured let‚Äôs see what‚Äôs up. Here are the results:

About 25% were outside my distance range and wouldn‚Äôt have been shown my profile otherwise (I actually went and double checked my setting to make sure I didn‚Äôt do something to be getting these results)

Over half of the rest were profiles I had seen and did not match with intentionally. While tinderplus is activated these automatically get removed from your ‚Äúlikes‚Äù but when it‚Äôs off they remain in your likes to give the appearance you are getting interest beyond the profiles you‚Äôve seen. 

Ultimately, the program operates differently based on whether you are paying or not, but theres no actual benefit to paying, just deceptive practices to make you think there is‚Ä¶

review:
Tinder has become an complete shadow of it‚Äôs former self. Once the go-to app for hook ups and dates, Tinder has slowly turned into an extraordinarily buggy and greedy money pit.
For the longest time, it didn‚Äôt allow me to update my bio and no matter how many times I tried to re-install the app it never got fixed. I messaged customer service twice, only to never get a response.
Anything remotely useful in the app requires you to pay. 
And you want to hear the best part? Tinder will delete your account, without warning, and without telling you why, and you can never recover it or create a new one. 
This has happened to me and many other people. 
I understand taking policies seriously but this is tremendously absurd. I will swear on my entire family that I have never, in my time of using tinder, have said anything disrespectful to anyone in conversation or in my bio, I‚Äôve avoided all political topics, and I‚Äôve never promoted hatred of any kind. You can imagine my displeasure upon learning that I‚Äôve received a lifetime ban for something I will never know.
Stay away from Tinder, this app will cause you nothing but frustration and disappointment.

title: Poor Customer Service and Inconsistent Terms

review:
I have been on Tinderfor about two years. 
I have probably swiped right on 1000 women and have ‚Äúmatched‚Äù with about 150.

At least half of these were not at all like their profiles: either their pictures were 10 years old or their ‚Äúeasy going, no drama‚Äù self description was not who they were. 

Of the 75 remaining prospects, I was able to have some sort of dialogue, but many of them wantedto be only penpals, or they refused to do a Tinder video chat to confirm that their photos were recent, and there was some level of chemistry.

That left about 15 that I have at least had a video chat with, and perhaps 10 that I have met physically resulting in five quite fun, physical friendshipsüî•.
So for me, it is definitely a huge numbers game that requires lots of patience and persistence.

review:
It has been scientifically proven that dating apps are quite harmful, but that is generally the case with any ‚Äúfree‚Äù app, so I will focus on the issues I have with the app design and not the content or the micro transactions.

First up, the UX could be a bit better. The swiping is part of things, but it is so confusing when looking at images to need to tap them. Many apps allow you to look through images by swiping, so it is a bit frustrating that image browsing doesn‚Äôt use standard controls.

Second, it is a lot of work to really view profiles. You need to tap a button to enter this mode and I really feel that this should be a setting.

Beyond the UX, I do not like how this app encourages ghosting. To be fair, Bumble and others do it too, but this is something that needs to be addressed. Simply allowing people to send a goodbye message would help so much‚Ä¶

Finally, I was a bit disappointed that after making a purchase any offers to upgrade did not apply to the current month and required the purchase of a full month.

Despite that, I‚Äôve swiped through thousands of profiles and have neither matched with nor swiped left against any of these 52. And finally, Tinder Gold is LAUGHABLY overpriced. I genuinely thought it was a mistake when I saw the most recent prices. It‚Äôs almost offensive to me that the app thinks that that service is worth $30 for *one month*.

review:
Tinder is simply terrible. 
Men, i implore you to go meet a woman in real life, give her a compliment and go about your day you will feel so much better
Besides the constant bugs, getting banned for discussing consensual sex acts with willing adults, the matching pool being filled who live in brazil or thailand even though im in texas, the many who are on there for social media promotion. its not like I dont get matches with beautiful girls, or the matches dont lead to dates, but the app will simply chip at your self esteem, day by day. 
Tinder is absolutely demoralizing and contributes to the lack of substance in todays dating. I hate that other young people have this and other apps as their only resort of meeting people through the pandemic. 
Also being a queer black male who doesnt drink, you cant be open with ur identity here. when my profile included these facts about myself I immediately saw my matches go down and people even messaging me some pretty awful things. 
All in all these apps are a curse.

review:
Tinder uses the same tactics that they use in any gambling scheme. Anything to give you that little extra edge you have to pay for. And a hefty payout too. Just when your edge goes away. You feel the need to pay more, it‚Äôs a never ending expense if you‚Äôre not careful. 

One of the biggest caveats is, you have to pay for the privilege of messaging people.  Most paid dating sites include that, and it doesn‚Äôt run out. 

 Oh. Let‚Äôs not forget most people use the site as just another social media app. For the likes and attention. It‚Äôs a constant struggle to find anyone credible enough to be able to talk to them on a personal level. It‚Äôs an option for singles, but definitely not the only one.
title: Predatory tactics
