Second, I was randomly banned from the service after not using it for a few days. The worst part? I didn‚Äôt even get a reason. My best guess is that I shared my Snapchat with somebody in a DM and Tinder didn‚Äôt like that. I could reach out to support and appeal, but maybe it‚Äôs for the better. 

Overall, I‚Äôd recommend that you give other dating apps a shot as well. Tinder might be the place where you meet the right person, but I‚Äôve decided to look elsewhere. Patience is the key to finding love, and you need to have a lot of it to use these type of apps.

review:
Tinder will warn you that having your occupation in your bio is breaking terms of service. I just always have my job in my bio on EVERYTHING. 
Then I get another message warning saying that I am harassing people‚Ä¶ But who was I harassing? I was shocked to get this message from tinder, but thought nothing of it. They didn‚Äôt even tell me who or how. 
Today, I try to open the app and it says I‚Äôm banned!! BUT WHY?! No reason whatsoever. 
I even bought tinder gold less than a week ago‚Ä¶ DO NOT waste your money on this app, they will ban you after paying them. FOR NO REASON.
title: Banned for no reason.

review: I had Tinder on my phone for years without issue. I enjoyed using it and even decided to subscribe to one of the premium tiers of membership without any issues. Then suddenly one day I woke up to find that my account had been banned. There is no real appeal process and the ban is final. They do not provide any explanation as to why I was banned but I know I have never violated any of the terms of service, have never posted any lewd picture or messaged anything inappropriate. And once you're banned there is no way around it. This is immensely frustrating and really closes me off from a potential dating pool. This app is run really irresponsibly without any recognition of the significance of banning someone without any due process.
title: Inexplicable ban

review: When you sign up for the app you won‚Äôt get any like‚Äôs until while your paying for the monthly service, maybe 4 likes a month. Nope, after paying for another month and looking through the matches I see that they are not real and won‚Äôt text a single word when you try to communicate.  The only ones that respond are complete scammers through and through.  They really do think we are that dumb to not notice who they are.  Tread carefully people, this app is 93% a waste of time and money.

review:
If you‚Äôre a guy, just honestly, don‚Äôt use this app at all. I have put way too much money, time and emotion into this app for nothing to have happened in 6+ months of using it. I get their snap, they never respond because they find someone else, someone ‚Äúbetter‚Äù. All you‚Äôre left with is a feeling of ‚ÄúWhat is wrong with me? What am I doing wrong?‚Äù 

It‚Äôs not you man, it‚Äôs the culture inside of this app and the natural bias. Men compete for women, that‚Äôs how it is, and men outnumber women on this app tenfold. Build confidence and go ask real girls out, like I will attempt to do from here on out. Goodbye, tinder!

I really hate that you can‚Äôt meet people as easily in person nowadays, which has made dating apps basically a necessity if you want to go out with people, but if you‚Äôre on the fence about which apps to use, skip tinder entirely.

I‚Äôve tested this out with getting burn numbers and using the same pictures and profiles and on my burner account I‚Äôve gotten 99+ but on my old account only around 5 in a weeks time. I‚Äôm considering opening a civil lawsuit against tinder for this, they steal your money and shadow ban and don‚Äôt have a way to fix it unless you wait 3 months. When talking to support you get the same copy and past message and this app really isn‚Äôt worth the time. Bumble has been a much better choice for the longest time.
title: Shadow ban

review:
When I paid for Tinder Plus for the year long subscription, it came with a variety of benefits that at the time were very desirable and made me, the customer, feel satisfied with my purchase.

However, it has been approximately three moths since my year long subscription purchase, and the subscription benefits have been ‚Äúpromoted‚Äù to a higher tier payment plan and thus canceled on my account.

I would not feel bad about this if I was subscribing to Tinder Plus now.  However, I already paid for Tinder Plus on the pretense that the benefits it had promised would be available.

If my Tinder Plus Subscription benefits changed after my year long subscription I would not feel bad, and I would not complain.  However, taking away those benefits after purchase and during the subscription period feels like cheating.  It begs the question ‚Äúhow accountable are APP developers to the contracts they promise?‚Äù

The answer is, very little if any.

I am very sorry to have to bring attention to this issue.  However, it does not feel ethical.
title: Buyer Beware: Subscription Benefits Change After Purchase

review:

My settings are only to show people within a certain distance but tinder still shows me profiles of people thousands of miles away.

review:
I've used this app on and off for probably 5 years. Since then, the app has gotten easier to navigate, but worse and worse to use. 

For one, you really can't get anything out of the app unless you AT LEAST have gold, otherwise, if you get a message or a match you can't see it without gold. 

Another common issue I've had more times than I can count is that, I'll get a notification that I have a match, I'll tap the notification, it pulls up the app. When the app finally loads up....no matches, empty screen. 

And the most rampant issue with this app? 

Scammers. Nothing but page, after page, after page, after page of women who want to do nothing but sell you nudes (which is not what I use the app for). 

Does Tinder (or Match Group Inc. , the company that owns every popular dating app ever, INCLUDING tinder) know about this? Yes. 

Are they ever going to do anything about it? No. 

So for any heterosexual (straight) men who plan to use this app, it's a bit like throwing a coin into a wishing well. 

Don't expect anything to happen.

review:
I‚Äôve been on a number of dating sites and had great success on all of them, except Tinder. 

I am 60, but, despite that 80% of the suggested matches are ‚Äúwomen‚Äù 30+ years my junior. Of those, my opinion is almost all we‚Äôre scams looking for money. 

To see if I was right, I ‚Äúliked‚Äù a couple of them. Within minutes, I got responses back for each of them. Clumsily written and lacking any personality, each respondent eventually asked if I had WhatsApp, a clear sign of a scammer. 

Of all the women I ‚Äúliked,‚Äù I received no response. Ever. Not from a single one. But, if I paid Tinder even more then I‚Äôd already paid them, the company suggested I‚Äôd have a better of chance of being ‚Äúnoticed.‚Äù  

In the meantime, I was being ‚Äúnoticed‚Äù at two other sites so often I was spending each night on the phone or at dinner with a real, beautiful, intelligent woman, one of whom I now am dating regularly. 

And she‚Äôs actually my age, something that is important to me!  So, don‚Äôt waste money on Tinder. Try Bumble. By far the best. Hinge is okay. So is OKCupid.  All are better than Tinder.

review:
Boy oh boy do I have a story for this crappy app. 

Tried it out for a few weeks, everything seemed fine for a while, I talked to a few people but only got serious with one. 

After a week of talking we decided to go out and finally meet, everything was fine, until. 

Upon meeting and nearly entering into he restaurant she said she had something to tell me. 
So I listened and she said that she was really a guy who just liked to dress and pretend he was a girl. 
So I left. 
After getting home I open the app only to find that I was banned. 
I got in contact with support after three weeks and they said I was banned for being homophobic. 
I asked them why is it okay for him to pose as a woman if he‚Äôs a man, no answer. 

So this app doesn‚Äôt like people impersonating anyone but they allow it. 

Two weeks later I was at a friends house and he was in there talkin to someone and I glanced over and saw it was the same person and I told him that‚Äôs the freak who got me banned. 
So I told him to stay away from that dude.

review:

review:
Scammy: Tons of scammers unfortunately.  If it seems too good to be true, it is.  Anyone who asks you to go on WhatsApp immediately is probably a scammer.

Filters: App ignores dealbreaker filters entirely. Also, I live in San Diego, I should be able to filter Mexico out. I love my Latinx sisters but I‚Äôm not interested in trying to date someone outside the country.

Not to mention your match rate will drop significantly to almost none after paying. This app is a waste of time. Plenty of better options out there.

review:
Demographic filters for race and height. (See hinge for example)

They‚Äôve redesigned the app so you‚Äôre forced to pay to get results. And even when you do pay. The results are not even worth it.

review:
From guys perspective.

Overall app experience isn‚Äôt too bad.  It‚Äôs a well lit together app, that appears to have cared to collect and provide details of each person.  However, not many provide these details leaving you with pictures only profiles.

But here is the disappointing bit.  It‚Äôs another dating app with; fake profiles, fake distances and fake accounts trying to get you to leave this page to scam you somewhere else.
In my experience this way round, I‚Äôve got multiple interests from many women, and have expressed my as well, only to find out these people do not live in places they say they do.  Worst yet, the minute you connect with someone they immediately tell you they don‚Äôt use this app much and they would like to meet you on Telegram or WhatsApp.

So: if you want to see a bunch or pretty faces, who will waste your time, are not local to you no matter what their profile says???  That‚Äôs Tinder.
title: Disappointingly Fake.

review: I‚Äôve had my account for YEARS and all the sudden it‚Äôs gone. I can still use it but I don‚Äôt get any new matches or my messages won‚Äôt load and nobody can see my account. All because I was reported for not using it for a couple days. There should be a warning or something that says ‚Äúhey be more active people are noticing your inactivity‚Äù or something like that. Now my account that I‚Äôve had for years is deleted without me knowing and I have to make a new one. Probably won‚Äôt do that because if it‚Äôs that easy for an account to be removed then the app is not worth it. I put in a help ticket but I doubt it‚Äôll get fixed.

title: Total Scam: Platinum Membership

review:
3/4 of the people I met had lied about their age by 5+ years in order to get more matches. The other person looked nothing like their pictures. All of these people were ‚Äúverified‚Äù by Tinder. Tinders verification system is strictly cosmetic and means absolutely nothing in the context of a verified match being potentially safer or more trustworthy than an unverified match. AirBnbs verification system requires an image of your ID. Tinder should consider a similar requirement if they truly want to take the safety of their users seriously. 

Someone who is capable of lying about their age and appearance could be capable of other creepy and predatory behaviors. Don‚Äôt trust the people you match with on Tinder, even if they‚Äôre verified.
title: Unsafe. Don‚Äôt trust verified users.

review: There are many people who use this app differently. review:
Hi Tinder, I‚Äôve been an on and off user of Tinder for awhile. I‚Äôm currently a platinum subscriber and I‚Äôve really enjoyed the service you all provide. 

Wanted to make one recommendation 

If you Super Like a bot and have to report it, refund the super like 

As part of the subscription (that I pay for) I get 5 Super Likes/day. There‚Äôs been more than one occasion where I‚Äôve Super Liked a convincing ‚Äúbot‚Äù that I then had to report to Tinder, causing me to (more or less) waste a super like on what could‚Äôve led to a genuine connection elsewhere. While I‚Äôm happy to report bots to contribute to a genuine community on Tinder, I‚Äôd like to ask Tinder to refund the Super Like if it‚Äôs found that the report filed was valid - that the profile in question was found to be illegitimate. 

Overall I‚Äôm happy with the service though. I‚Äôve met lots of great people and had great conversations and interactions

Long story short, I believe this is shadow banning. If your account is shadow banned there is nothing you can do to get the van lifted other than wait or make a new account. When you are shadow-banned, the people you like don‚Äôt even see the likes and any matches will not see any messages you send.

review:
I‚Äôm a single gal, straight, near NYC, who has been on and off dating sites/apps for 35yrs.  A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!

In my 30s - lots of matches, but dwindling as the guys got married off.
In my 40s - a barren field, except for the guys who wanted extramarital fun.
In my 50s - a definite upward trend in numbers, but mostly gun-shy divorced guys not wanting commitment.

Now I‚Äôm in my 60s.  The divorced guys are realizing that they prefer being mated, and they‚Äôre ready to give it a go again.  I get about 3 matches every day, almost every one of them ‚Äôreal‚Äô and all of them respectful.

To all you fellas, at whatever stage of life you‚Äôre in‚Ä¶ Thank you.  I‚Äôve had, and am having, a wonderful time.  I still have every expectation of connecting with my Mr Right.

Oh, BTW, I think Tinder is FAB!!!

review:
If you are trans or nonbinary, this app is not for you. Sadly it likes to pretend that it is by letting you "choose" your gender. Ultimately Tinder makes you choose between being shown with men or women. 

Unfortunately Tinder's algorithm and the people who make it are physically and spiritually incapable of honoring even this for their trans users. A trans man will consantly be shown cis, straight men who are only interested in women.

It is clear that what Tinder wants you to believe it sees you as and what its system actually sees you as are incongruent. I reached out about this issue and was told "try logging out and logging back in". Positively laughable.

review: I honestly used to really love this app. I loved meeting new people from it and everything, but I‚Äôve been banned for no reason 3 different times. I completely understand that banning is an important aspect that the app needs to incorporate‚Ä¶ but why are rude people, harassers, and people who have literal S.A. charges not banned? I‚Äôve matched with so many people who have committed horrible crimes (please look people up before you meet them!!!), and yet I‚Äôm the one getting banned? That makes absolutely no sense at all. If there was a way I could appeal my ban or find out why I‚Äôve been banned, my rating would go up.

review:

I do find that the app is quite glitchy‚Ä¶ I‚Äôll list them here.

1) After using it for more than 2 minutes in one sitting, there will be a major lag and I‚Äôll have to completely shut out of the app.

2) I am unable to use the video Loops feature. Whenever I go to upload a video on my profile the app freezes and just gives me a white screen. 

3) I don‚Äôt always get notified of messages, and when I open the app messages that I have not yet opened are marked as read. This makes it easy to miss messages.

I really hope these bugs will be fixed (especially the video loop one because I have vids I wanna post) so I can get the most out of the app!

review:
I‚Äôve used this app off and on for years, and it has progressively gotten worse as far as what is provided for their users. 

Free users didn‚Äôt used to have limited likes, nor did it feel like they HAD to pay to have their profile seen. Now it seems like you have to pay to even be noticed. 

Paid users used to only have to pay $9.99/mo get a weekly boost, unlimited likes, a handful of super likes, and some good service.  Now, it‚Äôs one boost a month with a subscription, $8 per boost, 1 super like per month, and I can only imagine they‚Äôll continue taking more away.

I'm sick of spending money on a subscription just to find they took away yet another aspect of what made me enjoy having a paid membership. 

Please, just make this more accessible and friendly, rather than getting greedier by the day. I‚Äôm sure you make more than enough without gouging users for every little service.

Don't ways your time with this app, there are plenty of other dating apps where you can actually meet people in your city.

If they introduce a feature where you could block passport users so that it actually respected your match distance settings and only people who want to meet people thousands of miles away had to sort through them, it might become usable again. review:
I‚Äôve used Tinder for a while. It used to be filled with real people and I had some successful relationships. Then I signed up again a couple months ago and it has been awful since. Why?

- More than half the profiles are fake. A lot more. 

- I continuously get notifications for ‚ÄúNew Likes‚Äù and there are 0 new likes. 

- The app continuously ignores my distance settings. Why am I being shown profiles 30, 40, 50 miles away? I don‚Äôt want to see anyone that far away and all I see are MORE FAKE PROFILES. 

- I reached out two months ago asking what is being done about fake profiles. My question was ignored by two separate people responding to me and then the third said, ‚ÄúI need to escalate this.‚Äù It has been radio silence since. 

- Top Picks are NEVER IN MY AREA. Why am I always shown people who are 99 miles away?

Just avoid this service until they fix their issues. I will no longer be giving them any of my money.

review:
There are so many fake accounts. Any use of this app brings serious risk of exposure to data harvesting scams and catfishing. If you manage to avoid that, there is trolling and sexual harassment to navigate. If you get past that, you have the great mass of confused humanity to navigate. 
Tinder is little incentive to combat this: fake accounts, et cetera inflate subscriber numbers, app traffic, and therefore help to underpin the valuation of the company. 
Do yourself a favor. Go somewhere new, irl. Explore you interests, and take them a little further irl. See who you meet there. The social experience will serve you well.

If you just show the bio first, and force us to read who the person was before seeing the person, we might all realize that were talking to people and not just chat bots connected to pictures. Or at least show the bios over the first picture again.
title: MAKE THE BIOS SEEN FIRST

review: I met my wife through tinder. As soon as we matched, she messaged me first and slept over the following day. Since then, it has been an amazing experience. We are extremely blessed to have found one another. 3 years later, we‚Äôre currently married with a baby on the way. Mirella Rose Parker is due April 7th, 2022. Tinder is amazing.
title: 3 Years Later | Marriage and Baby

review:
This app works and is user friendly. So two stars.

There are however too many fake profiles and potentially real females trying to boost their social media and only fans and snapchats. 

The process to report fake profiles is cumbersome and inconvenient, seemingly by design. 

They charge $175 plus various premiums to make it usable. It‚Äôs not worth it. Once you get tinder platinum, you‚Äôre almost guaranteed a match every two days or so. However, it will be a fake profile. 

There are loads of profiles in Asia, which despite my rather extraordinary efforts to limit my swipe range, i match with  more often than local people. 

I live in New York, in high density areas.  Theres no excuse for the amount of misleading activity directed my way especially as a premium paid customer for the service.
title: Too many fake profiles.

review:
Got Platinum subscription.  

First, at least 90% of the profiles are fake - promoting anything from massages, sex work, looking for Instagram followers, Chinese bots fishing for WhatsUp accounts.

No way to limit by geography. If you try to limit to 10-30 miles, 90% of matches are >1,000 miles away in the middle of the Indian Ocean. And that‚Äôs a paid feature. Scam. 

No way to limit by sex, gender and sexual preference. So you pay and then waste your time going through gender / sex preferences that are of no interest to you. 

No way to set height preferences, language preferences, etc.  

Worthless - why pay for it? 

You can like the promoted fake Instagram profiles without paying.

review: I had 50+ likes before buying Tinder Gold. After getting Tinder Gold I all of a sudden stopped getting likes. The distance filter no longer works. I typically set it at about 20 miles to see people within my town and all I see on my feed now are people from the other side of the state.

The effect on my mental health has been huge. It just makes it feel that much more hopeless seeing all these people on the app and once we match they have no interest in talking. 

I have no idea how to fix this app. But I know filtering out the people who have liked my profile and putting them behind a paywall has made this already embarrassing app so much more depressing to use.

Tinder once was easy, build a profile, swipe, talk meet and so on. Now everything‚Äôs a subscription, tiers of importance, packages of super likes, buying your way to the front of the line of importance- and the platform is just massive now with no (actual) repercussions for what occurs on it. Also worth noting scores of people have been arbitrarily banned from the platform for no reason known to them and there‚Äôs no form of appeals. 

It‚Äôs dying. It‚Äôs a cash grab all the way down, and soon other actual apps will overtake Tinder and leave it in the dust.

The last nail in the coffin for me was taking away free super likes. Really like someone? Pay up, or else they won‚Äôt notice you. The notification that someone ‚Äúis a popular user!‚Äù when you swipe right on them with a prompt to buy a super like is despicable.

review:
I‚Äôve spent near 200 dollars on tinder over the past few days
And it was smooth sailing until I realized that people weren‚Äôt always who they said they were. 

As such, I ended up having to delete my account, for fear that someone maybe pretending to be someone they‚Äôre not. 

In my four or five days on tinder, I found that nearly 35-40 percent of all people on tinder were not who they said they were, and not the age they said they were. 

This, as such, ruins the experience for users like myself who were just trying to make a connection. 

I‚Äôm not saying not to use this app. Live your best life. 
I‚Äôm just saying that you should have EXTREME caution if you do choose to use tinder, because it‚Äôs a dangerous place.

review:
This app is designed to help you look for a partner, but it's also designed to keep you looking and not find anything.

They make you pay for any useful feature (something as simple as telling who liked you)
Their algorithm is designed to boost popular accounts which inevitably reduce your chance for connection, meaning you will keep looking and keep paying.

They don't care in the least bit about spam/scam accounts that are just OnlyFans ads or straight up scammers.  They only increase the numbers on their platform and make it look like there are more real people on it.

This company should be ashamed to prey on people that are just trying to connect with others.

review:
I heard a lot about Tinder, but this app does not live up to the hype. Here are the key issues:
1. Too many fake profiles. This clutters the stack and detracts from the experience. 
2. The card layout is slow and tedious. I greatly prefer more efficient layouts such as that used in the MeetMe app. 
3. It is obvious that the system is tailored to waste your time for the sake of a profit. The nonsense of ‚Äúwe‚Äôve run out of potential matches in your area‚Äù is incredibly frustrating and deceitful. High quality profiles have limited access through the ‚Äútop picks‚Äù feature, and you are left perusing virtual Walmart. 
4. I can‚Äôt comprehend why the age/distance filters fail to work properly. Search queries regularly expand beyond desired limits. 

Overall, I do not recommend this app.

Had Tinder been clear and upfront with what their plans cover and do not cover, I would not have subscribed at all as I did not realize I would be faced with deceptive marketing practices. What a scam. 

Update: After reviewing countless similar complaints, I hope the victims of this scam app will take a minute to report it to Apple and to file online complaints with the FTC and Better Business Bureau which have on record several complaints about Tinder.

There is power in numbers and Tinder should be appropriately investigated for its overtly fraudulent business practices.

review:
Overhyped IMHO. 

The app matches people very far apart even if your settings restrict distances.

They nickel and dime you constantly; always up selling and fostering a competitive feeling. ‚ÄúBoost‚Äù is all about putting you in front of more people, which by definition means others get less. Not cool when we‚Äôre all just trying to find companionship. 

For some reason, despite my settings, I still get straight women and straight men in my ‚Äústack‚Äù. 

‚ÄúTop Picks‚Äù should be a default match method, not something you have to pay for or get once every couple of days. 

I do like the profile system but overall thumbs down. I won‚Äôt renew.

review:
Tinder is...interesting to say the least. 3/5 stars for the following:

Pros:
-Easy to learn how to customize profile/verify account
-Sometimes you meet actual people
-Top Picks is a cool feature
-You can use it for free or pay at most $20/month for all features

Cons:
-Sometimes super likes by mistake, no do-overs for it
-Most people unmatch you/likes are rigged
-Some notifications are glitched (i e when it says you got a like but you didnt)
-Unlimited swipes shouldnt be a premium feature (in my opinion)
-There are so many bots and fake accounts that I could work for Tinder and get rid of maybe 2% in my lifetime

Overall:
Its not the greatest dating app, but it still hasnt hit rock bottom in my opinion so I can‚Äôt give it less than 3

title: Terrible app

review: To put it shortly, this app does not help reinforce connections. Even with the common interests and search range, it only ever pulls up girls wanting drugs, a relationship or something else (and not the good kind.) Every match I have made has either never replied or just randomly stopped texting me, even when I verified my profile. Do not get this app as it's not worth your time (or your money if you pay for premium.)
title: Worst dating app
